The ayce is really affordable and still offers original rolls/appetizers. They also will do a half roll so that you can try more things! Get the Japanese nachos, you won't be sorry!!

5fAI1izHcZ_GBpUYK5ZA8Q.text: Sakana is located in a town where food is plenty and where quality can range from excellent to sad.  Sakana serves plenty of excellent Japanese food at a most friendly price.  Their sushi are made with the minimum amount of allowable rice by law a tell nd their is swift service and spot on flavors makes this place a MUST TRY!  The only bad thing that we experienced was the way they told us not to waste food.  They don't care if you can EAT, but just don't waste.  We were also guilty of that....but if you dine with my professional foodie, TOO MUCH is NEVER an issue.    So bring an empty stomach and allow Sakana to fill it up.  Their peach saki was the bomb!  So smooth and refreshing and at the CRAZY price of 2 for 1..... it was a no brainer.  We will be back!!!

e2IiV29wtQM5PGZgiHwOWw.text: I have been to many sushi buffet in Vegas. This is one of the buffet that I will bring more friends here. Great place, great service.

xWt8FfeVFNoWBtR_Oamejg.text: My first time here at this establishment, was really looking forward to a new Sushi spot. I would definitely pay more to go to Sushi Kaya than this place again. Arrived at 6:30 and was seated in no time, even with party of 7, by the time we left, there were at least 20 people waiting, but I tell you, it's worth the wait. Pork belly, bulgogi and the other stuff was great! all the servers were nice and their specialty rolls were generous in size with the fish and the sushi was a generous size to the rice given. all in all it was a great time with good food. id come back... * thumbs up*

7WNvMusSHBaYoWt5y1JVhA.text: The AYCE sushi is $25.95 for dinner and it does not disappoint! But a la cart is just as great as the prices are very reasonable. Most rolls are at least a dollar cheaper than your average sushi spot. Never a wait and cool atmosphere. The server took a while to come back to get our next order of rolls though. This place is a hidden gem!

1Psc74QEB3eXcM9jUnZ_ww.text: Da bomb, great deal and will come back for sure. For all you can eat, the best quality, made fresh per order is what makes it so good!

3qIye4avP9muNhZ_KQap1g.text: I love this place!! I drive 30 minutes to get here. Definitely the best Ayce in town. Great ambiance. I also think this place might be Japanese owned. Open late is an added bonus.

KeKux2INSUngttLdbPyxsg.text: On my last trip to Vegas a week ago (12/2016) I heard about this AYCE sushi place that was to die for. Checking on Yelp, I saw they have over 1400 reviews at 4.5 stars, so that was enough for me to round up a gang of 8 for an early dinner.   We arrived around 3:30ish, missing the lunch cut-off, so each had to pay an extra 5 bucks.  Lunch: $20.95 Dinner: $25.95  The place was half full. The decor was busy and some replica vintage items rest on shelves for an added touch. The ayce menu had many items and can be overwhelming, especially when the server has an impatient look on her face everytime she came by to tke our order. We were handed a sheet to mark our orders, but no explanations were given that even though the paper only lists round 1 & 2, we can actually order more if needed.   A few of us wanted hot water (because it was cold and it's better for digestion) but we were told they don't have hot water, only hot tea @ $1.50 / cup. Really? What do you use to make hot tea if you don't have hot water??   We ordered some sodas, and they brought out the wrong ones, so we had to flag another server down to have that corrected.   The rolls and nigiri we ordered were good, for the most part. (see my photos) The uni was subpar. It was runny, pale in color and had a weird texture, as if it's been dunked in water.   The freshwater eel was the highlight, as it tasted fresh w/ a semi-sweet sauce drizzled over it. We ordered some extra plates of this.   The food selection, flavor and portions (fish to rice ratio) earns them a 4, or even 4.5 for a few in our party, but the whole experience of dining there dropped it down.   Let me explain:  * After our first round was finished, no one ever came by to hand us an additional order sheet, menu or even ask if we needed anything. I had to go up to the cashier and grab it myself ... repeatedly. * The music selection was annoying. K-pop (Korean pop music) was blasting above our heads. This is obviously targeting a certain market, not the majority.  * Though I saw many kids in there, they played music videos with skanky girls in string bikinis shaking their thang. Maybe it's a Vegas thing but not really approriate for kids, no?  * A few of the servers were pleasant, but a couple of them plain looked pissed off whenever we asked for something. Perhaps they should work at DMV, they will fit right in.   Will we come back? No, not again as a big group. Though the food was pretty good, their lack of patience and explanation for first timers didn't sit well with me. In addition, lying to us about not having hot water and forcing us to pay for hot tea (which tasted like colored water) did not set a good impression for management, and also the annoying loud teenie bopper music selection didn't make for a comfortable dining environment, as we had trouble carrying on  conversations.   Food: solid 4+ Ambience/ Service: 2 Avg: 3

ICOdrXAIs-MAKX5laFCPqg.text: Lots of respected yelpers love this spot so I had to try it out. And yes! the hype is True! This place is great, I need to visit one more time to bump it up to 5 stars.  During my first visit I was highly impressed by quality and freshness of the fish. Also loved the appetizers and deserts. Many AYCE spots lack on the desert menu while Sakana offered a few more options. Roll selection is great, from baked, to deep fried, to riceless, to hand rolls. Everything here was delicious. Our waitress was very sweet and helpful. She explained various dishes and was patient while we made our selections. She also checked on us pretty frequently. Our table was never empty! The restaurant was quite busy, we had a little bit of a wait. Typically happens with popular spots. All in all, I really enjoyed my meal here and left super stuffed. Great success!

Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Monkey Brain

MjR1_KCyLXQ21O6i8wrV2g.text: Everything was great from the tuna to the albacore and our favorite was the sashimi tower!

UbW52Ba6xrt4PRDDD5aYHA.text: A massive appetizer menu, the option for half rolls, no rice rolls and uniquely dressed nigiri; this is a sushi gold mine!!! We drove all the way across town for this and it was well worth the drive.   I was a little overwhelmed by the menu and immediately psyched myself into being able to eat a meal fit for at least 3 people. Just order what sounds good to you because it was all so good! However, you must try the Super White Tuna nigiri!!! The fish itself melts in your mouth and gives a nice buttery feel. It is dressed with a creamy sauce that makes you want to just lick the plate. Second runner up is the Smoke Paprika Salmon! Whatever they do to that salmon makes it explode flavor in your mouth.   My favorite roll was the Bam Bam. I really like a refreshing roll and this one hit umami.   There was so much to try at Sakana, and I will definitely be back to try more. Oh, and the fish to rice ratio is insane! You get about twice as much fish to rice for the nigiri and the rolls are the perfect size to pop in your mouth.  They also offer unlimited mochi, honey toast and tiramisu for dessert. You must save room for dessert!

M9mF5e0fx5C6xIQWVi-Tcg.text: Dang.  I mean, (and pardon my French) HOLY CRAP.  How in the heck can they sustain this business model??  The sushi rolls I had were some of the best I've ever had in my life (competing, or even better than my usual joint back in DC), the selection available was huge, and the desserts (usually a weak point) were so good that when I asked for another, they pointed to a line that said "one per customer".  ...A "one per customer" dessert menu at a SUSHI restaurant...  This place is impossible.  And yet, somehow, it's only $25 AYCE.  NOT a buffet, I should add.  Am I being pranked?  Where's the video camera?  Are they going to hit me with a parking charge on my way out the door for $100??  I don't get it.  These kinds of places defy all reason (in a good way!).  So stop reading reviews--just go here and be done with it!  Hurry, before they change their minds.

PazCdbI20yHvc8tqpVB3Hg.text: This was my favorite AYCE sushi place in town. My husband & I would come at least every other month, if not once a month for the past 2 years. My last experience there was horrible & it was for my husband's 30th birthday.   We were sat at a table with rice on it & there was a huge clump of rice under the table. Our waiter was nice, however he was barely present because he seemed to be the only one waiting on the entire restaurant, which several girls that were part of the staff stood by the register laughing & talking the whole time we were there besides seating people when they came in. There was a short Hispanic man that came to put water in our glasses but we stopped him because we had Sprite. We asked him if we could please have 2 more cans of soda & he never brought them. I make AYCE simple because I always put my order on my notes in my cell phone, so they can easily just read it & copy but this is the first time my orders were consistently messed up. Wrong food being brought to our table & at least half of our orders never came.   Everything tasted good, except for the sushi donut & one of the fried rolls we received. The fried roll tasted like straight dirty oil & the sushi donut was difficult to eat because the rice was super soggy & stuck to the plate.   We do not live close to Sakana at all but we never mind making the drive. I'm so disappointed with this last experience that I think we'll just stick to the sushi spots on our side of town.

R_26bLHf5zBnak2kvqX6AQ.text: Amazing AYCE sushi joint! Whenever my friends and I decide to get AYCE sushi, I lower my standards significantly. That's understandable right? because you can't serve unlimited high-quality fish at an affordable price - it just doesn't make sense economically. But FORTUNATELY at this joint, that rule doesn't apply! The sushi here is actually pretty damn good. Yes it isn't as great as what you'd get in an omakase or an izakaya, but for an AYCE, this was hands-down one of the best fish I have been served. Oh and for the very competitive price, you also get access to some super "rare" items such as salmon belly, ocean trout nigiri, uni, and more. For you sushi newbies, these items are considered commodities and usually will cost you quite the penny if bought alone. Go ask how much two pieces of salmon trout nigiri costs at another sushi restaurant! But here it's included in the AYCE! Though understandably these rare items are limited to 1 per person but there are so many to choose from, you'll feel like a fancy schmancy sushi connoisseur at the end of your meal.  Seriously if you're feeling like indulging or stuffing your face in Vegas, skip the $40 buffets on the strip and come here. You'll get much better food and leave much more satisfied. At least that's what we did. Hoorah

ryRFFGaJCgmxj8-UbUruNQ.text: Best AYCE sushi by far!! Great selection of sushi rolls and appetizers. Everything is absolutely delicious! Staff is super friendly and very attentive! Gwen was our server and she was fantastic!   I will definitely come back and highly recommend it to anyone looking for a great AYCE sushi joint with great prices and a wonderful ambiance!

bgtrt_OBRgxk0dj6VYA31w.text: AYCE Sushi! I love this place. I came here right before leaving Vegas. I honestly think this is much more worth it than other buffet options on the strips. All the sushi are made to order. You get so much options. I would recommend getting all of the "limited"(1 per person) menu items because those were amazing. We came when they have a buy one get one free alcohol options as well. I would say pregame here before your clubbing night on the strip! haha!   Sashimi pieces were thick and the rice portion was just right. Rolls were amazing as well. Appetizer options were overwhelming! I was super happy and satisfied. I will definitely come back and definitely recommend others to come here.

0gZmUQeCeUB-GWXEh_00AQ.text: First time here and it was impressive! I love Sushi and I have my favorites, this one topped the list. Rainbow roll was superb. I can tell the perfect amount of rice wine vinegar in the sushi rice.  Although the wait was excessive (an hour), we weren't deterred. It was a good sign that this place is a must try. Lastly, the server apologized that one order came out late (we didn't even noticed) and he just took the liberty to remove an item from our bill. That's above and beyond service.

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States

h67G7LToR0E2V1xE0nA0EA.text: One of the best AYCE Sushi places in Las Vegas.  I was very surprised how tasty their salmon is and how fresh it can be, seeing how Vegas is in the desert.  The variety is amazing, that I probably only got to taste about 1/9 of all the possible dishes they offer.  The reason why I give this a 5 star, which is very rare, is because of the salmon.  If you are a fan of salmon, I would totally recommend this place.  It is very surprising that a place like this can get fresh tasting Salmon in the middle of the desert.  The quantities of the dishes are also very reasonable.  However, I would not recommend any of the skewers.  I would say the skewer sections is one of the bigger let downs for this restaurant.  The meats were dry.  Other than that, the variety of food other than sushi was very tasteful.  Side note, don't get too stuffed if you want dessert.  The Deep Fried Ice Cream tasted very delicious to finish off a great meal.

fYTEs7Ode0r6WecJurBl2Q.text: One of my all time favorite sushi places! Tucked away from the hustle bustle of the strip it was worth exploring and finding this place! They have some incredible sushi options and every-time we make it to Las Vegas it's on the top of our food chain list of places to hit a least a couple of times!!

0WGSiQRiEYxB5Lbij26_IA.text: Have you ever seen a bad infomercial? Have you ever been taken advantage of ? Have you ever been totally pump faked by a fundamentalist such as Tim Duncan for the San Antonio Spurs to your own dismay of an optical illusion?   Where do I begin ??? Oh boy ....  I went here the other night but didn't eat because the wait was 1.5 hours and the staff runs the line so slowly. Some gay guy crossed my name off the list twice and the staff did nothing about it. I don't know if that's his gay way of hitting on me but he almost ended up getting his lights knocked out, so fortunately I left before trouble ensued. They have no organization, no system, they kind of pick and choose who they want to seat and when they want to seat them. Oh what fun is this game. Literally 4-5 open tables just sitting there looking nice and empty for some hungry heathens to come devour some "critically acclaimed" sushi.  I am accustomed to vip service my entire life and  now I know how it feels to be in general pop or the guy trying to ditch the line but isn't trying to by a table at club Liv in Miami but thinks he knows a promoter but doesn't know the promoter only gets paid on bottles and you probably should have made it easier on everyone and just got the table. They make you wait forever. No one watches the list or assigns the next party. I have a better chance of calling next in the streets of Harlem with an all white roster and actually getting on the next game then getting selected for a table here. Literally I feel like the luck of powerball struck when my name was finally called after my famished body had endured a 1.5 hour stand - a - thorn. Worst part I was high and you'd think I'd be more chill but I was hungry af.  Okay two hours later we are seated ready to rumbleeeee.  The waitress has a nasty attitude, doesn't speak English, and gave us one menu. Gee, Thanks, I guess. So after I partnered up with my buddy G, as if it were story time or we were working on a group project huddled up. We realized we had two opportunities left in the evening to order so we spat out a hum-dinger of an order.  She delivered our sushi about 50% correct which is even a poor free throw percentage but I was so hungry I didn't give a fukk was just grateful for food at this time. Someone in line told me this place was better than Yama sushi. Yama sushi is best in Vegas! Best service, food, quality, & price. Has 4 locations who can quickly seat you and accommodate high traffic times.  After what I would call a mediocre slab of sushi the waitress gave us a sideline warning and said we would be charged for not eating the rice. After our stomachs had failed us we left one roll. This hating ass biatch charged us 15$ for an additional two rolls. You literally have to get a manager involved if you would like a refill. Like sorry we are in the desert it's dry out here, do your job and get me some water.  Since she tacked me on the front 9 I happily left her what she earned which was a $0 dollar tip. Be nice to your customers, especially first timers who came to visit on their birthday and just waited 1.5 hours. I work hard for my money and your not entitled to my money because you have a store front sushi restaurant and a couple good yelp reviews, which were probably purchased by the way.  Never coming back ! Yama sushi is the champion of this town!

hjzyCOtbUFeLaCsnWeXyhA.text: Oh em gee. If I could sum up sakana in 2 words, it'd be that it is a "sushi heaven". Thanks to all the Yelpers who posted their reviews and guided me to here. I'd like give you all a huge bear hug, because it's True that this AYCE gem is THE best of its kind. We went there around 9 on a Saturday nite and I was seriously dreading that we'd have to wait a long time to be seated, but nope. We got our table right after our host came to greet us. After that, everything was a blur of sushi bliss. We didn't get to eat anything the whole day since we were busy with all the road tripping outside of vegas so we were pretty famished when we started our AYCE ordeal. I must've ordered almost the whole sushi menu and a good number of appetizers. Within about 5-10 minutes, our food was delivered to our table in a succession of what I remembered as a delishness galore. I can't believe it. I've found what I've been looking for all my life: a place that delivers excellent quality packed in massive quantity. For the first time, the slices of fish was the main diva of the show rather than the glob of rice that usually takes up the space of the stage like in most other AYCE joints. I was astounded to see the gloriously huge pieces of fish stacked on top of a small piece of the sushi rice. And the seasoning?? Frickin fantastically spectacularly amazingly bombass diggity good. I love my fish naked and raw just as long as they're fresh, but damn, when they're dressed in a bit of that sexy ponzu and garlic or Yuzu sauces, I felt like I was hooked on ecstasy. I've never had my sushi served that way, but consider my cherry well popped coz I'm now I'm a lifelong addict for it. As for the appetizer, hot diggity damn, I do love me that pork belly. Don't get me wrong though. Just like their sushi, their appetizers were just as good, too, but I can't get over how tender and perfectly flavored that piece of meat was.   With all that said and done, all that I regretted from my experience at Sakana was that I didn't have enough appetite or room in my stomach to eat more. For the dinner price of $25 ish per person, it'd be like finding needle in a haystack if I ever find a place as good as this one. With that said, I'd be back in a heartbeat when I'm in Vegas again for sure.

JF5dDlXnBitqmNN-iMuCnA.text: My all time favorite AYCE sushi spot! They have high quality fish and the interior design of the place gives a really nice ambience.   I personally order nigiri sushi and the rice to fish ratio is perfect! Mainly the reason why I love coming here. Order the "towering sashimi poki"! So delicious. Probably my favorite menu item!   If you're going to come definitely pay the extra money to do the dinner menu. So worth it.  Only giving it 4 stars because the service on our last 2 visits was kind of poor.

ACoqSGRv4OVhUC7X0pmMYA.text: This place is amazing! Everything we got was delicious, not exaggerating service was excellent. I recommend the towering sashimi poki, bakes lobster roll, all of the nigiri options. They have a very reasonable all u can eat (from the menu) and you can get half orders so you can try more options. This didn't apply to us but they will charge you for leftovers. I am most definitely coming back!

iM4KygcxTphjHJBHFXWb8g.text: Really good sushi. Good quality fish for an AYCE restaurant. I usually judge the quality of the fish by how the ahi tuna looks. This place had a more dark red color ahi tuna as opposed to the light pink "tuna" that other restaurants serve. I really liked the garlic ahi and seared lemon salmon nigiris. Good size fish and rice wasn't a huge amount either. I've been here twice and I already can't wait to go back again.

o3XX_6K3jf7HLJO9FUvHoA.text: Great service, great food, decent price. The line was a little long, though, so make sure to place a reservation for weekend nights.

v3ryj26y1knuyyjn-40Hvg.text: Raw fish please!!!  Located in the Target shopping centered on Maryland and Flamingo, we came to this spot recommend by our girl Angeli D. "Where you at girl?!" First impressions - very limited parking. There's a Filipino restaurant and other stores that share the corner, so good parking is a gamble.   The decor inside is awesome! Art deco mixed with traditional Japanese art. They have a cool chalkboard that covers the front window with a list of menu items, new items, and favorite rolls written on it. In the middle of the restaurant is a cool bar like table that sits 12 people comfortably. The sushi bar sits 8 and they have 3 coool bench booth setups that can sit another 12. The ambience here is refreshing, hip and popping. Not too loud.   Service here is surprisingly better than the ones we get at Yuma and Kaya. Carlos walked us through our questions on some items we didn't recognize, and made great recommendations including the Dancing Eel, The Shit, and Pang. No dry glasses, and no empty plates. Kept making room for our new dishes, and on top of us when it looked like we needed more. He was patient with us, with it being our first time here, he didn't give off that hurry up or "really?" Attitude. In fact today the servers seemed to be on point at both bar and tables. Good job guys.   Ordered: Green muscle Salmon Kama Seaweed salad Miso soup Shrimp tempura  Pang Pork belly Bacon & lobster skewer Bacon & asparagus skewer Dragon ball (baked lobster mix with mushroom  Nigiri: Salmon Garlic tuna Super white Albacore Sarada lobster  Rolls: Lobster roll Dancing eel roll  Dessert: Green tea ice cream  Nigiri proportions are good here. They are not shy at all here with their servings. The rice is just perfect, no huge rice servings and small proportioned fish, where like in most places you fill up on rice. Salmon Kama here is small, but shoots, they have it. They have lobster apart of their ingredients, and that's a plus. Skewers not as big as some places, but is tasty.  We'd like to come back and try the dinner menu, but overall for AYCE, customer service, and quality, they get 5 stars from me.

_5fWDQp5dUYZaQ8COj7jLw.text: Sakana is located along a row of smaller, random shops. However, you'll always be able to find it because the line is out the door! Very fresh sushi and lots of side dishes to choose from. Ambiance is whimsical and cozy.   Because of how busy it is, you might have to ask someone who isn't your server for a drink refill etc, but they are all very polite and get you what you need.   Try the cajun nigiri and the super white tuna. Very very good. The maguro was done well too. I don't think you can go wrong ordering here. If there's a wait (ours was about half an hour), it'll be worth it.

C9LzlIT-HWlHfSXSBF1FuQ.text: A huge group of us came for dinner while in town. Mind you we had a reservation for 15 places earlier in the day. We waited a little longer but not much of a worry. KZXLLbgBbNlgjGRKjpOHzw.text: We went on a Thursday night for dinner and there was a constant line for seating. The staff were really good about updating everyone on wait times though. We didn't mind the wait, there's good music and music videos on all the TVs to keep you occupied.  We did the all you can eat dinner and we're surprised by the immense options! It's not just sushi, you can get desserts, skewers, etc. we mostly had sushi and rolls though which were all very good. They don't use a ton of rice which is great because it lets you have room for more.  Everything tastes fresh and was flavorful. The staff were really quick to ask if we wanted more whenever we finished our current orders. We also ordered some beers which were 2 for 1.  Overall we loved this place: the prices are great, the food is good, and the staff were quick and very friendly.

The menu didn't have any pictures so it left me having to use the yelp app to look it up and see what would look good. (Killer for an AYCE sushi place because foodies do well with a visual representation/pictures of something). Second, had to knock down this review for the service. Its one of those spots with amazing amazing food but really bad with the staff. We weren't being catered too all that much, towards the end of our meal when we wanted to order dessert a big party came in and the focus was on them...it took 30 minutes for a waiter to come by and take our final order and a check. It was just very bad how quick they rung up our order but werent quick or attentive..

BIfPVPYbWj1kQPmXGoikbQ.text: This is my favorite AYCE in town! They have many appetizers, nigiri, rolls, desserts, and drinks to choose from. The fish is always so fresh and the fish to rice ratio is spot on.  My usual choices are hamachi/salmon kama, baked mussels, bacon & asparagus skewer, and salmon and yellowtail nigiri. When I'm here for dinner, I order uni and ama ebi (sweet shrimp--the head is separately deep fried and if you're daring enough, eat the whole head!). They recommend trying The Shit and Pang, which are unique appetizers (IMO it's not bad, but nothing to write home about). For the rolls try the Lisa Lisa, or one of the baked rolls. So good! For dessert, try the Deep Fried Banana or any of the house made desserts.  The interior is nicely decorated with some Asian-inspired trinkets on the walls. There are many seats up front with a large room in the back for more private parties. Pay attention to the chalkboard in the middle of the room--sometimes they have unique specials! Everything is pleasant, although the floor could use a good scrubbing.  Service is usually great, but in my experience they seem to forget at least one order from time to time. Not a big deal, just remind them and they'll bring it out promptly. They are good with coming back to take additional orders and refilling drinks.  As my favorite sushi place in town, I have yet to be disappointed by the sushi or service. I love the fish to rice ratio as well as the desserts. This is my standard for sushi in Vegas!

-d4creJESbCcI6-I4hck1Q.text: While on vacation in Las Vegas, my wife and myself were in the mood for some ayce sushi.  Especially with the high reviews for Sakana, we decided to give them a try one night. We came with our kids at about 8pm, and it was a bit crowded, but not too bad.  i think we waited for about 15 minutes on a Tuesday night.   I do have to say that the service is extremely fast.  The food came out minutes after we ordered it!  The taste was great, and the server was nice, but also hurried (as expected and appreciated).  It is too bad that the top menu items are only "1 time at dinner" such as the Uni.  However, it is understood to keep that policy so that the price remains reasonable and people don't take advantage.  The one thing about their policies that i didn't like is the "Yelp" forcing.  Like many other Japanese places, they offer you a free drink with Yelp.  However, the difference is that instead of just checking in (and writing a review later), they force you to write a review before the free drink.  That is a bit weird that they expect you to review before eating, and have to write it on your phone.    I am updating my review now so that I can give a True feedback to the restaurant.  Sakana is a great option for ayce in Vegas, but just know it is off the strip.  I plan on returning one day.  Funny thing is that I actually went to Sakana about a year ago with some co-workers here in Vegas.  However, when we arrived, they lost their liquor license, so we decided to go eat somewhere else.  I am glad that I returned and that their liquor license is back.

qu4Kgn-CmO6g0w_64b6XWw.text: Called 5 times to make a reservation and first call got picked up and hung up and never answer again. So my family and I decided to just go ahead and go to the restaurant only to see that there's a lot of people waiting outside. Really bad customer service!!

3DkRRM8pMuli__iMHoP-SQ.text: Where, oh where do I begin? This AYCE sushi joint has stolen my heart, & rightfully so! If Sakana was a man, I would run to the Vegas strip and marry him immediately.   You would think that quality is compromised for quantity, but that is definitely not the case at Sakana. The sashimi tastes fresh and the appetizers are cooked to perfection. My favorites include the salmon belly nigiri, towering sashimi poki, and the baked mussels. If you're feeling the need to spice up your life, the Call 911 Roll is just the thing to order. Anything on their monthly special chalk board is bound to make your taste buds happy!  I can't forget to mention the great staff. They are so kind and attentive to all your belly's wishes!

dfMz1azh8Ve1zh7Ys8hpdg.text: Excellent first time experience! 1st off they were very busy, but the waiters and sushi chefs were still very attentive, fast, friendly and courteous. Big thumbs up for that. 2nd, the food. OMG! So good, everything was just top notch, all the nigiri was so fresh tasting, with an overwhelming fish to rice ratio 2-1 fish, that's amazing. The rolls were great (the what the heck roll & something wrong roll=could eat that for the rest of my life), all I could say for every bite was Oh My God, so many complex flavors and textures, it was little bites charismatic heaven. I was given 2 chefs specials, wow for creativity and taste, they were awesome. The appetizers were all very good, Baked Mussels some of the best I've ever had, the Pang is not to be missed, and the Pork Belly, where have you been all my life.  Super awesome can't wait to go back

nKsQftji-WaZyiIAtIecFw.text: I feel like my entire life has been dedicated to AYCE sushi since I moved here. "Hey, do you want to eat?" Of course I do and it usually ends up being sushi because my friend is a sushi skank, so therefore I am also one. Friendship goals, y'all. So, I came here with my darling sushi skank on a Wednesday evening around 7 and it was PACKED! First of all, the parking lot was packed and I was like "no big deal. People are probably off to do other things besides eat all the sushi I want". Nope, Sakana was packed, with a wait list. What in the shizz is this actually about? It's WEDNESDAY! Okay, okay. So, we got on the wait list and sat on this little bench near the front door and stalked people who were eating, all while proclaiming how excited and hungry we were. We waited probably 15 minutes and that was quite enough of that nonsense. Then....we were seated! Yay. Everyone from the front staff to the waiters and water peeps were all very friendly and seemed to generally want to assist in creating a good experience. Thank you! There is nothing worse than getting crappy service but good food. Winning all around! So, anyway, the food. Pretty amazing. In my sushi blackout, I actually managed to make a little note on my phone of what I ate(pat on the back, dude). Here is(most)of what I ate before I rolled out of this joint, gastro sick and questioning my life choices: *Spicy garlic edamame(the bomb.com. For reals, yo. This is my jam right here. Salty, spicy, garlicky, hot, intense, amazing. Get it and thank me later). *Agedashi tofu(not the best I`ve ever had but certainly a contender for my heart. I love me some agedashi tofu. I wanted more. I wish the portion was larger). *Green baked mussels(Maybe it's just me, but I didn`t particular enjoy these here. I guess this is a Vegas thing? I`m not sure. I had them at one place I enjoyed them at and the rest have just been OK. Pass for me). * Nigiri was enjoyed in the form of tuna, yellowtail, cajun tuna, octopus, seared lemon salmon. All were good but my stand outs were the cajun tuna, octopus and seared lemon salmon. I could live off of those. *Hand rolls(not jobs, rolls): Lemon salmon(I admittedly love lemon and salmon so this was really an amazing experience for me), Lisa Lisa(Meh. Not my thing. Too much sauce, too much...too much), Golden Tiger(another one I didn`t pick and didn`t particularly care for because I felt like my arteries were clogging the moment I ate this deep fried monster), Bam bam roll(really yummy. I would get it again). Random choice: Towering Sashimi Poki. It was good but I`m not sure I would order it again because it did feel a bit "heavy" for me with the crispy wonton underneath the sauced up fish. It was alright. Worth a try if you're into sauce and spice. At the end I had green tea panna cotta, which was surprisingly addicted and I wanted to ask for another and another. Overall, I want to come back here, so if you're in the mood for sushi, please take me out!

Bm2VIrfrP0qm20lI-obyQA.text: There are very few things in life I love more than good sushi and Sakana is currently my favorite in Vegas. After seeing multiple check ins from a Yelper I know and trust I bookmarked it and eventually made my way down. The first thing about them is that the fish to rice ratio is fantastic. So many places barely put a sliver of fish so that's a welcome surprise. They customer service was great. The servers are always making sure you're good to go, whether it's beer or water or more rolls. The rolls Come out quick. It was almost too quick because I expected them to take longer so I had a table full of rolls-a good problem to have. The chefs are fun to converse with, which is an underrated part of sushi experience when eating at a bar. An outgoing chef changes the entire vibe. Their fresh Wasabi is straight (fire emojis). It's soooo soooo good. If you're a drinker, they have a good 2 for 1 happy hour that I make sure to always take advantage of.  If you need a sushi place, come to this one

TwerCuzuS2lq2UAaH0qhvg.text: The food is awesome but the customer service is something that needs improvement. Came in at 4pm for a early dinner, anyone who knows me knows I'm a bigger set guy so I like to have space when I eat. We got sat a small 2 person table and when we asked for a larger table since the restaurant wasn't that busy. The older Asian lady said "no" dinner table is set by how many people are eating. Ok fine we get it you want to maximize your seating potential but when you have 15 out of your 20 tables open your think you'd accommodate since it's so early in the dinner service.  Like I said the food was great, when it came time to order some dessert I asked what kind on mochi brand that they used the same lady rolled her eyes and said in a rude annoyed voice that she did not know what kinda of brand and that they made it In house, when I said really she then said it's a Japanese brand. Like comon now why you wanna bullshit for, I asked what brand it was cause coffee mocha is my fav but only certain brands actually make it good though. "Mikawaya and Maeda-en" make really good coffee flavored mochi ice creams.  In all it was a mediocre experience, would I come back? Maybe if I was in the area, but really I'd have to be in the mood for some sushi with a side of shotty customer service."

a9W-m2Xi9dAbxp_9MRRsyA.text: AYCE All You Can Eat Sushi spot. OISHI! First, plenty parking spot in open plaza. Spots nearest to entrance just may be taken because this place is so popular. Second, wait is worth it, if there is one. Third, sushi made to order (so not just rotating on a belt and you have NO idea how long it's been sitting out). Fourth, fun vibe- AYCE lunch & dinner prices reasonable. Come hungry. Dinner time is truly the best deal for your money- as you will see I'm attached zoomed in photos, they have some items "dinner only" and "1 per person" and even some "1 per table" too! So if those are your faves, be aware! The servers are super busy speeding past, but smile! Be nice and ask away! This is a fave for many reasons! Highly recommend for locals and visitors! Bonus: if you come around 3pm-ish, and ask nicely, they may honor the dinner price for you!

WdSDL8Ek8A6nfTOCiDz-Yw.text: Last Friday, after a long day working on the yard due to a broken branch from the snow, my boyfriend and I thought we deserved AYCE sushi! We've been to Yama and Goyemon and recently heard of Sakana. With all the great reviews, we thought, why not. Maybe it'll be a new place to bring our friends when they visit. Upon arrival, we had to wait maybe 45 minutes to 1 hour. We had about 13 people in front of us.  This is a good sign for a sushi spot since you know they are going through rounds of fish and therefore, the fish should be fresh.  Our first plate was great. The oysters and ama ebi (sweet shrimp) came out first. The oyster tasted great with the flavors that they put on it.  The sweet shrimp was also not bad. They also provide the shrimp head here fried similar to Yama. Goyemon usually just provides the body.  First time trying the fried shrimp head. Not bad since its fried but also gets difficult to chew towards the end due to the shrimp shell.  After the first plate the rest of the sushi came out. We got all the popular items that were 1 per person orders as well as the main items like yellowtail, white tuna, etc.  Not sure if the waitress didn't hear us right or randomly put down numbers but our order definitely did not come out right. We were trying to avoid raw salmon due to the parasite fears and yet we got both the salmon belly (which we did order) but also 2 more orders of regular salmon (that we did not order). Our yellowtail and another order of white tuna was also missing.  Also they had scallop which is one of my favorites though it is not the nice fresh type like at Goyemon. This one has that extra outer ring and doesn't seem as fresh.  The fish here taste fine. Seemed ok for freshness but most of them did have some type of ponzu or their "300" sauce on it.  Therefore, if you like your fish without sauce and like to control your own soy sauce quantity, then this place may not be the place for you.  My boyfriend also noticed that though the fish were decent sized, the rice quantity was more, which combined with the sauce on each fish would fill you up faster.  Something to note if you are trying to make the most of your AYCE experience. So for rice to fish ratio, Goyemon wins on this one.   We also got the yakitori items. Bacon and lobster, bacon and scallop, chicken, and sausage. These items were just ok. Nothing special and the bacon ones were overwhelmed by the bacon so not much seafood taste.  For dessert, we got the mini honey toast, fried banana, green tea ice cream and red bean ice cream. Mini honey toast and fried banana both come with vanilla ice cream. Mini honey toast we just ok. It's pretty much ice cream on a piece of sweet toast. The fried banana had a weird aftertaste to it. Not sure if it was in the batter or the banana itself.  Lastly, one thing I was very disappointed in was the ice cream. I'm lactose intolerant so anytime I get ice cream, I take Lactaid pills. Because of this, I only eat ice cream when it's worth it.  Green tea also happens to be my favorite usually but the ice cream here had barely any taste. Both the green tea and red bean barely could be recognizable.  The vanilla that came with my fried banana ended up being the best one, but it could have been due to the chocolate fudge that was drizzled on top of the ice cream.  Overall, Sakana was OK.  Sushi is fine and I don't think most people would be disappointed. If our orders came out correct, maybe we'd had enjoyed it more. Recommendation would be to send it back if they get it wrong so you don't end up filling your stomach with something you didn't order.  The dessert was also a bad way to end the night.  So, if you just want sushi, this place is fine but go get desert somewhere else.

DRbuNNgwUe65-dtDQnvp1w.text: This is the second time I've been to Sakana and upon looking at the menu, it clicked...Sakana is under the same ownership as Sushi Neko. Neko is one of my all time favorite sushi places in Vegas, which makes sense why I loved Sakana the first time (same menu). The fish is always fresh. I mean melt in your mouth fresh! I love the seared lemon salmon and cajun tuna. So much flavor! They also have no-rice rolls for those who are trying to avoid more carbs!  Ambiance of both locations is very similar. The music they play is good, however it was kind of loud for conversation.  I've been to other sushi joints all over town, but hands down Sakana, and it's sister restaurant never disappoint.   Do yourself a favor and go here for AYCE....It's the way to go. You will not be disappointed!!

lJyx1zwShLf6yN62SObfBg.text: Decided to try this place seeing that Yama Sushi was jam packed. Considering it is the day after Christmas I expected that anywhere we decided to go would be crowded. We first walked in and the place was pretty busy. Read the signs that said, 'Please wait to be seated'. Stood there waiting about 5 minutes before flagging a worker down to ask if there was someone who could help us. She pointed to the clip board a few feet I front of us and told us to sign in.  Sushi/fish tasted good, service was mediocre. AYCE price was average.

0gnks2SURkWku2I8oQnmbw.text: I loved it here :) We're here for a few days and staying at the strip. We were craving sushi and didn't want to go to any of the "Asian Fusion" blah blah restaurants in the hotels. I looked up an AYCE place and this one was on top of the list. There was a bit of wait on a Thursday night but nothing crazy. We were seated and our sever, David, was really nice. Some of the AYCE sushi places I've tried in LA has a 3 rounds limit so you tend to order too much in the first round. Here, you just order as you want more, which I really like. We didn't get rolls, mostly nigiri, sashimi and their apps and skewers. The fishes taste really good and fresh. I felt like the quality of the food is 5x more at least than the price we paid. The servers also bring the food really quickly and they're very quick to respond when you ask for assistance. They also have a lot of selection and they include desserts too :) Next Vegas visit I'll make sure to come back here.

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States

R4T0y_RKMtXtsLZRCH-Agw.text: One great option for ayce sushi! Probably the best I've ever had.  The place was already popping right when they opened for lunch.   The sushi was fresh compared to other sushi buffets! None of them had that frozen taste to them. The salmon nigiri was my favorite- smooth and buttery. It is also True that they don't over stuff their rolls with rice. Another plus is that you can order half rolls on the eight piece rolls which is a great way to try more rolls. They have a 2 for 1 drink special that is all day!   Such a great deal. Sakana is now on my Vegas musts when I'm in town!

Ia9y8KIL2yBVjJVi9pCabA.text: Review is 3.5 Stars  Came for dinner on a Friday night and wait was almost 2 hours. It is a small place and understandable.  We were seated and started ordering immediately.  Food comes out quick but some order were messed up (i.e. some plates never came out, some did that we didn't order). When asking about the rolls that we didn't order, our server said it's on our paper, so we have to eat it.  Wouldn't show us where we ordered it. Sushi does have a good amount of fish, but they also use a lot of rice. They're other great sushi places that are better.  I'd only come back if I was on that side of town and craving sushi

AOP17Eyv-zbi5diJhgoTtQ.text: Came back after a very long hiatus of 3 years. Awesome ayce sushi. I recommend going with the nigiri (all good from garlic tuna to lobster salad), mussels, and Chef No. 1 and Bam Bam rolls. Blanc Manger was as good as ever.

jDGMpJAfUCoXBGezFkMEGw.text: Hard to find an AYCE sushi restaurant that serves good quality fish, rolls that are not all rice, and good service but Sakana has it all! We had a party of 15 people that were starving after a day of volleyball. The staff was excellent from start to finish, attentive to our large party, bringing and recommending different nigiri and rolls. We got all the specials including oysters, salmon belly, uni, and ebi. This restaurant does not skimp on the amount of fish you get. Their salmon and hamachi nigiri melts in your mouth.  We will definitely be back next time we are in Vegas!

-NZJztzJBS05CfyetMCwVw.text: So glad to have found this place. Loved the fact that it's a sit in eat all you can sushi and not a buffet! Everything was really good with lots of choices!! We came during dinner so there was a bit of a wait which is expected given that they were good. Food was quick and delicious! Love their decor too

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pEJx1PnpYvn00-Rc9UrFOg.text: My favorite AYCE sushi spot in Vegas. Everything is delicious. Size of nigiri is good. Fish is fresh. Appetisers are great. Service is fast. No complaints. Love to bring friends here when they visit Vegas.

JMzKZzu7dQCJdpT7oIGmMg.text: First time here, it was amazing... just loved the fresh trout sushi... to die for! Ambiance was nice but it was kind of squishy in there, not that much room! Food was good tho! Loved it

WQsFqKE9fiMftfddgKqong.text: $25 pp with bogo beer what's not to love. It's a steal, for Vegas especially. Salmon anything and beef fried rice was bomb. Everything we tried was good. It's not the greatest sushi ever but for the overall experience, ambience and price I would come back when visiting Vegas. I deduct a star bc they forgot to bring out a dish twice.. but then again it was a packed house! Just go.

rdtbw4gRFTuVAyDUKho1-A.text: OVERALL: 8.9/10 (Yelp conversion: 5/5). Average based on the breakdown at the bottom of this review.  The AYCE here (for dinner) is extremely #worth if you can break even by eating at minimum 2 premium rolls (for example, $9.95 each for the sashimi or rainbow), and at least two orders of the premium 2pc sushi (for example, $4.95 for each of the oyster / salmon belly / uni). Everything else ordered past that (per person) is worth it since you already broke even (based on the a la carte prices on the menu, which are incredibly pricey for the portion sizes).  I was a party of 1 and there was an end seat at the sushi bar, which I gladly took. This made ordering extremely easy - I was in and out within 30 minutes of arriving, even after waiting 5 minutes after putting my name in the queue (4 parties ahead of me, all of size 2 or greater).   After tax, the AYCE dinner came out to $28.03 (pre-tip). My experience was great, since the sushi chef was extremely attentive and helpful at describing what was good, although this may have been due to me sitting directly in front of him at the sushi bar.  1) VARIETY/SELECTION: 7/10. Had a decent selection & offering, but this is Las Vegas, which is in a landlocked state, and no access to fresh fish - you get what your geography gives you.  2) FRESHNESS: 8/10. Again, it's land-locked, don't go in expecting Kashiba-level freshness. This isn't near a farmer's market, nor is it going to taste as fresh as one.  3) VALUE FOR MONEY: 10/10. If I ordered the equivalent meal off of the a-la-carte menu (which is the same as the AYCE menu, but you pay the listed price instead of the AYCE price), I would have had to pay closer to $78, given that each of the premium rolls are $9.95 (I ordered 4), the 2pc sushi dishes were $4.95 each (I ordered 6), and other dishes ranged from $2.95 (cheaper sushi pieces) to $14.50 (Seafood Salad).  4) SERVICE: 9.5/10. This is somewhat biased since I was sitting at the sushi bar, and the sushi chef I could order from was literally serving only me and a few table orders (despite the place being packed to the point of a wait list). The wait staff weren't super attentive, and the -0.5 stars is from my water being not refilled for over 20 minutes (even though the wait staff camped behind me since that's where the point-of-sale device was).  5) PRICE: 10/10. I didn't eat lunch and wanted something filling, given that I had hiked this entire day. Needless to say, $33 including tip for an all-you-can-eat sushi meal is a bargain.  The atmosphere and decor is somewhat nice too; the TV was playing K-Pop songs the entire time I was there (I saw "Gentleman" and "Hangover" by PSY, as well as some K-Pop male idol group whose name escapes me). Interesting that a Japanese restaurant plays so much K-Pop.  I'll visit again next time I'm in town - great recommendation if you're craving AYCE sushi in Las Vegas!

ncEfUAVhaGZ78OmJUGIWPg.text: Great place to eat and enjoy very fresh sushi. Must try it!!!!!!!!!!!'nnnnnnnnnnnnnn make sure you order all you can eat menu. You will definitely eat more than that

xm5Hl4tmQc4Oc9SWqzy2QQ.text: I was looking at 3 different sushi places last night and I'm glad my boyfriend chose this one (it was a blind choosing haha). We we got a few rolls and some sashimi. Everything was super delicious. The fish was extremely fresh and everything came out fast! I've never tried halibut sashimi before, only pan seared and oh my! It was heavenly! The servers were fun and very attentive. I don't think we had an empty plate sitting in front of us for more than 2 mins. The sushi chefs are really nice and fun as well! Their portions were generous and everything was bomb. Definitely hoping that we'll crave sushi once more on this trip, otherwise I'll be more than excited to be back in Vegas next time!

-l0he-_FCcdiix5qRh-0SA.text: Well I had to leave this review even though we didn't eat here since my experience was so bad. We tried to come for lunch on Tuesday. It was party of 3 of us. There had to be about 4 or 5 servers in the restaurant and they were not close to full or extremely busy, but we waited over 10 min to be greeted and seated and it NEVER HAPPENED. Not a single server even acknowledged we were there, no one even said we will be right with you. They all just avoided eye contact so after 15 minutes we walked out and found a better place that wanted our business.

0FCWVsW3-OjjTrQPv514DQ.text: My friend frequent this restaurant, so I had a high hope. The service was decent, but I feel that selections of rolls were somewhat limited. And they do serve nigiri sushi with bigger fish/seafood on top of rice, but they honestly didn't taste that good. They definitely didn't taste that fresh. But the service was good.  Unfortunately, I didn't get what the hype was about. I prefer Goyemon better even though their fish are smaller.

STko7VR5U6SiZYgMoZwUtA.text: Delicious. If you're grabbing dinner be sure to order The Shits, as that comes with sauce that's pretty awesome. I like the dancing eel roll.  My only issue is the wait time associated with this restaurant's popularity. Service is avg, but food is great.

Mv-TcPcxF7rDvL4Z_Ccrxw.text: I should have done my due diligence when I chose this spot. Yelp shows 4 stars and over 1,000 reviews.  Little did I know that this place was once shut down recently by the health department for improper food handling and storage.   I ate here with my family and was a bit surprised by how fast our nigiri was coming out. We ate all our food as we were all hungry. After I got home, I was unable to go to work as my stomach was not happy. It did not get any better, from hourly diaherea to every twenty minutes and vomiting.   This place needs to be shut down permanently as there are many other reviews with the same results after dining here.   Save your thirty dollars and put it on the roulette table instead   DO NOT GO HERE!!

ip1N1UVebghlu_IqMe0wuw.text: The food is very reasonably priced for a buffet and sushi fresh with tons of selections. One of the waiters splashed a bit of food on me after he spilled a bowl onto the floor while cleaning up. BUT! The manager gave me a free meal! Much appreciated, Bon!  Happy customer here. Don't eat at the Strip. Eat here.

ywoQk7nft2LFRwerv5Q0Iw.text: I rarely leave mediocre reviews, and am so sad since I really wanted to love this place. The AYCE is okay, but hostess needs more training on seating customers. I arrived 6:30pm on a Tuesday, looking to get a table for 5. Come 35 minutes later and after seeing 4 later parties seated before us, we are still the only ones on the waiting bench. I noticed the other parties of 3, 3, 4, 4 were seated by pulling two tables together, and kindly asked her why the staff couldn't do the same for our party of 5. Mind you, I've been standing with her for the past 25 minutes and haven't received a smile from her yet - but she explains that she is waiting on a table to leave and they are about to go. And on we wait for another 10 minutes, while another 2 parties get seated before us. To my disappointment, go ahead, GUESS how she seats us? By pulling 2 tables together. Why, OH WHY didn't she do this 35 minutes ago when we were the first to arrive??!!? It takes just as many tables to seat 4 people, as it is for 5 people. Minus 1 for poor planning. But we didn't let this upset our night. We were on a mission to try the AYCE menu. Lunch is $20.95, and dinner service is $25.95. The menu is pretty extensive, and we enjoyed our meal. Plus 1 for prompt serving & refilling... Another staff member was constantly refilling our waters. There was one instance where our server brought the wrong item to our table tho, and just shrugged it off ... Minus 1. My favorite was the Red Snapper Nigiri, Tiger Roll, Chanel Roll, and Bulgogi Nachos. The rolls seemed to have a lot of sauce on it, a little too much for my preference, and the fish was okay, but not too memorable. Parties of 6 are charged 18% gratuity automatically. And there are signs about only splitting bills 6 ways for parties of 6 or greater. The ladies restroom is decked out in Hello Kitty, near to my heart. And the restaurant decor is really nice. Plus 1 for decor. I'd probably return to give it another try if they didn't punish larger parties and have us wait 35 minutes - didn't offer a water or something to drink during our wait. I watched 18 people get seated before us, and was so hungry and parched by the time we were seated :( I usually dine with my family, and this place didn't make my list of places to bring them since the long wait is just not worth it.

WYOErChEuEdpxscxMoo_fA.text: Make sure you go for all you can eat deal - it's a steal! And make sure to order the following:  Baked Mussels Summer crunch roll (although labeled as spicy, it's not) Eel nigiri White tuna nigiri Ama Ebi - so delicious   In any case their food is divine and the service is brilliant  But more importantly, it's a really good deal in LV. Why? Eating sushi in the strip can be very expensive.   Getting out of the strip and eating in establishments that cater to the locals ends up being more affordable and give better value for the money.   Just be prepared for a wait. This joint is very popular and the tables are limited.

LoTy-m77MYl_kvryv8sxAA.text: What I like:  * No fishy smell of tuna/salmon/yellowtail/salmon belly nigiri, and has decent proportion of rice.  * Food comes out pretty fast  What I don't like:  * Uni is not fresh. It tastes bitter and gives a smell in your mouth. Goyemon restaurant so far has fresh Uni everytime I'm there.  * You get not 1 order, but 1 oyster only. * Seafood salad is just a clump of leftover meat of all sizes. Not pretty to eat and I was afraid I might get a stomach ache.  * Green panna cotta dessert wth is that? Bitter. Do not order! * Fried banana dessert is nothing worth mentioning... you get two small pieces of tempura battered banana with a scoop of ice cream.

PZ-FnqOb55tNfhAat6DVXA.text: My fave sushi spot in Vegas. When in Vegas, must try! Made-to-order, all you can eat! Try the "it's the shit", scallops, lobster. Can't go wrong.

FapN7jglkHfAr0M2J3DXPw.text: For some reason you can find some of the best sushi is strip malls  - and Sakana is a good example of this theory. Amazing sushi for all you can eat. Good service as well as fast. I would give them 5 stars except their Sake selection sucked.

cACugtydevI2zuq9spfmdA.text: Great place great food very friendly so she was fresh and plenty of it. It was my first time and I will definitely make it a point to eat here whenever I come visit Las Vegas again

MsAGPBDbxv4Hp9Oa2dX11w.text: This was such a pleasant surprise!!! I was searching for a quick stop for sushi and came upon this hole in the wall restaurant. I had the green monster and a regular spicy tuna roll- both were great AND cheap! The service was also quick and the ambiance was inviting (love the cute seat cushions). It's kind of tucked away from the road, but it's definitely worth a stop. Can't wait to tell more of my friends about it!

u5O1SEW04xB56BUaKFUFhg.text: Really good sushi, a ton of items to choose from on their ayce menu and really clean inside.  They also have banana tempura ice cream as part of their ayce!!  This place is definitely my go-to sushi joint whenever I'm in Vegas from now on. :)

ECflzcHxDXad7OCVJVO4gw.text: So glad we found this place. The staff us very friendly, and they accommodate some of my picker tastes. (For example, I could live without the garlic ponzu sauce or mayonnaise for the rest of my life.) They have a wide selection of signature rolls, including a section of spicy rolls, which appealed to me. I tried the "Call 911" and "I Need Water" rolls; both made me happy. The Cocaine Salad was delicious. The giant shrimp was a little too sweet for me, but my wife loved it.

yTbtUbtszstI1SR3sEQKOA.text: We loved this place!!  Sushi was fresh and it was all we could eat!!  Service was exceptional.  Can there be such a thing as too exceptional?

m4RaDfX5ec4JG4HT5M2YGw.text: Highly recommended! Came here for lunch with my husband based off of the positive yelp reviews. Delicious sushi, great customer service and fun atmosphere. Loved this place! Would love to come back again.

AiPbhcVt1dhkY6q-lrZpQA.text: Yummy Sushi! The staff is super nice and very helpful! The location is a little hard to find. It faces Maryland Pkwy and it's on the right side of Target.

pAW31M3i_F6sCV2XFytw_A.text: Excellent, prompt, curious service as usual:) Beside the AYCE you can order off the menu which has 1/2 off rolls and sushi and they have drink specials. Fresh fish.

zaM5mOZqFETDArGXepFsmA.text: Went this past Sunday 5/10/15. It was a bit busy. We waited about 15 minutes to be seated. The restaurant decor is great! Modern, with good music and an attentive staff. We ordered the all you can eat $25 dinner. We also indulged in the 2 for 1 alcoholic beverages. That special runs all day everyday! Food was good, fast and fresh! Definitely way better than Yamaha sushi across the street. The only thing I didn't like was that you have to sign yourself in on a waiting list upon entering. There's no host there to control that list.

t4SLHQoCvP8VLC4cjCy0eA.text: Bomb! Delicious sushi, nice atmosphere, 2for1 drinks! Definitely one of the best in Vegas

iAohDq6m7TtMhTQ8Pt5xdg.text: They had a couple specials tonight that were great.  First was a seared piece of tuna with a slightly sweet sauce that they called toro steak really fresh and really good.  Then some salmon belly with a dab of real wasabi not sure which was better the real wasabi or the belly .   Last special of the night that I really like was some mixed fish poke that was wrapped in a thinly sliced cucumber I think.  All of the rolls that we had were good but I'm into ngiri.  There was some mackerel that was great and all the fish was very fresh tonight.  The chef kept bringing little dishes like some scallop in the shell with salty lemony sauce and some black and regular masago.  Great place I hope the quality stays and the price 22 bucks if I remember right

FsXFiJjDq9O6vF5YS8fWWw.text: Excellent sushi. Sat at bar, Chiefs are great. Seats could be a little more comfortable. This is my second time here, I will be back again. Fish is high quality and good portions. AYCE is off the hook, come here hungry and you will leave full.

WN_UwethKAcRJH8O8HiUsA.text: If I can put no stars I would. Pretty bad experience. Manager and staff were disorganized. Made me, my husband, and our two kids wait 1 hour when the place was half empty, waiters were walking around doing nothing. A couple came after our 45 minutes of waiting and were seated and had food in less than 10 mins. They didn't offer us water once in our hour of waiting, and mind you we had a six year old tired and hungry with us. We walked out after a hour, there's no way I would've spent a penny here at this point. And just so you know its off the Vegas strip and the manager told us when we arrived to call our taxi 30 minutes in advance as they take a while, we called our taxi after we were very hungry at this point and the taxi service said a hour to pick us up. I heard the food was good here, but we wouldn't know.

M-RjkN1KoK7UXZFpngS0og.text: My favorite AYCE spot so far! Ive tried a ton and this is the place. The wait staff is very friendly as well as the sushi chefs. I've been here three or four times now and every time they would bring over something different for us to try as the chef's new specials. The fish is very fresh. Ive never seen more than a few people in here at a time so its nice to go to a sushi bar that isnt totally packed all the time. This place is a must try

kYrV2uq5lsVg4itdqkQrlA.text: This is the best sushi restaurant that I've found in my price range. I come here with friends for pay day, and the service is always really good. The diverse menu is really nice and their rolls are really big.

Xkf26ZpIpPPkKZ2Iyef6Kg.text: Sign says Kabuki but they are called Sakana now.... AYCE for 23 on dinner and 21 for Lunch... their choices and combinations are pretty awesome...

B5rEMw-Ze8UA2rqAhQzhtg.text: Food was decent. Did the all you can eat buffet.  Paid for ala carte uni during lunch and soda is not included in price. Ordered a roll and was told upon leaving that he would charge 1/2 price for not finishing the roll... Are you kidding me!  Ain't ever coming back to this place.

U4TyQCLCwBOBNm-wu1fZGg.text: Cajun Tuna. I could eat only this! Everything is great but this is to die for! The service is great. Friendly and helpful staff. Music is a little loud but it's a young, hipster atmosphere so that goes w the territory. But everyone would feel comfortable and enjoy the food and atmosphere! Great restaurant. My favorite place in Las Vegas!!!

yCgYRzh5nHLNG1wMTEUi4w.text: This place is amazing every time I come he I leave here happy with my experience servers are good chefs are amazing if  you're going to Yama instead of here your missing out

COmA5t6acTb3W9EmhdtkeQ.text: Located hidden away but must come and try if in neighbourhood. Excellent fresh fish with a well portioned fish to rice ratio for nigiri sushi,. Rice well favoured and this makes the place an excellent ACYE restaurant. Only minor issues is that there are limitations placed on a number of items but these are not always clearly outlined on the menu. The waiter also needs to improve his English as got a number of our orders wrong. No time limit seen. Excellent overall value for money but crucially very tasty.

SkRNfxINmGdHgk05Rc0J6A.text: What a great restaurant! Amazing food, friendly service and great prices. It is the antidote of the Strip.  Can't recommend it highly enough.

1Ygp2Qb0dQD0XDL7KDjM1g.text: I love this place!! This is my new favorite spot their sashimi poki is so good their fish is so fresh I just love this place! I've been many different places in Vegas and this one is my go to spot now!
