iFbUW5A_dLE-38mxkpV60Q.text: Awesome service and great food. Not sure if I'll even be able to walk out of here I'm so stuffed! Worth every penny.

tnIBR0WtgE6geBl-EEnfEQ.text: I've been to multiple AYCE sushi places in Las Vegas and I must admit that this is the best.  Sushi is fresh, service is great and sake is the bomb!

mMWJge1B-m55qX_F_UcrNQ.text: Service was trash. We waited forever for our food and for service. Our last roll didnt even come. We waited for 2 hours and gave up. Worst service from any sushi restaurant ever. We asked for the bill and for it to exclude the rolls that didnt come out and, not to my surprise, that took forever too. I dont get the hype about this place. The reviews do not match up to my experience. All in all. This place is trash. Don't waste your time.

7opSA0m1oMjR2Skbl_rLlg.text: Excellent food and service. All of our sushi orders came out promptly and everything we ordered tasted amazing. I loved the garlic tuna and the Hawaiian roll. The portions are smaller so you can try more things such as the crispy rice was only 2 pieces and the pork belly was 2 pieces. I really liked that instead of getting full right away off of one specialty roll like at other "all you can eat" restaurants. All of the staff were friendly and welcoming. There wasn't a single item that I didn't truly enjoy. Definitely going to come here at least once a month!

e--afV-4ZeZmlW7MvM-QPw.text: Best nigiri selection and quality for all you can eat. Appetizers are always on point. Sometimes not so great keeping track when it's busy and I've definitely gotten some things I didn't order, but it's our go to place for all you can eat by a big margin.

wb7p9n5PzGEOP11uX-UvTA.text: This place lives up to the hype! Best AYCE in town for sure. This place gives you twice the fish on half the rice, and the ingredients are fresh and delicious. I'd highly recommend their salmon belly nigiri, but anything off of their nigiri menu is good. Dinner ayce is 26 bucks and its the best value around. They don't appear to have all you can drink anymore however. Come early and be prepared to wait a little cause its usually packed. They only take reservations for parties of 10 or more.

n5eVvv39f4fXBHc8aClMAg.text: Do not ever ever come to this place! Before I order alcohol, I ask the server if the alcohol is included, he said yes. Then we order 3 alcohol has been extra charge on the bill. So we asked the server, he changed his word and told us that he never said the alcohol is included.  Wtf, and he said he is the manger! Yes! A big Asian guy that has no hair! That's him! Avoided him! Avoided this place! Never come back!!! This place with such rude and dishonest manger will close very soon!!!

4xxRgfQQdL5hFyL_DQonpA.text: This is the best sushi restaurant I've been to, and I've eaten all around Vegas. I have tried different rolls every time I've gone to Sakana, and every single one of them was 10/10. Seriously. My favorites are the Lemon Shrimp Roll, Something Wrong, and The Shit. Great service and the food comes out so quick! 100/10.

hBpy8M4NKHYUJQArROE4Rg.text: The hot hot fire for AYCE everything is super fresh. They let you order lots of items at once. The fish to rice ratio is just right. Highly recommend

w0fjWIaELww858Hq5rCUtg.text: Ate here last night for a friends birthday. The staff was friendly and pretty good at getting the rolls out quickly. The sushi was good and the all you can eat is a pretty good deal. Came out to about 32$ for dinner with an automatic gratuity. Very similar to Yama sushi right across the street. The main difference between the two is that Yama is very tightly packed and I felt Sakana gave you more room to sit and enjoy your meal. Both are great and you can't go wrong for AYCE.

QSfSaPYtufP9kp5Xqo1glg.text: This place is AMAZING!!! The food is really good! I have tried many all you can eat sushi places and this one has been the best of all! There's a lot of variety to choose from. If you are doing the all you can eat, I recommend getting half rolls on the 12pc rolls, so that you can try more rolls. I will be back for sure! This is my new all you can eat sushi place!!

8oV34LzQs5dk1yzgTTnk9A.text: For an all you eat place the fish is very fresh. And they dot make the blocks of rice so big you fill up in ten minutes. I'm impressed.

3dd2lkruiAxPAje_lEW0Jw.text: Came here with a group of 5. Parking was easy, and the place was pretty empty for lunch on a Saturday, so that was good for us...since we were starving.   Walked in, told the host we had 5 and was pointed to a table for 4. (They didn't lead us there....just pointed) but no problem... we grabbed a chair from the table next to the one we were assigned to, sat down and began to order. The food was just OK, 3 star quality even for a AYCE sushi place at about $22 a person. The service was slow, they had plenty of servers though. About 45 minutes into lunch....a server came to my friend who sat at the end of the table as he was eating...told him to STAND UP because "we need your chair". First response from my friend was complying... then he looked around....there were PLENTY of empty tables! So he asked....why my chair? There's a lot of chairs....so the server responded by saying "what if other people come? They will need that chair" let me repeat.... they had plenty of empty tables!! And the worst part is not that my friend was still eating his food when he was told to stand up....the worst part os that the group who the server planned to give the chair to only had 3 people...so they didn't even need the chair!   Lol....will not return....

EKVi8dj5TuXjJpgDV_FYPw.text: Came to Vegas and wanted good quality fish without the hype and price tag. We didn't have any rolls, just nigiri, and it was awesome. They don't offer sashimi on the menu, but the nigiri came cut thick with little rice and an extra piece on top. The yellow tail was awesome and if you love hot...get the 300 version. The garlic tuna should be on your list also. The only thing better than the sushi was the service. It was promoted, quick but pleasant. They offer all you can eat, but do not let you think less of the quality of fish or service they provide.

zUXm9ApsHB1OTi-1aybJ5w.text: Best sushi in the area! A lot of fish on a little rice for sushi. Seafood salad and towering sashimi poke are terrific. Super white tuna found here as well. All you can eat is the best value-more like gourmet sushi than any other place in town!

dwJt5O0YyHlbv2Urt8ChxQ.text: Wow! What a great all you can eat sushi restaurant! The quality, the creativity of the menu and the service was great even though the place was packed on a Sunday at 4 PM. Not sure we would do the all you can eat again just because it was way too much food. The menu is in-expensive enough that most folks will not eat the 24.95 a person. We are super excited to have found this place and we will be back very soon!

imLOQECnH-Tm0GlvOQ6iOQ.text: This place is the bomb, and their quick too - super fast, super fast! We ordered by pointing at yelp photos ...

UuM26cVHkaqv6R5Uv9i3OQ.text: Great sake. Great salmon (sake). The baked lobster roll was delicious. Service was very fast. Only thing is I would trade the club music for some latin jazz or something.

MBPAzuw6ZaUyIgpBvY4iPQ.text: I have been coming here since it opened and i don't ever go anywhere else. The mackerel and ikura nigiri are so frie she and flavorful. I love that there are so many options and the sake is always two for one.  Sakana is by far my favorite locals place for sushi.

5qq9lnUAgf830Gg7x3-jQg.text: My business partners and I came here for AYCE sushi lunch and it was so worth it! They were having AC problems but we didn't mind. They are very creative when it comes to the sushi roll names.   Items:  Miso Soup Garlic Edamame Burn your ass roll Lobster roll Hot mama roll  I can't remember what else but I can't wait to come back when I'm in Vegas again.

fGtQSmTfg_lWIhYsuuGREg.text: Wow! Service is awesome, my sushi came out quick and the decorations are so cute! Definitely recommend coming here!

GsNqBTpVShDVpQEcpYSPhQ.text: Best food in Las Vegas. Super great!!! I recommend the captain America it great. Drinks are good. I love the prices as well. Does not break the bank.

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bX1OBP3pu_yzhW8qcTqGMw.text: Good food, great service..visiting Las Vegas and found this place.  Had the Lobster King roll and it was delicious.  Will return again

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster King roll, yummy

B-557lD26dmvSiT0WzcIog.text: when we stopped in for lunch, there were more employees then customers - service was not an issue  I was a little surprised that this restaurant chooses to only offer the no-rice shush until the dinner menu  The biggest issue I had with eh place was that they heavily sauce EVERYTHING, not just the rolls, but mackerel and tuna was also dripping in sauce - good quality fish doesn't need to have the flavor hidden with sauce

I73eV_Oq7aoq6cL9VL6kbA.text: This place is great for AYCE sushi. Keep in mind it's AYCE fish and you'll be happy with the quality you are getting. Service was excellent. I enjoyed all the desserts so save room, the green tea pana cotta in particular.   We ordered just about everything. The appetizers were great but I wasn't too impressed with the miso soup. Some hand rolls I ordered turned into cut rolls but that's fine, I just shared with my party. This slightly became an issue because it equated into a lot of extra food. The only reason I docked a star was the "lobster" and "crab" were all imitation. I wish they stated that on the menu. I was expecting at least prawns for "lobster" like at most places.   Anyways, they took reservations for my large party and we were seated right on time. This is located across the street from the Citibank.

GAyJqwatSdgVwI67OwBwqw.text: First time at this place but service is pretty impressive! Good selections of sushi and the quality is great also! You totally get the bang for the buck!

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RgftNMRWXd73V7hmB8GLFg.text: Was hesitant to try sushi in vegas again ....we have high standards for sushi lol Hawaii eating makes it that way. This place was VERY VERY GOOD! I recommend the Hamachi Kama and baked lobster soooooo friggen ONO. We will be BACK!

QUmajpx1nvmVeMqlsJ_Nmw.text: I've tried many of AYCE sushi place in Vegas, and this is probably the best in town (definitely top 5, recently went to Jjanga and that was really good too). Sakana uses about half the rice and same amount of fish as most place (like Yama, which is in the shopping center across Maryland). The rice is nice and fluffy, sometimes a touch too loose.   I come here at least once every two weeks. That's how damn good they are. I deal mostly with nigiri only, but the few rolls I've tried have been good. If you want something spicy try the Call 911 Roll. For appetizers definitely the pang.  Best part is 2 for 1 drinks. Need I say more.

a50nXdwa7mnqNIGD9JyzYg.text: LOVE their spicy garlic edamame. The servers have a great sense of humor, and their food is even better. Definitely a gem in hole in the wall spot. Coming back again, yay for free alcohol!

pjc6Nx5q5_ox4jbhm9NbUQ.text: Cute ambience, they decorated very well, took my family here because the japanese restaurant I wanted to go to was closed, and I yelped something japanese that was open for the time I was seeking.  So, this is were we ended.  The staff was friendly, the restaurant was pretty crowded for it being 3:00pm, we opted out of the all you can eat, thank goodness because I ordered two rolls and a yellowtail sushi and it was more than enough for three people.  The rolls are giant here, so think twice.  The fish was very fresh and food came out quickly.  My sister has already returned with other friends since our last visit.

DUPHydt_emcf4yoGcgiTsA.text: Was craving some AYCE and was on this side of town, so thought I'd try a new place.  I was pretty happy with our choice of Sakana.  The main thing I remember was that our nigiri had very little rice on it, which is generous for an AYCE as you have to eat everything.  This meant I was able to cram a few extra orders of nigiri in as I wasn't stuffed with rice.  The Batman Burrito was our favorite non-nigiri item, and I think we ended up ordering 3 orders when all was said and done.  I tried a few other dishes from the kitchen which were ok, and the rolls weren't bad either, but that's not my thing.  The service was a strange mix.  They were super attentive and kept coming over to us to ask if we wanted anything else.  Unfortunately, they kept forgetting 1 item off each order, so we kept having to re-order.  Not a huge deal, but it was sort of hard to keep track of if we had gotten to try a dish.  Good value for under $25.  Uncomfortable seating, though.  Oh well, I'll be back.

MJN2qTJa8ySS3rbeVPlS_Q.text: -All you can eat for $21 (lunch) Awesome price for good sushi!  -Good varies of nigiri!! Must try -Yuzu yellow tail, 300 albacore, Amorim scallop, and Cajun tuna!  -rolls are super delicious too!! Don't skip "the shit" roll!   Will totally come back!

KqcapoBXt6CsKQbS-czhRw.text: Nothing tops this place. It's the bees knees. You should come here, especially if you do this review because then you get a free sake.   This is so awesome.

n489ew4kC2O_ydf9Z06pUg.text: This place literally may change your life. Maybe I just don't know Vegas Sushi but this by far beats any sushi I have ever had. I had the $20 AYCE sushi and all 5 rolls were amazing. They were very busy when I came but the service and rolls came out incredibly fast. It was unbelievable. So glad I came here!!!

5NGkiPHkSX5-W5SC0XEgmA.text: This is our go to place! You should try "The Shi*" cause it is the shi* foreals. Lunch is 20.95, Dinner is 25.95. It's close to other shopping areas as well and is quite close to the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

-D0_vWqv79jnvM-b9ducOw.text: 5 stars for great service 5 stars for great prices 5 stars for great selections 5 stars for small amounts of rice   A Must Order: paprika seared salmon and  there's something wrong roll

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;There&#39;s something wrong roll&#34;= soooo good!
Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The BEST AYCE in LV!!!
Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Paparika Seared Salmon= a MUST try!

tEjZx2GPAw1usdn6uUwNsw.text: Great quality Sushi and very high-volume at the restaurant. The fish is always fresh and the atmosphere is very nice. I also enjoy their free drink when leaving a comment at Yelp special.

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Good food

wZFlQ0hL3u7g1Luuz5zRFQ.text: This is probably one of the best Sushi spots! Price is reasonable for the amount of food you get!! Never disappoints!!

D76ccIHShD2iVTrJ6GrBYQ.text: Excellent service They have good quality sushi and rolls. Must try! Hidden treasure in Vegas!!!!!

9gEumLtVMSb0rrClsusEuA.text: I don't want to waste my time reviewing this place, but I will just say a few words. The rice and fish proportion was good but over all, they are not fresh, and they covered most of their sushi with too much sauce (I guess to cover their not-so-fresh fish that they serve).

PNooDRWu9LL8sj0UWRgccg.text: My wife and I came here on the recommendation of a local Las Vegas resident. We were very hesitant because I have never had a great experience at an AYCE sushi restaurant but today definitely surprised me. Every bite was delicious, the service from the entire staff was attentive and kind, and the value for what we received was fantastic. Sushi on the strip is unpredictable and pricey, if you aren't willing to drop $250.00 bucks for a great meal, this is your place. Don't miss it on your next visit to Las Vegas. Thank you Sakana.

JPzg7FfkLgFtPN8GcOeqTw.text: This is an impressive all you can eat place. Unlike most other AYCE places which try to fill you up with rice this one gives thick pieces with more fish than rice. The list of rolls were impressive. The rolls themselves were on the spicy side. We ordered one of the lobster rolls which was really yummy. We also ordered the salmon sushi which wasn't fishy and was a thick piece of fish.

Dzggwfsme84quqzOK1_L7w.text: The food is super awesome. Probably my new fave AYCE sushi spot. Although, the service is not the best. Must have the poke tower (I don't remember what exactly it's called), popcorn lobster roll, dragon ball, and "the shit" is really the shit! What I love about the sushi, besides the awesome flavors, is that they don't put much rice. I plan to be a regular here.

prqQlydZXH9020mA7qg6Mw.text: I normally don't leave any reviews for restaurants, but personally this is not an establishment I would return to. We were told that all of Las Vegas is out of uni and were told that we can look at the invoice for the past month. In addition, we were give the last two oysters of the night even though we were one of the first tables. I fully understand if restaurants run out of items, but please let us know when we are ordering instead of just telling us while bringing the dish. The Amaebi was not well cooked. The shrimp head was stale and hard. Finally, the red snapper was not snapper at all. Instead, we were given tilapia which was passed off as snapper. We were told by the owner that the market labeled the tilapia as snapper and they didn't know. Please, just be honest.

FuFY85xx_2fkG_S8meIsBw.text: Great food, great service, friendly and attentive staff, huge selection of AYCE, pleasant ambience, fair price.  Not much else to ask for.

TF8wl1ShbKomo3uFi2j_DQ.text: Excellent!!!! We found this little gem over the weekend during may vs pac fight. While everything was packed it seemed, we happened to stumble across this place. Although not a food snob of any kind, all I can say is everything we ordered was great between 2 of us. Will def eat there again when back in vegas. Glad we found this place. If you like sushi this is the place to go.

s8SstnIaST79pyHZUe8yUA.text: I love this place! The only place I go to eat sushi! The staff is very polite always checking if we're good on water or what ever the case is even when their busy.. Which is always! I come for the Nigiri rolls, the raw fish here is the best always fresh. This is the Sushi Spot. 100% I tell Everyone to come here.

EXMAk4v8OfI9MbWTYVJ1Gg.text: Best sushi in town! The staff if friendly they're fast and everything is super fresh! This place is way better than Yama! Just wished they were open a bit later!

_1r77pjC0pUl0LxlBzKRow.text: Standard AYCE sushi price, good quality. 2 for 1 drink specials all day every day. Highly  recommend the Saba and XXX Super White.

BPNOr11_E6VQQkbzMaz3Ag.text: Not even worth one star for bad service/waited almost 45mins and still people behind us got seated and refused to comp even drinks for waiting like that. So not going back, there's better places than this!!!!!!

OA2GQhol_mNJrnnUav7j9Q.text: Went here for the first time saturday coz Yama is super busy. I'd say I like this place better. A lot of choices than Yama and good food. Our server was really helpful and nice. Very good ambiance. Fast service. And very nice presentation. Will definetly comeback and recommend to friends. Keep it up Sakana!

bBe_qZQBCrptn5x0__0qCQ.text: Great service and amazing food!  The fish was fresh and the rolls were delicious. Out of all the all you can eat sushi restaurants my husband and I have tried, this is our favorite!

vhFozmFK5aUmZTLvVFLg5A.text: Don't understand why it's getting 4-5 stars... The quality of the fish is not very fresh, some even tasted fishy. I was so hungry and ready to pig out, but after I tried a few pieces of nigiri, I decide not to torture myself with substandard food on Christmas Eve. I deserve something better.  We spent only 30 min total for this meal. Didn't even want to try the desserts. There was only one server while we were there for lunch. We had to wait a long time for everything. We asked got hot tea but it was never served. I had such a high expectation for this place based on other a Yelp reviews but... Big disappointment.

xNXcqAkAMjjOYh81FAjxKQ.text: For an AYCE sushi place, it is very good. Not too much rice and the fish is pretty fresh. They put WAY too much sauce on the rolls so next time I go, I plan on ordering the sauce on the side. I got the popcorn lobster roll and it was drenched in 3 different sauces (one seemed to be just plain mayo-gross) and it kind of ruined the flavor of the roll and turned it into a goo-ey mess. I would say the $25.99 AYCE option is a great deal if you get the nigiri and no-rice plates (available only at dinner) since they give you a generous cut of fish and not too much rice. The rolls are big and quite rich so they fill you up fast. I went in starving and could not finish the 2 rolls I ordered. (I also had eaten 2 pieces of salmon sushi). My total would have been $27 if I had just ordered a la carte so I didn't really get to take advantage of the AYCE price but next time I come back, I'll be sticking to just the nigiri, sashimi salad and a hand rolls.

vRp2tXnD2XfCx3H8jNsszQ.text: I've been there for several times. The food is great for the price. But the service is awful (and for this reason I only tipped 16% for the lunch). Some of my orders are missing and they keep me waiting a long time if I want more orders (embarrassing!). I still remember the cold face of an old asian waitress who passes me as if I am invisible. The other day, I went there for lunch and they seemed just finished some renovation work. The whole room was full of paint smell which to my surprise did not worry them a bit. For one-time customers, the place is on par with other great AYCE sushi (Goyemon, Yama sushi...) you can find. For return customers, the Yama sushi across the street could be better in terms of the professional service. At least they do not make me write a complaint.

JEZteT4xlRUEXjjFhLb_DA.text: I've had friends and family from across the nation who always want to eat here and for the local family - it's a regular treat. The freshest cuisine and friendliness folks around.

Cg7c0qYEHkAntBtyu4N19Q.text: For a $22.95 all u can eat dinner, it is a good deal for an average quality sushi place. Service was great. But it is not a top quality sushi place. If u are looking for quality, go somewhere else.

m_LReG4NlLEufiH6tNKj-w.text: out of all the AYCE sushi spots in Vegas, this place takes the cake for BEST NIGIRI (i will remove this post if i find another place)! i'm not a big nigiri fan to begin with, but this place changed the game for me with all their fresh cuts and flavor. lots of choices on their menu for rolls, and finally an uncommon dessert choice - mini honey toast with ice cream!

oRdzkehVxAL1tRSrSRdv1w.text: One of my favorites in Las Vegas. Fairly priced. The chefs are extremely friendly and the waiting staff is helpful. Just a delicious all-you-can-eat buffet!

PuNhhi53CmDBKhiIrR6_tQ.text: We have been here a few times and def like it. The acye portion of the fish the first time we came were good size, with not a lot of rice. They have a huge selection of rolls and sushi(nigiri). The fish tasted fresh and place was busy every time  we've came so they must order it daily.

Xots3XG9fJPM8H2_IvyuEg.text: The spicy garlic edamame is very good. It wasn't to far from the strip either.  Would recommend for sushi

pWGU-a6Odnexr6AoHlCpOA.text: Worst service ever! We sat and waited and it took an eternity for us to receive our food. Save your money and go to Yama Sushi across the street.

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They never once asked me if I needed a refill. Very disappointed with the customer service.

DY_-p0GJHkFzk7fw2_V36Q.text: Oh my gosh I'm a loss for words about Sakana because this place is unbelievably good!

flSnc00559n-PgfeIXCRQw.text: Fantastic food! Fast, friendly service. Great environment and really nice staff! Definitely will be back! Monkey brains is my favorite! 5 stars !!!!!

Tdh6chyZuYG05fEDs2c25A.text: The a b solute best sushi in town. All you can eat is only 26 bucks and they do 2 for 1 on almost all alcohol including hot sake and beers. Order the Vegas roll and have an orgasm in your mouth. You know you want to.

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So good

iPIq71zsnVBU2p8k4ibk9A.text: This is the best sushi place ive been to and ive checked out alot of sushi spots. The customer services is great, they keep the rolls coming so your not waiting for your next order for long. The fish ratio is more than rice and everythings fresh. I highly recommend this spot check out and enjoooyyyy.

NULKzSDEu63HAn5mbnkaiA.text: The variety, quality, and value here are amazing. Haven't been in here once where it wasn't packed with people, and with good reason. The non sushi options on the AYCE are endless, and tasty. Must try if visiting Vegas or if a local like me! :P

iIBAvi5dik07ihdd-5aazA.text: Accommodated our group of 14 and great fast service with good food. Can't beat that! Ordered drinks for free for writing review.

Q2zVo4nLlNAV-Sd4IqbaFA.text: Amazing ayce sushi. As the other reviews say they have a great ratio of fish to rice in the rolls. Also alcohol is 2 for 1 so my mom and I each had a glass of wine and the total for that was $6 (which in my opinion is a good price for one glass). We had nigiri, rolls, and a hand roll, the "batman burrito".

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Batman burrito

9xC5hiirpgJF0VMeVYX0zw.text: I think I may have finally found my spot for sushi in this neighborhood. I got the sushi lunch special (6 nigiri plus a spicy tuna roll) for $12.95. All of the cuts of fish looked were aesthetically pleasing (nothing mangled), and were of a good size. Tuna roll was a tuna roll....pretty hard to screw that up, I enjoyed it. I'll be back, glad I tried it out today.

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $12.95 lunch special (also includes miso soup).

LEQQOjnvQnoZ6njn9XeIJw.text: One of my favorite spots for AYCE. Nigiri rice to fish ratio is excellent. Overall dope place

Hh4QlKh4vQt6EcfpnwpIQA.text: Great value AYCE sushi. The appetizers were great and the rolls were in good proportions. The wait is a little long and there is a lot of tempura on the menu but besides that it was wonderful!

SZMdij1cwSnz-YZuq6DAWQ.text: Comes here every time we are in Vegas. The best sushi anywhere.  They have so many kinds of sushi that LA don't even have.  Service is always great.

9SBwXk_Nm2gKJGfTWq-CSg.text: Very nice quality as AYCE in Vegas. I've been many disappointing sushi AYCE here but sakana definitely change my opinion! Will come back for sure!

Ai2NWClthUJCT2Emr1g-IA.text: My go to sushi place near campus. Always fast, friendly, and fun. One of the best all you can eat deals in town. Come hungry.

cTZrIUXOrLfrg_J8FfOLVA.text: Best ayce. Good service and the sushi was fresh. Large selection of sushi rolls. A little off of the strip which makes it not crowded and a nice ambience. A good place for a good, quick, cheap bite.

ec-K-QYssm5m-9D0uznnIw.text: This place is so delicious. We use to be regulars at yama sushi, but this place blows every other sushi place out of the water. The quality of fish they use was delicious and fresh. The service both times was great even though they were busy. The only downside is it is a small place, so at times it can get a little congested, but overall excellent food and wonderful service.

kLTT07blbdBc4oWn6GKN4Q.text: The buffet was a good choice.  We ate about double what we would've had to pay for without the AYCE.  Good quality dishes.  Sorry, I forgot what was good and what I would pass on but most of the dishes I didn't like, my sister's did so it's mostly personal preference.

LmeB5RjSpPMJ6wgZnVzbZQ.text: Decided to try a new place for AYCE Sushi and was glad I did. This place was excellent!  We went a little early so there was no wait and the wait staff kept coming over to ask for more orders.  They had a buy one, get one drink special that we used to get 2 orders of sake. We kept ordering rolls and nigiri sushi. All were delicious! Seriously top quality for being a land-locked state :)  Would definitely go back, but bring your appetite.

Dle_xOogNokl2B1pASMnHQ.text: Because it is all you can eat type place, they don't use the best quality fish. It was pretty fresh but I can tell from my many years of working in a fish market.....

uOW6tcGHbljxbx-YPw2pLg.text: Best sushi spot in vegas hands down! The nigri here is out of this world. Extremely fresh with a more than generous fish to rice ratio. Cannot beat it especially for.the price.

Their appetizer's are to die for- I suggest everyone try "the shit" appetizer, because it is..well.. I don't know how else to say, THE SHIT! I would definitely recommend coming and trying, the servers and staff are all very friendly and very attentive, I'd give more stars if I could based on just the service alone, and even more stars for the sushi! The fish are VERY fresh, not a bad taste in my mouth throughout. The only take away would be it is very chilly due to all the fans running. OVERALL I WOULD COME HERE AGAIN AND AGAIN AND AGAIN ETC ETC THIS IS MY NEW SUSHI SPOT

D_GGboyrRjryjXJaVGDkJw.text: We got here a few minutes before three but we were seated right after three and they made us pay the dinner price even though we technically got there before three. Other than that the place is awesome! I love the lemon salmon roll!

pp60e3MSgW-qVvK-nUmj2Q.text: Wow. I came here for the AYCE. The service was very friendly and prompt. The "fish to rice" ratio here is ridiculously awesome. They have all of the basics on the menu and most things are pretty fresh. The uni, however, was kind of old and gooey.   Sakana is located in the Target plaza on Maryland and Flamingo. It's the very last shop on the north flamingo side. The interior decor was so-so.   I think if they could easily become a more popular place if they liven up the atmosphere a bit.

KmK88d5qOA-fCEnZudgI0w.text: Came here on a busy Saturday night a received our food fast. everyone is really friendly and the sushi is AMAZING!! *Monster Roll and Pang is a must try

50MVSBL5SUTdHYTswpTBpg.text: Great food with fast service as well as people. We all enjoyed the place will be back soon .

4n8WnY609i2YT9UBfB_lMA.text: Never had a bad experience here.  Sushi is very fresh and the staff is always so friendly.

6zhF5kB7EPv8Oy35rHIQhg.text: The service and food are on point here. The waiters are really quick to refill your waters and take any empty plates away. Regarding my previous and them forgetting orders, I haven't had any problems since my last few visits. I've gotten everything I've ordered. I think Sakana is such a great value. Delicious food for an awesome price. Thanks Carlos, Sung and all the other staff of Sakana.

rO-BPEhQo3g4FOFtkZPmzg.text: I'm not a fan of most sushi restaurants in Vegas. There are a couple expensive ones on the Strip that are great but pricey, and otherwise there are very few spots that I like in a more affordable price range.  Sakana, however, far exceeds my expectations. The chefs will talk with you, they're very friendly, and offer excellent recommendations. If you ask for whatever is good that day, you will get some great sushi, and it won't be the same every time either. I've already been here 3 times since I found out about it a month ago, and each time I've been served a different array of dishes, every single one of them outstanding.  But the most impressive thing about Sakana is that they actually cook great sushi rice. This is very rare for sushi restaurants in Vegas, and in my opinion makes a huge difference in the quality of the meal.  On top of the excellent food and chefs who I love, the prices are fantastic. At $22.95 for all-you-can-eat dinner as well as 2-for-1 beers during happy hour, the check will be about the same as any other all-you-can-eat sushi place in town, but the meal will be a hundred times better.  I urge you to sit at the sushi bar. The chefs are engaging and entertaining, but they will give you time to talk among yourselves when appropriate. And if you're adventurous (or already know how amazing it is), order quail egg, because it's one of the best things I've ever eaten anywhere.

YefW3oITlRXxzr7RGGb3Fg.text: Amazing again. My favorite roll is the Kiss of Fire. So fantastic.  Thank you for the awesome experience.

ipU1oSlOKCp9KZL7NuAgxQ.text: This is by far THE BEST sushi place I have ever been too.  They never let me down, I will keep coming back for as long as I live.

l2G4iMF6PWP5Gh6Pq6ISKw.text: I am really happy they replaced Kabuki!  The sushi chefs here are so friendly and attentive.  Even when we sat at a table with the kids they took the time to listen to our customization (hubby likes super spicy but hates garlic and mayo.  I eat anything as long as it isn't spicy, my son likes spicy but not too much and loves cream cheese).  They also have special dishes on the weekend, which so far have been wonderful!  I like that not everything is a roll or drowned in sauce.  Definitely try the Scallop Nigiri, no mayo, the amaebi with the head fried, the toro steak if they have it, and the Sakana Poki.  The sashimi salad is good (the shrimp tempura is sometimes a little stale but otherwise great dish).  My younger son loves the short ribs, he had three bowls.  The shrimp tempura is a little different than other places, the batter is different but tasty.    Definitely come give them a try!  Worth the drive from other parts of town.

GZU-xvt6kKIyLRCRsThHqg.text: EVERYTHING here is FANTASTIC,,,,BUT THE Towering Sashimi Poki is INSANE!!!! Also the Baked Lobster Roll and the Baked Scallop Roll are a must try. Not a bad thing on the menu!!!!

8lJWjx_005wQqvI7SddQtA.text: Being from Southern California and right next to the coast id like to think we have some good sushi. Just stopped by this place and I'd like to start by saying the service is great.. The servers were very attentive and polite.. I got " The Shit" and veggie Tempura to start. Both were good the "The Shit" is a must just like the menu says.. Also got the lemon salmon roll and some super white tuna on the side. The lemon roll was good just like at home for me. The super white was freaking good also got the Pork Belly which was amazing!!! And beer is 2 for 1.. Will definitely be stopping by while I'm in Vegas!!

P2K-CXtRDLLVQIP_MCAEmg.text: Reasonable quality for an All you can eat . What made my experience much better was how great was Jose's customer service ... Will be back for sure and if he is not there Im leaving .thank you

As busy as it was our service was great and food arrived quickly.  Lots of rolls to choose from, as well as a large selection of appetizers.

vHmoNBAUw0guXlLQzwVZxQ.text: Great sushi, all you can eat and 2 for 1 special. Really close to UNLV, plenty of parking and cool Japanese harbor like design gives the fish place an authentic atmosphere. Highly recommended!

Ek2hdtA-A1JdBDq2AksWFw.text: This place is authentic and affordable for what you get! I had pork belly, gyoza and a variety of sushi an rolls. Nothing to complain about.   We did all you can eat for lunch and were not overwhelmed with rice which a lot of all you an eat places do (you end up with a big ball of rice with a tiny piece of fish). Here, it was not the case. Generous pieces if fish on just a small ball of rice.    This is Japan in America. Love it!

o8MY4gOYQoHef2LKZA28AA.text: The best AYCE sushi in Las Vegas! My boyfriend recommended this place and I was hooked. The restaurant's atmosphere made me feel very comfortable and welcomed. Their sushi chefs and waiters were super friendly :D  Oh my goodness, I love love love their AYCE menu. EVERYTHING we ordered was perfect! I can't believe I never knew about this place until a month ago. I always thought Kaya was the best but not anymore lol. Definitely a must-try!!

9s1mccImXWsLlDVs-69TWw.text: Can I just live here? The food was amazing. Looking back at the pic I took during our dinner reinforces how much I NEED this place in my life. They can do away with the staff that sacrifices service for efficiency. I need some alone time with the never ending sushi.

yt_l-XGSUQbxKNOiLYeCIA.text: $25 for all you can eat buffet is something you'll get in NY anytime. Salmon, eel, tuna and the typical stuff.   But here in Sakana, you'll get anything and everything. The menu is fair game with fresh delicious cuts of fish. From uni, salmon belly, fresh umami, shrimp heads, garlic tuna, albacore, snapper, specialty sushi pieces and 100 other different things I can't remember.   This is by far the best all you can eat sushi houses I've ever been to. The best thing about it is, they don't give you enormous amounts of rice that other places do to fill you up.   The staff is very friendly and answers any questions you have. The sushi chef offers jokes, compliments and just generally a warm and friendly guy.   This place is a must for any sushi fans, hungry or not. You can't beat $25.

dMd6CAjXiEOuucg4B6WxdQ.text: Here's whats worth ordering (best first):  1) Salmon belly (limit 1) 2) Poke stack (limit 1) 3) Garlic tuna 4) Super white tuna 5) Ocean trout (limit 1)  Here's what wasn't so good:  6) Scallop - I thought this was going to be a single piece of raw scallop but it was small pieces of not fresh cooked scallop. Not good...  7) Uni - Ugh, i'm disappointed this wasn't good but it didn't taste fresh at all - very salty and tasted too much like the sea. Disappointing because this is one of the "limit 1" items and would've made the dinner more worth it if it was good!  8) Seafood salad - chopped up (probably not the freshest) cuts of various fish including tuna, salmon, hamachi etc. The quality of fish in this is clearly not as good as what you would get in nigiri , hence why they douse it in sauce. The benefit is no rice though. Tradeoffs...  Overall, this place offers AYCE for a really good value. Its also worth noting that the service is impeccable here. Even if you aren't even remotely finished with your order, a waiter will come by to ask you what you want next. Same for the drinks. They definitely run a tight ship here.

46p86S9CpEj6evdkeh98Qg.text: Saw the reviews and photos and couldn't wait to try this place.  That was a good decision.    Came here for AYCE.  They have a good list of items, and one of the best things about this place is they offer half orders (for most sushi rolls).  I noticed alot of their items are similar to the items that are in Sumo Sushi or Jjanga.  They also have some korean food, and I'm curious if they are affiliated with Hwaro....only because the first time I tried "the Shit" was in Hwaro, and they offer than same "the Shit" here in Sakana.    They have every time of fish, including my favorites that cannot be found in all places: super white tuna, salmon belly, and yellowtail belly.  They are very generous with their portions to.  I like that they put some kind of sauce in their nigiris so it doesn't taste too plain.    They rolls were good.  I got the Something Wrong roll, which has the fried soft shell crab on the inside, and two pieces of fish on the outside with garlic ponzu sauce.  One of my favorites.  Also tried some of their spicy rolls, and yes they were spicy!    Also on of my favorites about this place is the desserts.  Most AYCE only offer one thing of dessert, but you can order some of the dessert items more than once (except ice cream).    Being in an older location (and maybe it was wrong for me to judge a restroom based on this), the restroom is very clean.  There's a floor lamp and Hello Kitty painted on the back of the women's restrooms.    This has definitely become one of my favorite sushi places.

NhnzhghzX6ixxMgDlEwz5w.text: Despite them being on dirty dining, we have still been loyal customers. If I could give 0 stars, I would. My family and I have been regulars here for a few years, but we are never going there again. Not because of the food, but the worst service that progressively keeps getting worse every visit. This is due to a woman named Anna, she is always there and she loves to throw plates on the table. It seems to be her thing to make the costumers feel horrible for dining there. Many occurrences happened this time, once was that we asked to add a table from someone since we had a toddler in our party. They said yes, but Anna and one other man named Edwin attempted to scold us, persecuting us without letting us explain ourselves. Saying to put the table back now and to squeeze in. Even though half of the restaurant, including the middle table was empty. Who does that? And, of course, plate throwing this time, one time threw it on top of my aunty's sunglasses too. She yelled at us for being a large party (6 of us with 2 small kids) that should be aware that people are waiting, not once, but twice. Neither times she talked to us was before our 1.5 hours were up. When we asked to talk to her manager, she said said we had 5 minutes left and kept talking over us saying, "I know, I know, I know", rolling her eyes, glaring at us, then said there's no manager. This is only a little bit of what she's done. I have never met someone as rude as her! Every time we go, she ends up being our server. So around the last 5 times, we have been treated badly with her stuck up attitude and annoyed demeanor. If you see her, run! She will ruin your day every time. We are respectful people, my parents have been in this industry, like she has. There's no excuse that she treats the customers like a burden when sakana's motto is "our family works hard for your smile".

Very friendly waiters and atmosphere. Definitely coming back and recommend to everyone!

6iICtXxlYoNHR9cA5-NqRQ.text: Sakana is a great option for AYCE sushi. It has great vibes, and is close to campus which makes it convenient for college students at UNLV. The menu is updated and even better than before. I definitely recommend Sakana.

Sf6s_lViTm5nUwEEdFwLaw.text: Great place, if a little bit out of the way if you're in Las Vegas without a car. Even though we paid a hefty cab fare there and back from our hotel near the Strip, as I had suspected after reading reviews and seeing the strip-mall address, the food was really great at an unbelievably great price. My nephew opted for the $25 all you can eat, I went a la carte. In either case, the fish was great quality, even Uni was fresh and yellow, the sushi chef, even though not Japanese and he explained on his first day there, he certainly knew his stuff and delivered quickly, joyfully, and very tasty. Rolls, nigiri, seaweed salad, cooked dishes, all were very, very good.  I've eaten sushi all over the world, and this can stand up to most places I've enjoyed.  Don't hesitate, get yerself there!

9vs00ZNu5d4BSx6oAF7KsA.text: Had a great experience. The ambiance is lively with cool art work and Japanese music videos on the TV's. The wait staff is super friendly and attentive. The food was delicious. Our son ordered two of the baked rolls and liked them. We had some miso soup, seaweed salad and three rolls. Hawaiian roll was my favorite. Everything came out in a timely manner. Well presented and fresh. We will definitely be back.

fBVA92dCDlKnCBnZou5Elg.text: Best option for AYCE sushi in Vegas. It's not that far from the strip and definitely worth the cab ride. We went for lunch so uni was not included. The salmon was so fresh and the rest of the rolls were tasty. They definitely don't skimp out on the fish as the salmon pieces were big. They do offer half rolls so you can try more.   There's also BOGO on alcohol throughout the day. We arrived relatively early for lunch  and the whole placed was almost full. I can only imagine how busy it must be during peak dinner time. The servers were very patient and friendly too. They cleared the tables quickly and always asked if we wanted to order more. They've also got a cute hello kitty women's bathroom!

tpXcqc1ncoO7fWIkMy2bjQ.text: Holy moly!  You better come hungry and they will fill you up but good at Sakana.  It's a quick 5 minute cab or uber ride from Bally's/ Flamingo/ Caesar's corner.  Nondescript shopping center but hopping busy place inside. I ate at the bar and they really worked quick.  They had lots of specialty rolls and let me order 1/2 portions so I could try a variety.  What a treat.  Two for one beers too.  I'd say this is a Vegas find!  All you can eat was only $25.95.  In a sea of overpriced food, this was a great value and good tasting too. Well, I'm back again!  Love this Vegas treat.

CijCDdhvxvDbQGHj56n_iQ.text: Been here several times for all you can eat.  Both times food was great. Sushi was fresh tasting. Service was quick. Always busy!  We went on a Monday once and a Sunday another time and both times a wait!

koIBqJWn8T976YE_06qSWw.text: This place is the best sushi I've had in Vegas yet. Go get it , you won't be disappointed, and I know my fish. Get the 25.00 all you can eat and order the salmon belly and the towering sashimi . It is awesome. One of the many things I loved about this place is the fish on the nigiri is huge and the rice is tiny so you get a lot of fish for your money. Just about everything I tried was good. I highly recommend this place but go early they get crowded.

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My wife and I seen good reviews so we tried it, this is our new place when we come to Vegas. Killer sushi

KFHkf-vLYJBMaNVwP3B1dw.text: Coming from OC/LA California, I've been to quite a few sushi buffets in my life. This place is well in the top 3.  Usually at ayce sushi places, I take out some of the rice. However, over here the sushi was fresh and the fish to rice portion is amazing (lots of fish, less rice). For $20.95 per lunch, it's hard for me to imagine how this place makes money.  Must try if you're in the mood for sushi in the area.  PS this is a Korean owned sushi restaurant. You can always tell by the taste of the miso soup.

2AB94ZEwcr_fnG7jROM-4w.text: Pinkie sized rice with palm sized sashimi is called sushi??!! Why I never....  I must admit when I was told about this place I was a little skeptical. I was ranted about this place like no other. After all, the LA pride in me refused to believe that LV would have a sushi place that is close to what my home town can offer, but there it is!   Everything was excellent. I strongly suggest you try the sushi instead of the rolls. Just look at the rice! You can barely find them!!!! This be my new favorite spot in LV for sushi! Hey it rhymed, haha

MlmP70IRqmp3MeK_V9RpXQ.text: Came here for all you can eat lunch for $20 per person. Pretty worth it in my opinion with a huge variety of things to choose from!   My favorite was definitely the recommended "The Shit" and Dragon ball.   Would recommend coming earlier than when you plan to eat as the line was pretty long even at 1PM.

sPB4J4gLpCn2SFICcAcYaQ.text: Terrible !!!  Do not come and eat here. Bad attitude. Fish not really fresh. We are getting AYCE SUSHI. They are out of Uni, Sweet shrimp, oyster, ocean trout. Those premium are out and still charge us full price. Feel like they out premium sushi. The rice with fish ratio is too much. Not worth it.

7R8Y_iT7C8_jQcrjKMD_HQ.text: Best sushi spot off the strip!!! I loved the Hawaiian roll and the Cajun tuna was my favorite as well! My friends and I went there on a Saturday night and the wait time was 45 minutes but the food was well worth the wait!

xVs84sf9HZtRVtJ9aC-z0g.text: Sushi sizes were massive. I frequent Goyemon on Decatur and Sushi Factory on Rainbow and nothing compared to this place in terms on fish to rice ratio.  My first reaction to our first plate made me gasp because I didnt expect it to look so authentic and fresh. I mean, the fish pieces were huge and you could hardly see the rice.  Food tasted great except the salmon skin roll, it was extremely sweet which made it hard to finish.  Comparing this location to others, my biggest gripe is that there are too many choices that are limited to one order only such as, salmon belly (at goyemon its unlimited until it runs out).  I also like my fish without sauces but almost every sushi came out seasoned to some extent whether it was with ponzu or cream based. However, some people may like it and I enjoyed it as well but I may not have known if there is a plain option.  My overall experience was great and it truly does get busy which is a good sign of a successful business. I would say to try it and judge it for yourself.

reqNVnVy6IIVQZlEtE_0Yg.text: Best all you can eat sushi place we found in Vegas! The price is fair compared to what you can order, (the whole menu!!)   They give out more protein than rice on their nigiri, they have fast services even on a busy night. The place is decorated beautifully and overall a fun environment to eat and have hang out with friends and love ones.  I would definitely recommend this place to bring your date, friends, family or any other love ones to.

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Some more of the sushi we ordered

2WiPoT_wXOJzp0UHrXI8oA.text: The Manager was very attentive to our large party and the AYCE was the best deal around.  A must try is the 49ers roll!!

-staPdaoPzEFv4t9NST0Qw.text: Very good sushi but their customer service need to keep up with their food, the guy did not let us sit at the table but the bar because no more table for 2, he said either at the bar or wait and he had no idea how long the wait was.  But unfortunately there were many tables for 4 and the shop was not that busy at all. Until we left, those table for 4 were still empty. Sometimes you need to be flexible and make customers feel you treat them nicely.  Besides that everything else is perfect. The chief at the bar also asked if we need anything else which is really nice of him. That isnt his job.  Really recommend Pang bread.

u9X-U7cuk-jKoONFaL0D5Q.text: Hands down best sushi place I've ever been to. The fish was fresh and given in sizable pieces in comparison to the rice. The presentation at this location is also top notch. They have a HUGE variety of items to choose from on the menu, many with fun names. I loved that they kept their AYCE prices constant across the days because I've seen places where they would charge the dinner price on weekends regardless of the time. The place was clean and space wasn't an issue. They have tables of all sizes to accommodate for your party.

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Something Went Wrong Roll. Loved the addition of the soft shelled crab!

sylNicCQHKZCjNf7Wa2SXg.text: Reservations is a must because this place gets packed!  All you can eat fresh sushi? What more can I say?  I'm not talking cheap grade fish. The food served here is excellent. From uni to hamachi, the boast a wide variety of sashimi to exotic rolls.   The servers are quick and orders fly out of the kitchen. The portions are perfect and you will leave Sakana full and satisfied!  When in Vegas, this is a must GO!

JOTHkNLosWrtfXiu7ByREA.text: I had the ultimate AYCE sushi for lunch @sakana_lasvegas ! Talk about food coma! That's exactly what happened yesterday!  It's been so long since I've dined in here. The place had some renovations which totally added a more modern look and feel to it. The fish to rice ratio here is excellent! They are seriously generous with their delicious nigiri  selections and that's what we mostly ordered. This place is always busy. It's popular to both locals and visitors alike. It's only minutes from the strip. Bookmark this place if you ever plan to visit Vegas!

-Zbd4sg7cJXXR1AEXFiprw.text: Sakana definitely gave my boyfriend and I favorite AYCE restaurant a run for their money. My boyfriend and I love Nigiri and they have so many wonderful selections. We ordered salmon, lemon seared salmon, yellowtail, albacore, 300 albacore, shrimp tempura, and gyozas. We ordered a golden philadelphia roll and a monkey roll but we weren't big fans. The fish to rice ratio was amazing with so much more fish than rice. We would strongly recommend paying the extra dollars for dinner as some of the most delicious items are served only during dinner; ocean trout and salmon belly.  Sakana has no wait when we went but it is a Thursday early afternoon.   We love all the nigiri ! We will be back!  The customer service could be a bit more warm but they still did very well. I was pleasantly satisfied.

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Hlb1iUWQOAtTQkaF3PQO9A.text: Horrible service. We waited there for 20 min,completely ignored  for a party for 3, when they had tables available.

PzS3WMB8OQb81BP5SxsZcQ.text: Never been to an ayce sushi in Vegas before but it tops everything I've had in Chicago

lQcsek4Ppc_3_3LziZ1FjQ.text: The fish tastes great. Everything is fresh.  And the price is just over 20 for lunch. Much better than many other ayce sushi in Vegas. Excellent place.

N0Y5WTz-C-CUmzkEh442sQ.text: Sakana has really good fish. The quality of the fish that they serve is amazing. Unfortunately I had to give this place three stars because the service is quite horrendous.   Upon entering the restaurant, there were at least five dirty tables. The waiting area is very small and all the people who were waiting in the front of the door were waiting for to be seated due to the dirty tables. First of all it's literally a fire hazard to be blocking the door like that. I understand they were short staffed, but it's literally like this every time I come to eat at this restaurant.   We were seated but didn't receive menus, or even water. Management needs to address these concerns quick. If you got bad service, then the business may suffer no matter how great the food is.

xr9T1DhKcXo5eLpvn8MVQA.text: The FoodLoverNYC loves the food quality and gives it the superyumm approval. It also reasonable prices and i would like to apologize for writing not more but we feasr.

hYjDxNLalpeYg6ebXvQiYw.text: To this day, this is the best AYCE sushi place I've tried in my LIFE! I was skeptical at first because it is in a bad location, however never judge a book by its cover! The inside decor is modern with lanterns and fairy lights. The noise level is moderate to loud.   The fish to rice ratio on the nigiri is insane and you're basically eating sashimi because there is just a tiny ball of rice under a thick piece of fresh fish. There is a 2 for 1 special on the alcoholic drinks as well if you decide to get saki, soju, wine, beer, etc. Lunch price is fair, just a little under $21 and a little under $26 for dinner. They should be charging more for the quality they present, and we waited 40 min for a table and I wasn't upset one bit.  Came with a party of 5, and once we ordered, our food was out on the table within 10 min! Quick, fast, fresh, and it left everyone impressed. We were full and only stayed for less than 50 min.   Definitely would come here again when I'm in town!

Mt6evgGpVdvgBP8k3sHHig.text: This is by far my favorite all you can eat sushi place in the country. We waited in the line for an hour but the food and services are totally worth it. They keep a high level of food quality despite its buffet style. I would definitely recommend yall to try it.

psEvzB3CCntA7yWh82VUiw.text: I definitely would recommend coming here for all you can eat sushi. The seafood pieces are fresh and tasty. The rice portions are perfect not too big. The service is great and friendly (David was our server.)

-bb9ALLRvguGwUnSsmQ8Vw.text: This review is for AYCE sushi...because MAN I love Sakana! If you're looking for a central location with good service and fresh fish, this is the place to go.   They have a great variety of appetizers (mussels, tempura, bacon wrapped scallops, edamame, miso soup, calamari, seaweed salad, pork belly, etc) and lots of rolls for those who liked savory, sweet, baked, fresh, and spicy! You'll find favorites such as one minute man, wet dream, and snow in Vegas (which I thought were only at Yama, but it looks like they're here also!)   Here's my favorite favorite part about Sakana. AND I'm sure it's other nigiri lovers' favorite also. THE FISH TO RICE RATIO = BEAUTIFUL. Gorgeous amount of fresh fish on top of a small bed of rice. THATS the best.   Like dessert? Choose an ice cream AND a features dessert on the menu. End it with a not so fishy taste for that sweet tooth!

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 12 orders of Salmon Nigiri because that&#39;s how we AYCE

4M2MoCghWnr48f9BVd5WBg.text: Ok for AYCE sushi this place definitely hits the spot. They have excellent service, constantly refilled drinks, constantly grabbed finished plates and asked if you're ready for more. What more could you ask for? Oh and the fish is pretty good, nice selection, prepared well and made quickly to order. And for $25.95 for dinner...I mean come on.

ky0ssWOyfZ3l-DlTcrawow.text: Hands down the best sushi place in Las Vegas. Or even Nevada to be honest. I lived in Reno and Las Vegas, and I don't think there are any good sushi restaurants in between. This place is always PACKED. Be prepared to wait especially during dinner time. No wonder, because their fish to rice ratio is HUGE for their nigiri (big fish and little rice). That is how it should be. At Sakana when you pay for AYCE sushi you are definitely going to get it here. Their rolls are also tasty, and they have a wide selection.   Service is excellent! Very attentive and finished plates are cleared readily so you could have room for new dishes. Waters always filled, staff say excuse me when they accidentally bump into you, etc.   To top it off they have a wide selection for their dessert! Green tea pana cada had a strong matcha flavor and was very pleasant because it wasn't so sweet. They also have ice cream, mochi ice cream, mini honey toast, and more!   I would definitely recommend this place! Check it out when you're in town (:

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Look at the size of this salmon!

W10_7njJSQug2JQbsKOZAg.text: Greatest ALL YOU CAN EAT SUSHI ever! I wish we had this back at home. Looks like this is an every Vegas Trip stop. You won't regret any of the food you get. Hands down, Must Go To Eat!!! And dessert!!!

3dq0fF7ENcYCUhVkkbl-Yg.text: Yelp's rating was very misleading.  The quality of the fish was poor and the service was even worse. Our server,didn't bring us half of the things we ordered.  We got tired of waiting and called it a night.  Definitely had better ayce sushi, quality and service.

k3fx5uZKsnZxb-58mi_HmA.text: If you're doing all you can eat, and you enjoy your specialty rolls and apps this is your new favorite spot  -the entire extensive menu is included in the AYCE-   It's a little loud being near campus but generally a good crowd, great service and quality fish every time.  Cheap drinks and lively and talkative sushi chefs.

yK7olZwNyL75kZWt56gaXw.text: Been here so many times and this place never disappoints! I've tried my share of sushi places in town and no place has come close. The icing on the cake is it's all you can eat dinner for $26, including appetizers and desserts. Every single item we ordered was fresh and delicious. Service was perfect and on time with everything we ordered. We always order hot sake and a large Sapporo (and it's always 2 for 1). The beer is always cold and they chill their glasses which makes it that much more refreshing. Appetizers, I highly recommend the jalapeno bomb, baked green mussels, pork belly, spicy garlic edamame, bacon and lobster skewer. For rolls, the summer crunch roll, lemon shrimp roll,  call 911, wet dream and the lobster king roll. Definitely owe it to yourself and try it out for yourself

TvqBbEAo2RiWyUJ7rcRwsg.text: Seafood is very fresh and I like their small rice Sushi. Some of the Sushi was too much flavor for me because I like simple no flavor fresh Sushi (Just soy sauce and wasabi). The service is not so good but I understand they are busy and it's very reasonable price.

aMDMtjteVgaxcpVxSadvDg.text: The freshest sushi I have eaten for long time. We were 12 people. It was a wait because of our large group but the wait was worth it. I usually don't like all you can eat places because they compromise the quality with the quantity. Not here though . Everything we ordered was fresh. My family is very big fan of sushi and they know good from the bad. Everyone complemented the food.  We had Bon for the server. He is one of the best server we ever had. He was very kind and helpful. Everything was on the table right away . It's hard to get order from so many. My family is demanding. He satisfied everyone. We were very thankful to him. He made our day special .   I strongly recommend this place. The Ocean Trout and Salmon Nigiri were our favorite.  Don't leave without the desert. That's included in the " all you can eat menu" .you will not regret leaving some room for desert.

DxNFmTn0m5gU58fRnXFTIw.text: There's a lot of choices when it comes to AYCE sushi. Lunch here is $21 before 3pm then dinner goes up to $26.   Certain items like salmon belly is only available for dinner. But really most will be satisfied by specialty rolls. Must try appetizer is called 'the shit'.  Compared side to side to Yama Sushi, I think Sakana is little bit higher quality, friendly staff, one suggestion is to add galbi beef short rib and no rice rolls.

7bFFP3_XwZmyStEbQSLvVQ.text: First time here and we definitely will come back. It's AYCE sushi! Fish fresh and service was excellent. Food delivered to my table really fast. There's probably a longer wait if you come at peak hours. We came at 4pm, waited about 15 mins and got us a table. Overall a great experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hvCHweUpGFdLKRj9ZKlcJw.text: Not bad for all you can eat for $27. Fish was fresh but was doused in ponzu sauce (which I personally don't mind)  I ordered: * white tuna (must get) * ocean trout (must get) * garlic tuna  * hamachi with jalapeno * salmon roe  I recommend skipping the rolls. Expect to wait an hour or more. Don't bother trying to call, they never pick up!

75mwSaJeJpWHL8VzFiFDaA.text: This place was solid for sure. It started off well and it ended well and I admire the system they have going on here. There's one thing that stood out from our meal here. The nigiri rice wasn't that great and the fish was very big pieces. Although it was very good i dont feel like its traditional. The sauces that they used were good. I rank this as maybe my second or third favorite sushi place in town because the experience was a happy one. The one thing I hate the most about going to an AYCE sushi spot is when your service messes up the food experience. Like for example when a server asks if you're sure you will finish what you order but here you don't get that these guys running the show are very nice and they give you suggestions and they accommodate you with a smile. Thanks guys I'll be back or for sure order some lunch since I do work down the street!

gLH7lef8EZHx8uNLR2maeA.text: Best all you can eat sushi place in Vegas. I've tried 3 different ayce sushi places with great reviews on Yelp and this came out the best. The nigiri has great fish rice ratio( large piece of fish and tiny piece of rice). Beside the good price for the ayce, the prices on drinks are very fair too. Soda/tea is only $1.5. The service was quick too. I like it so much that I came here twice during my visit to Vegas. Will definitely go back next time I am in Vegas!

It was so disappointment in terms of freshness and the service attitude. Yellowtail and Tuna are tasted sour due to decay of fishes. 4kj892V-kO3J32uEi6THQw.text: WORST place I have ever been too, food way pricey for very tiny portions and I forgot my sandals there so I called the next day to see if they were there and I was informed they had them in the lost and found for me. When I went the next day I was told they were not in the lost and found and had to speak with 3 people about calling the lady I spoke with to ask where they were. They pretended to not know who I was talking about like they did not know what staff they had working that day AND once they said it might of been the host told me they did not have a number to call her . HOW the hell do you not have a way of getting in contact with your employee ? The MANAGER was the one arguing with me very unprofessional like she did not care at all to try and help me and told me she had no number for this worker or any way of finding out who it was . The manager INGRID is a real unprofessional rude lady she shouldn't even be a manager there. They probably take home all of the lost and found for themselves at the end of the night ! But even if that was the case nobody could tell me that. They alll just pretended to be stupid so I drove 30minutes there and 30 minutes back for no reason ! never returning to this place again

fn22XNNPEzAgfsk1wN9aig.text: First time ever eating sushi and I enjoyed it. I  had the all you can eat sushi dinner and Of Course I didn't eat anything raw lol.. would highly recommend to sushi lovers..

S3cXiakGHyhMoWYTw2OvWg.text: Jason is the reason I gave bad review. He was extremely rude to his customers. When I first came in, Jason put my name down and said it would be an hour wait without giving me the vibrating device. About 10 minutes later, I found out Jason did not give me the device (each device has its own number), so I went back to him. Later on, I asked if the number on the device affects the waiting. Jason rudely blamed on me that I put the name myself, that's why I didn't get device. I immediately pointed out that he put my name, he did not even apologize and gave me a shitty look. I later on returned the device and said that I could not stand their customer service, I needed to leave. Jason replied,"don't come back"  Yes, I would never come back.

us-laPwTZjE39BTUPJxJ2Q.text: Amazing sushi! If you love nigiri, you will love how they prepare theirs... lots of fish and a small amount of rice. AYCE is the way to go (at dinner AYCE is even more generous). This was my first time, and I'm never going anywhere else! See the pictures, you will understand.

TGg5KWuFPAEedydq1LHaaw.text: BEST AYCE SUSHI IN LAS VEGAS.  I have never been to a AYCE sushi spot where the starters and non sushi items are just as good, or even better! I recommend the fried rice and the pork belly! the shumai is deep fried,  but just so good! All their portions are perfect size so you don't have to fear about over eating! *Food was so good i didn't even take pictures :(*  HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

My friends that are foodies recommend Sakana as one of the best restaurants in Las Vegas.   Huge recommends: sashimi poke, fresh wasabi, yellowtail nagari, super white tuna and quail egg

But the food came out quick and the service was top notch 3 waiters going around and taking orders asking if everything is ok and refilling out drinks.   It was pretty dam the best all you can eat sushi bar so far in terms of service and food. Definitely will be going there again.

wHN446hF6ZRuCusn4hllDQ.text: Servers soaks    you get seek after the 1st byte and you have to pay the whole $26  We ask the server if we can pay for the rool and he say no you have to pay for the whole dinner

GM83gJsPK7ORE3L5RNrC4A.text: I finally found a sushi that I like! Went tonight 1-8-16 for their $25.95 AYCE around 6:30 PM. This restaurant is located adjacent to the Target shopping center on Maryland and Flamingo.  Shout-out to my Yelp pal Gregg W. who just happened to stroll in while we were chowing down!     The ambiance is casual but their food is totally upscale.  I was amazed at how quickly the food came out!  Seriously we must not have waited 2 minutes for our food and it was all hot and fresh and delicious.    Items selected:  Scallop & bacon skewer- Delicious.  Bacon was crispy and scallops were tiny but sumptuous.   Shrimp tempura- Best I've ever had.  Hot, crunchy, salty, delicious.  I could eat them all day.  The shit- wonderful.  Spicy, crunchy, hot, crabby.  I wanted 20 more immediately.  Edamame- Best I've ever had.  Piping hot, salty, perfectly steamed. Yassss.   Chicken fried rice- Wonderful flavor.  Good size portion for AYCE.   Japchae- Stir-fried glass noodles with shredded carrots.  Delicious flavor and piping hot.  Pang- YUCK.  Tastes like hot mayo and crab.  Not for me.  Gagged a little bit.  Something wrong roll- The first sushi I've ever liked.  I'm go glad I tried it.  It had tuna, salmon, and shrimp tempura.  If you go, you have to try this.  I loved it.  Mini honey toast- Amazing.  Toasted block of bread with honey and ice cream.  Get five of these.  The ice cream is something special...it's super white vanilla (like the inside of a Klondike bar).   Get your ass down here if you like sushi...or even if you don't (like me).  This place has made me a believer!

ePJgTYpmSZN3oUgqUQEJeQ.text: Food is awesome! Like 10/10 on the sushi, except..... they really need to look at their ceilings and do some dusting. We were sitting there and looked up and there was literally dust about to fall from the ceiling. It was disgusting. Please dust your ceilings and decorations please!

ca3Zt0qusVlwJY6hykqKXQ.text: Everything was amazing!!!! Definitely worth getting off the strip. Our waitress was extremely nice and yeah.

8KPvnoEV23-OoEEe7vVD5Q.text: Menu is expressive mostly rolls. They put a lot of sauce on everything to the point that the food is bathe in sauce almost so keep this in mind when u want to do AYCE. We are here as a couple and we can only handle two rolls and a couple of appetizers. Service is fast tho and staffs are nice. By the way, for AYCE you have to eat everything include the rice or else u get charged

TlRrkF-VBWdkunZVNEbfQA.text: I'm pretty sure I've found my go-to AYCE sushi joint and here in Vegas, there are SOOO many to choose from. Sakana has always been consistent in service, quality and deliciousness!  Dinner AYCE is right under $26 as of 1/2017. The dinner menu has a few things offered that are not included in the lunch price including sashmi rolls, ama ebi, and uni. Otherwise, the rest of the menu is fair game for lunch and dinner. Some of my staple items for Sakana include the garlic tuna and salmon nigiri as well as the Hawaiian and Be Happy rolls.   The service is really quick and efficient here which I love. Once you order your sushi, a blink and it's already in front of you! It's probably more for their sake of turning over customers because the wait and line can be quite extensive but it's still nice to have quick service.  My favorite thing about this place is their fish-to-rice ratio (yes, that's a real thing in case you didn't know). It's a huge slice of decent quality fish with rice. It's one of the best ratios out there, trust.   There are a few dessert menus if you can manage to keep a pocket of stomach for it after your sushi. Only one order allowed per customer though :( they also advertise a 2 for 1 special on beers, wines and house sake all day every day!  Overall, one of my favorite if not the best AYCE sushi place that I've been to here in Vegas and I wouldn't hesitate coming again or recommending it to friends/visitors.

CEeUgNLQjD3A-NSou4hMhw.text: I really wish I lived closer, my ultimate favorite sushi place in Vegas. I sometimes go after school or during my passing period since it's by unlv and wayyy better than yama sushi which is always packed and busy with their chefs yelling at the servers. Their fish to rice portion on their nigiri is perfect!! They aren't stingy with their fish and it's presented beautifully with a leaf under. Their appetizers are unique and flavorful. I'm not a roll person, but from what my friend said they can make a really good California roll because 99% of the places he orders a Cali roll, it's really sad and weak. Service is amazing and they have more dessert options than other places, I love their ice cream tempura!  My favorite thing here is probably the Ono, must try!!

A few rolls may be a bit oversauced as others have complained but not enough to make them sloppy and inedible by any stretch of the imagination    My family has eaten sushi all over the US and this was a very pleasant experience.  I can see how there may be a wait in a different time of year as the  place was small.   Do yourself a favor and try them out.  You won't regret it!

qoNg6S_feNB745qAYhNdFA.text: Sushi was good! A few things that bump this restaurant to really good was the ambiance! I really liked the music, they were playing Drake and EDM lol, as well as the decoration, it made me feel at a Young Japanese woman's home.   What sets this place apart from other AYCE sushi was the nigiri and the dessert. Most AYCE sushi restaurants will give you a lot of rice and not so much protein, Sakana does the complete opposite, long and thick fillet of protein over a smaller bed of rice. Way more dessert options when buying the AYCE deal, fried bananas, tiramisu, mini honey toast,  tempura ice cream, which are all very small compare to regular dessert but by that time you should be stuffed ( or else you didn't do it right). I would recommend this place, fun environment and good sushi!

Ya9XWVHbTF51MVwEv7uiAA.text: The sushi here is amazing! I love the huge all you can eat selection and all the different types of rolls and appetizers that they have! Super delicious! When I go to all you can eat sushi I like to order two rolls to begin with, and as I finish them I will order more one at a time. My waitress, Ingrid, seemed irritated and annoyed every time I would order another roll. Isn't that the point of all you can eat sushi? To order more rolls if you're still hungry because you're paying for all you can eat... Anyways it's a shame because this place is so delicious yet they have servers that lower their reviews.
