p1CvZ4xjOnxbThE1z5KCrg.text: Sakana is one, if not my favorite AYCE sushi spot in town! They off such a variety of rolls, nigiri, appetizers, and desserts. I've been to plenty of sushi spots in Vegas and this one has such high quality fish I have not found anywhere else in the city. The only downside to this location is the service. It always seems to lack when it gets busy. This location is definitely in need of more staff. Otherwise the food is AMAZING. Some star menu items I would recommend trying are the Hamachi Kama, Saba Misoyaki, Yuzu Yellowtail, Garlic Tuna, A Little Tease Roll, Hawaiian Roll, and Baked Lobster Roll.

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LOpb7i7zEY5ky17b1f6BaQ.text: The fish is very fresh, the prices for AYCE are very reasonable, and their nigiri are delicious and VERY generous. Im definitely coming back to Sakana

7CNnebcHMQ96ihxGSnY5ng.text: Excellent sushi. Excellent service. Usually AYCE is a step below in quality. But not here.  I am not from Vegas, and this place might give me a reason to return. Forget the Strip and gambling! I am coming for the sushi here!

vZqPYa2IOiA9khm-FsZDsw.text: This is the most value I've ever gotten out of an AYCE Sushi place. The price is super reasonable and the fish were all really fresh. We mainly got nigiri and some of my favorites were definitely salmon, unagi, and a couple of the spicy ones. I actually don't think I would like this place if we didn't get AYCE because the regular special rolls and nigiri prices were pretty expensive and the rolls were all that great anyway.  If you're looking to just eat nigiri, I definitely recommend this place, especially the AYCE option. But if you're more of a specialty roll typa person, maybe it's best to skip.

X1OmZIYGX5B64I6b8KcWKQ.text: The restaurant is in a small strip mall which in my mind that means it's going to be goods! We came in and the place was packed and lots of people waiting.  The entire menu is 25.95 for all you can eat (minus drinks) but everything else included which if you can put down the sushi is a great deal! My husband and I did not do the all you can eat but shared 4 rolls and we came in a $44, so depending on how much you eat may or may not be worth it.  The sushi itself was amazing, probably some of the best sushi I have ever had! I wish I could have tried more rolls but we were stuffed. The rolls came out really fast too, like within 10 minutes of ordering. If you're a sushi person, definitely suggest going there. It's off the strip but from the Mirage it was not even a 10 minute drive.  The services wasn't the best but the food made up for it! Would absolutely go back!

DQ4CaAWAcb7RqqMx7oS0hw.text: The waitress and the manager lie about the kid buffet price! We went there for dinner. My friend mistakenly told the waitress that my kid is 3 years old who is actually 2. During the check out, I asked the waitress what's the policy of the kid price. She told me that under 3 is free. So I told her that my son is not 3 years old. And then she said under 3 is free, but I have to order at least one item for him, which I never heard before, so I asked her to double check with the manager.  When the manager came, he told me that we have to pay for every kid. So I told him that the waitress just told me that under 3 is free, and I need to order at least one item for the kid. He said the store policy is every kid has to be pay as long as they can eat the food. We end up paying the half price for the 2 years old. The thing pissed me off is at least one of the waitress or the manager is lying about the kid price, because  what they said are totally different. I understand the price is calculated when we asked about the kid price, but I don't like the way they make up the story just to cover the charge. Moreover, they also have a 90 minutes limit to eat. When the time is almost up, the manager told us he will give us 15-20 minutes to eat but there is a lot of people waiting. I checked out the window, there is NO ONE standing outside.  I really suggest the business owner should reconsider the management. Allowing such an unethical person to be the manager will just keep the customers away. No matter what, I will never visit the store again.

9Kw4XrSd2SErLINJErenxQ.text: Seems like their service has really taking a shit. I've been going here for 4-5 years and I feel the service as well as the quality of the food has gone downhill. First off, I showed up a little after 8pm, there was 6 in my party, and they offered me a table for 4. Uhh no, we're not trying to squeeze into a tiny booth. Mind you, there was no wait when I showed up but several parties that arrived after managed to get tables before us. Yes, I understand I had a large party but l, let's be honest, it still sucked.   As for the food, I'm no professional as to how it should be prepared but some sushi pieces that arrived were noticeably warmer than they should've been.  Let's talk about service. I've been coming here since before I was pregnant with my oldest child. She is a little over 3 now. I don't know if you have any kids but I know for a fact that my toddler does not consume the same amount of food as would a 5 or 10 year old would. So when I tell you I was a little mad that the server  told me i needed to pay for all you can eat for my kid, I was pretty upset. She ate a couple pieces of shrimp tempura and the server was all over it. I informed her she could charge her a la carte for the shrimp tempura but that was the tipping point.   When we first started coming here, there was a tiny Asian lady that managed the restaurant. She was delightful but the staff they have now is horrible. I'll be taking my business elsewhere

E8IJdfePB_qRoA1JqMo7Uw.text: The sushi here is delicious. Very fresh fish and the fish is larger than usual with the Nigiri. We had a few of their appetizers too which were delicious. The service was very prompt and I always had a full glass of water. My only complaint is that they tried to charge me 16.5% as sales tax. Normal sales tax is 8.25% and the receipt even said 8.25%, but the total tax for sure wasn't 8.25% of my total. Not sure if this was an honest mistake or if they hope nobody will notice. I urge everyone to make sure the sales tax is correct before you pay. They did refund me my money for the difference. I know it's not a lot ($4.50 or something like that), it's the fact that it seems very sketchy to me which made me retract a star

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CAMSoKk-3OA433VeFj1PNw.text: Go early to beat the crowd unless you dont mind waiting a bit, the food is excellent, the quality of seafood is better then most ayce sushi places and the price is worth it. The two times I've been here I have no complaints, service was great, food was excellent.

XczywIvyMKq-9L-aiwcLwA.text: Seriously one of the best sushi spots I've ever been too. Everything melts in your mouth. They don't over stuff with rice. Huge fish pieces!! I would fly from LA to Vegas just to eat here again

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All you can eat
Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All you can eat

SfJ1p3wcQCUVMKhMiyuYrQ.text: 1st time I came here. I really like it a lots. It's great quality if compare with AYCE from another place. Lunch special is $20.99. Sushi is very fresh. Service is very great also. Take sometimes to try this one and you will not disappointed.

BllejWeenR91j6b5EkipoA.text: This is my favorite ayce sushi place. Too bad I live in SoCal and am only in Vegas once or twice a year.    CONS: My only real complaint is the method of ordering. I'm accustom to ayce sushi places that have you mark down on a piece of paper what you want to order. This place makes you order with the server which doesn't seem bad but because it's an ayce sushi place, I like to order a bunch of things at once and plan out my meal. With such a big menu, it's time consuming and inefficient to sit there with the server and go through the menu one item at a time and pick out what I want now and what I want later in my meal.   PROS: Okay, enough negative talk. Let me tell you why I love this place. First of all, the food is great. I love their attention to detail. Most ayce sushi places serve fish in bulk so they throw fish on rice and push it out as fast as they can. Not at Sakana. All fish looked beautifully cut. And for some, they add garnishes that complement the fish (it doesn't mask the flavor of the fish either). I ordered the baked mussels and noticed they shuck the meat off the shell before baking. This allows you to slurp it right off the shell instead of having to pull the meat off yourself. I also noticed good cuts on fish and garnishes. Little things like these separate this place from other ayce sushi places. They're definitely not lazy here. They don't cut corners. They go the extra mile to make sure the dining experience is enjoyable in every way. Even the wait staff was on it. My water was always full. Even when I poured my entire glass into my hydroflask, they were right there with a refill. I'm excited to come back here the next time I'm in Vegas. It's literally the one thing I look forward to the most right now. Follow up review coming once that happens.

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JHPCn37ZR0l2_BVo52K1iA.text: This place is friggen awesome.  Wife and I ate probably $120 worth of sushi and two bottles of Sake for $100 after the tip. Screaming bargain.  It is small and there probably is a wait but it is worth it.  Service is very good, food comes out extremely fast, and our waiters were extremely nice and helpful.  The stuffed tomato and sashimi roll (wrapped in a cucumber peal) were ridiculous.  The umi, as well as all the fish we had was extremely fresh.  I will make sure I come here every time I am in Vegas.  Seriously, I have had sushi that cost 2 or 3 times as much that wasn't as good.

lnTi5hXBksxCIUsQ23rjMA.text: We came here because my GF read good yelp reviews about it. The STAFF service was EXCELLENT!!! My 2 stars is because the quality of the fish in the Sushi nigiri was just NOT GOOD. There are simply better for the same price range in this area. I wouldn't had came here if the GF didn't insist, especially after we just had one of my best ayce sushi in VEGAS at YAMA SUSHI last night, where the fish was so damn fresh and most importantly the rice in the nigiri wasn't the size of a chicken nugget. Yes.. that's another issue I have with this joint. The rice is HUGE, soft and wet, which some people may really enjoy but not me... The dessert selection is great which is different from other places.

LF06uxP9ITlPPR-se1tBdQ.text: Had an amazing time here at sakana. It had amazing nigiri. I suggest eating the albacore, some of the freshest I have tasted. Tobiko was amazing and sweet. Check in to get free sake! Try to make it before dinner because it gets packed

lgINqbFr1FxQfabypIvrkg.text: My favorite restaurant in Vegas, hands down. AYCE that is fresh, tasty, affordable, and sushi with so much more fish than rice. The sushi rolls are good, but what keeps us coming back is the delicious nigiri, appetizers, and low carb options (bottom right on the menu). The Towering Sashimi Poke is basically a delicious fish/sauce topped nacho. One of the best things I have ever eaten... Absolutely divine. Anything with scallops like the dynamite appetizer and baked scallop roll is amazing. The chicken yakitori is gourmet status- so good. I've been a regular for a long time and am so sad I had to move back to LA. To be honest, this place makes all other sushi in Los Angeles or Las Vegas look sub par. An absolute gem. I miss you, Sakana!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Towering sashimi poke- best thing on the menu!! Basically Japanese nachos.

Ck2tTtL3eh3cYnXK5yVEuw.text: This is one of the better sushi buffets i have been to. Solid sashimi. Dinner is 25.95, not a bad price for good quality fish. Personally, their rolls are good, but i would order a lot more sashimi during ayce since this place is solid for that. The pork belly is really ****ing good btw.

gPaJJ1xWcD9P0QOTjtjncQ.text: What a good deal for the all you can eat sushi and less than 3 miles from the strip! Highly recommend. I ordered the little tease roll and salmon roll and they both tastes very fresh. Anytime I am back in the area I will come back for a visit!

uyIL3Cm6EUv_NrmFvD_nug.text: The first thing I noticed is the decoration and how festive it is. Amazing sushi!!! Amazing service!!! My favorite roll is the lemon salmon roll and I've been to many places and it never compares to SAKANA. Best place to go and you can honestly never find another good sushi place and customer service. Chicken fried rice is amazing!!!!!

2Exjza7-vv6pdfm-Uw65Dw.text: My first time here and the service is great. They are on top of everything. The food is delicious, this is a AYCE spot and you get a lot if you can eat it all.

nZ16tr51csNs_AGT6eSahg.text: One of the best sushi buffets we had, salmon is so fresh and they don't cheap out on the portion of the salmon. Unlike other sushi restaurants where they offer sushi buffets, they give a huge chunk of rice and a tiny piece of fish, here they give such a big and fresh piece of fish and a small portion of rice, it's amazing. One of the freshest fish we had, taste is amazing, service is amazing. So worth the $25, it's a must to come whenever you're in Vegas.

P40VL3-qAuGUaewNfhiohQ.text: The first time my best friend and I visited this place, it was outrageously good. The overall quality of the fish, and the rice to fish ratio on the nigiri was on point. We have gone back more than three times now together, and individually with other friends, and it has dramatically declined in quality, not just in food, but service. The owners are quite nice from what we have experienced, but the servers here always always always forget one or two... or three things we order.   I decided to take a few coworkers here after work the other day because they were craving sushi after our long day, and after that last experience, I know personally I would never be back. Not only did they forget three of the things we ordered at our table, but they sent us two rolls we never even ordered. The quality of the fish was variable and we could tell that the yellowtail was not fresh because of its distinct smell and taste. So disappointing that their miso soups came out late and at room temperature at best without tofu. Some of the baked rolls that we ordered came out with a huge amount of mayo that overpowered the taste of the content. One of the rolls, the dragon, came out with brown avocado slices... Completely lost my appetite after eating some of the yellowtail nigiri and seeing that... This place has definitely gained some mad popularity from the first time we visited, so maybe they just don't care for quality like they used to? but, my advice... they are not consistent with the quality of the fish, the service is friendly, but extremely slow and forgetful, and overall, for what you pay, this is one AYCE sushi place i will never come bring people back to, recommend, or visit in vegas.

E0okIRZNaGHkRxXG3x9_rA.text: Best all you can eat sushi in Las Vegas! Great selection. It is also very nice the appetizers are included in the ayce menu.

Bxtmo5IvcuX4GN3lvmFxJA.text: Best hidden secret of las vegas is this place. They serve Fresh sushi in and all you can eat. 21 for lunch 26 for dinner.

cfhhqEJGo4-oofJ4WvpQog.text: Okay this place is the bomb! Sushi is always fresh! I love how they have different items on AYCE that's very different from the other AYCE here in Vegas. Like they have udon on their AYCE menu like who does that?! Lol overall amazing experience!!!!! Staff is great as well! One of my fave spot now.

XysGLyEuYPArwENVvjT9eQ.text: Nice ambience and good selection of sushi. Definitely will be back in the future. Kind of a far drive but it's really worth it in my opinion.

NaNED4jCui9OUNUG6lnaZQ.text: Fish to rice ratio is way better than I've seen at most places!  They restored my faith in good sushi after a tragic dinner at sushimon.

JaV3ZhBA08cgldIRJFrPqw.text: The sushi here is off the charts. Fresh, delicious fish dripping in these crazy sauces! Definitely coming back next time I come to Vegas. It's a small spot in a strip mall but don't be discouraged. The prices are right and the sushi is on point. Thank me later!

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lisa Lisa roll and popcorn lobster roll. Beyond amazing

Bt0DBLwHAF4z0ogWEVHGag.text: This has got to be the best sushi i have been able to find. It took me 2 years to find and wow its the best!! Their sushi is on point and the drinks are fair priced. I love this place.

DMj7wY2BKLEu8Ulei-fSzA.text: The fish to rice ratio is wonderful. The interior is beautiful and they have an awesome drinks two for one deal. Worth it ~~

Mj8lB1l1v--YAch3T13GLA.text: Came back for the second time today with my fiance since we're not from Vegas and I gotta say, it's still as good as the first time. Heads up, Lunch AYCE is $20.95 and dinner is $25.95. The garlic edamame is pretty good if you wanna try something different. The shrimp tempura is freshly cooked so there were plenty of those orders coming our way. The baked scallop roll with cream cheese is my favorite (the baked lobster roll with cream cheese comes close, which is pictured below) but in honesty, all the rolls here you can't do wrong with. The service was good and the food comes out pretty quick. The place gets busy so expect a wait if it's the weekend. We came in on a Monday around lunch so there wasn't a wait time and were seated right away. Keep in mind that you can only make reservations for parties of 10+. Other than that, if you're looking for good AYCE sushi, Sakana is a must try! Made the mistake of going to the AYCE across the street from here and it was mediocre, maybe even lower. I wouldn't suggest going there. All in all, best sushi here in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked Lobster Roll
Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Tempura appetizer

jgaKyEHq2J1XlRn2P-_NYQ.text: Stopped by after a long day of traveling, and their all you can eat dinner special hit the spot. Amazing atmosphere, attentive staff, and the food is unbelievably fresh! Highly recommend.

Yl8_iCjhhdBYdLa8cYgOwg.text: What Asian girl doesn't like sushi? It is a cute little place with little knick knacks placed around the restaurant so everywhere you looked there was something to find. Service was good, drinks were never empty. Sushi came out quickly, which I can't complain about. Good was very tasty, like everyone else has mentioned the rice to fish ratio 1:1. One thing I do notice about good sushi is that the rice is compacted enough where it it stays together from the pick up to the dipping of soy, be soft enough when it hits your mouth the rice will fall apart on its own without the first chew. I know it sounds weird but it's True. Lastly, just to mention the black sesame panna cotta desert was perfect, not too sweet but still tastes the roasted seeds was excellent. The boyfriend says it tasted like a "rubber tire" but he does not like the Asian deserts much so there you go.

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Snapchat this!!!

2aNiJnElb_0O2RjSazaPEQ.text: I've been to this place once and I was sold. AYCE sushi for about $25 is incredible. I would have spent so much more on what I actually ate. The service was great and they made the sushi right in front of you!

Mcm8tlkWu6i04EvLeygOEw.text: Great service however the food did not taste as fresh as a couple months ago...

zmQ7NTPt4BjOiD2_gvMFeA.text: Very tasty sushi with excellent fish to rice ratio. Sushi rice compact and flavoursome. Good value for money. Loses a star as a number of limitations to what you can order which is not always clear on menu and the waiters need to improve their English as got our order wrong on a number of occasions however this doesn't hide the fact, that sushi taste was excellent. Sushi chef please take a bow.

LZOXsXDHJxNXOntU3YHmOg.text: Still amazing! Great sushi ! I come here all the time. I always recommend this place and everyone likes it. The nigiri is good as well!

HQxh9qZVQ-3CwIYq2RJXYA.text: Best sushi I have ever had, and surprisingly the wait is never bad. I almost don't want to write a review because it is a hidden gem. Service has been good every time but once, but how can you control for that? The fish to rice ratio is the best I have ever had. They don't always have the specialty items so don't buy the all you can eat expecting to make your money back there, but why eat anywhere else?

RiyNAkjARzRU1WG1NkYraQ.text: Excellent food, great quality sushi. Wonderful service! We are here now for the second time this year from LA and it is the greatest find! Carlos, our server was unbelievably nice and attentive. Out food was at our table promptly, we had the best dinner date. Totally loved the Screaming O, What The Heck Roll, Orange Blossom... Their names are so sexy too... Will absolutely come back when I'm in town again!

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sakana Dinner Ambience

fVrCfX-GREXLD9iQipEqjw.text: Came back to this place a second time like I said I would. Just as solid as the last time. Staff was really friendly and attentive. Carlos was our server, fantastic guy. Reasonably priced, and pretty much the entire menu is available as all-you-can-eat, even some of their specials. Highly recommend - dinner like this would be $200-$300 on the strip.

BjQQIr2zIbDgIu_zYpUJBQ.text: My favorite AYCE sushi restaurant in Las Vegas. I've been going here for a couple years and they never disappoint. Their fish is always tasting fresh and The rice to fish ratio is excellent. They always give great customer service. I recommend trying this place out.

mBPZ9510dxdqxA1dKyWs5A.text: Great fast service ayce is amazing excellent fish portions and quality 2for1 drinks are a great thing too

92m1sVFT8p_b1-31-R8eow.text: Really good place! My favorite; golden tiger, steam muscles, sexy girl, what the heck! Service is always on point, clean and friendly environment.kid friendly so that's a plus ;)

HXvZX7OnxGdxd7o0ojtbAg.text: Great place meet friends and enjoy amazing food. Food is delicious and the the environment is great as well

JBe1a5rkToxxVOnuzDMJyQ.text: We very much enjoyed our experience here. Our waiter was very friendly & the food came out very quickly! Really busy at 10 pm on a Friday evening. 2 for 1 sake, wine & beer!!! All you can eat includes desserts. Only thing I would say I didnt love was there was too much sauce on everything but you can always say no sauce!!!!

GM-88qBrCOPKf4W-WKeMCQ.text: This place has great food!! Will be back. I love that we get free sake if we post on yelp

VgzMgoqOTibQCRecJrWtzQ.text: Very cute place - and cheap all you can eat. Looks small outside but pretty roomy inside. Good music playing as well.

E9bgJHpoJZ7E__PCKxyX_Q.text: This place is bomb. Super good sushi and good people. Everything on the menu is really good and fresh. I would definitely recommend trying here if you like sushi. The sushi chefs are very friendly and really nice.

5GQwROmnikfduxGNhXGpeA.text: AYCE dinner $22. Auto gratuity (for large party) plus tax... $30.  Yeah, the sushi is cheap...ER than other places but I'd rather pay more for better service and quality. My friends chose this place and after seeing all the wonderful pics on yelp, I was super excited to try it out. Boy, was I disappointed. None of the items we ordered looked like the pictures! Nigiri was aiiight. The slices of fish were pretty and long... but so thin, and so much rice! Rolls were decent. I didn't try too many so no real opinion on those.  Service was not impressive at all. We had a large party... 10 people. But we called and made a reservation the day before. They should have been prepared. It was dinner time and sorta busy but still only had 2 servers/waiters. People that got there after us somehow managed to order and get their food before us. And our table was right in the middle of the place! They weren't ignoring us... just not very observant. Anywho, we were finally able to flag them down for orders but instead of taking orders normally, they handed us a sheet of paper with their menu items and had us mark which ones we wanted. I wasn't a fan of this but it made it easier for them. There were a couple things that I had to hand write out on the side because they didn't have it on the list.. NBD. The first couple appetizers came out but we still didn't have dipping or eating plates! We had to bug them to bring it out. The reason I was annoyed of the service was because they were hard to get a hold of. Each time they brought a new item out, they'd hand it to us (literally... hand the plate to us, instead of placing it on the table), and have us figure out the organizing. There was a handful of times where we had empty plates to be cleared but they just walked away.   Also.... I'm not normally a huge germaphobe but there were fruit flies all over! We kept waving our hands around the entire time to shoo them away. They were even in the restroom.  I will most likely not ever come back here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black sesame blanc manger

r3hC8WOE2mR3zRncSjNf0Q.text: Handful of items are one order per person like salmon belly, oysters, seafood salad (like mixed fish poke), ocean trout, ama ebi... Etc. But well worth it for AYCE. Been here many many times since this is the hubbys favorite sushi spot at the moment ;) if u get Kevin as ur server ur in luck! Always attentive and super fast. Love it. Fish here is twice the size of the rice and they serve fresh wasabi for a $3 upcharge so this is a definite must try. You won't be sorry.

nhRnuwfAFcULc3bMJIYt8w.text: Perhaps I'm a simple person. I really don't care about decor, signs from previous owner on the wall, or what's on tv, don't care! I came for food! I come to a restaurant and would like to eat great food and have good service. Sakana has ridiculously amazing sushi, incredibly fresh, out of this world!!! The Service is very good, Jason is busy and yet still attentive.

49hRn0MVanJlNCt1R4C_YQ.text: Foodwise, this place is not the most special. And the chairs are wooden boxes with no back rest.  However, the service was surprisingly great. And there is no wait to get in even during the busiest times. (If you've been slapped with a 1 hour wait at Yama, I suggest just going across the street and coming here).

Tru-Zp-zSbZL6ta5ZYkVyg.text: Hell Yea!  I just found my new sushi place to eat at the food is amazingly good and the price is not bad at all. They have all you can eat sushi, appetizers, dessert. The only thing you pay separately is the drinks. The restaurant itself is nice and clean and the service is really good as well. Most all you can eat at places give you attitude if you keep ordering, well not here very nice server he kept coming back asking us if we needed any more rolls. This is a must go restaurant. Go Go Nowwwwwwwwww!

M2udghkbRvBtaAQAFHv2Nw.text: Most amazing food! Plus, it is so AFFORDABLE-EE! I highly recommend this sushi place, because they have great service with a friendly staff, diverse alcohol options, and remarkable speciality rolls. The decor is greatly unique, setting a sweet ambiance. Love me some Sakana!!

Et8ZCGcgN-9dBoHaQNhrFw.text: Great service & really good sushi, got the all you can eat , and had such great shrimp tempura !

7btskcSKH-0C-OwHjri84A.text: All you can eat sushi as been the trend for quite a few years now and there's certainly a bunch in Vegas. What I don't like of those places generally is that they steer you towards the rolls that contains a tiny bit of fish and lots of rice... If they offer Nigiri or Sashimi, they often limit you to a few pieces.  This isn't the case here. They might limit you to one or two order for a few delicacies but you can have Nigiri all you want... and it is mostly what I had. The food was good ans the service attentive. They are in fact very generous on the fish portion for the Nigiris. When I was there, they has a 2 for 1 on sake and beer also.  Atmosphere is fun, warm and welcoming.  All and all, propably now my favorite AYCE sushi in town.

AbKToakRyRWOP7LGeQIx2A.text: Best AYCE in vegas ! But be aware not to get Anna as your server, she is beyond rude & very impatient. Always has an attitude if something doesnt go right or if she gets something wrong.

Xz7Bz2tp3Jw8RRgkpT7FxQ.text: The sushi was so delicious and tasted fresh. We just wanted to eat more and more until we literally couldn't eat another bite. Our favorite was the garlic tuna and anything else sashimi. The oysters were fresh and tasty. Nothing tastes too fishy or gross. We would definitely come back to this restaurant for the all you can eat sushi. We were to the sushi way restaurant as well, but it does not compare to Sakana.

H0jVAM-Z36h5jp142l526w.text: Don't understand the 5 star rating. Maybe because the all you can eat price? But you get what you paid for. The service was good, I'm not impressed with the quality of the sushi, most of the rolls has imitation crab in it.

oFNX9j4UbrcPF9e0HyPGLg.text: I hate sushi.  How many times do I have to say it? Yet people keep dragging me out for raw fishy fucking fish. Well, if I'm going to play ball I'm coming here next time.  The sushi was not repulsive. Fish flavors were clean. Sauces and execution bang on! And guess what? They have Bulgogi. And pork belly. And Udon. And cooked fish options. Yes please and thank you!  The vibe is homey and warm. Service super-fast, low-key, and menu knowledge is top notch. Dirty plates are taken away lickety-split. AYCE is the way to go. Two of us plowed through a dozen or more plates for around $60 with tip. Soda is in cans though so be forewarned.  Wonderful place I'd return to in a heartbeat, sushi curmudgeon or no.

butLJ7YkXVdrpqQTCuoMSQ.text: May 27, 2016 @ 2 PM.    This is the second AYCE sushi joint we have visited in Vegas and this time we took my son.  We came here right after three hours at Bally's pool and we were starving.  It is about a 15 minute drive from the Strip.    The staff sat us immediately and were very patient explaining you can order anything on the menu (except for a few dinner items) for the AYCE lunch.  It costs $20.95 per person and lunch is served from 11:30 to 3 PM.  I will say, the slices of fish were thick and the fish to rice ratio was good, not great, but good.  The service was excellent.  As soon as the food or drink disappeared, a waiter was there to serve us more.  Just make sure you eat everything you order or they charge you more.  I am going to list some of the best items we tried.  Sushi: Yellowtail tuna, Smoked Paprika Salmon, Sarada Lobster, Salmon,  Wouldn't try again: Surf clam, Aomori scallop  Appetizers: The Shit, Pang, Fried pork belly (absolutely wonderful), Fried crab meat on skewer  Rolls: Popcorn Lobster Roll, TNT Roll, Wet Dream, Philadelphia Wouldn't try again: Call 911 Roll (I like spicy, and they warned me, but this one is just too hot to enjoy.  Be warned, it has Jalapeno AND Habanero)  Want to try when we return: Monkey Brains, Lobster King Roll, Playboy, I Love My Ass, Hulk Burrito  Make sure you get the 2 for 1 drink special (all day long) which allows you to buy one sake, beer, wine, or soju and get one free.    Altogether, for three of us, we paid $80, and were barely able to walk out.  In fact, had to take a nap in the car in the parking lot we were so sleepy!

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Front to back sushi: Sarada Lobster, Yellowtail tuna, Salmon, Smoked Paprika Salmon.
Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Popcorn lobster roll.
Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Front of the menu.

8RsnaB1kV_-meYEboTNtMA.text: This place has a wait so be prepared, especially large groups. My waitress last night was very friendly and had a warm personality as did the host. The decor is really fun and I found the constant reminder to eat all of your food hilarious. I ordered heavily off of the nigiri menu and the fish servings were large and delicious.   Be aware that there are menu items that do not clearly describe all sauces and toppings used, which is a problem for those who are celiac or gluten free.   I would highly recommend speaking with your server about any hidden ponzu sauce or eel sauce (both made with regular soy sauce which has gluten). Otherwise, they have tamari and are very generous with their sauces.

RtpScZg3kcUabI8z61GX2w.text: ***UPDATE 2***I stopped in for take-out last night, I usually order every few weeks. The sushi is great but the rolls have DEFINITELY gotten smaller. I've noticed it the last 3 times I've ordered. The prices have also increased & this IS NOT reflected on the menus. More $$$ for less sushi = no bueno  UPDATE 1***I've been coming here nearly 3yrs. Sakana consistently delivers fresh, tasty, reasonably priced sushi. Staff is always pleasant. What more can you ask for? This is by far my favorite sushi spot!

6jqbCZnwfnrSBWWX0P6WHQ.text: Definitely my new go-to for sushi!! We hardly had to wait for a table, the staff was very kind and very accommodating, and the sushi... well it speaks for itself. Every roll we ordered was absolutely delicious. Their appetizers as well as desserts are phenomenal as well. Getting "All You Can Eat" if definitely the way to go for this place. I will definitely be returning!!

D78pcTj9xLRX1xmcmKCN2Q.text: Best AYCE sushi! By far the best sushi spot in town! Unbeatable fish to rice ratio, quality and flavor. Service was a bit slow when we last went because it was busy but the food was worth the wait. My family and I love this place & plan to bring any family or friends who are visiting from out of town.

ZJccwIyjiiRveUaVNGVBXw.text: Oh my lawd...hello sushi gods!! Thank you for allowing me to find another great hole-in-the-wall sushi spot! Can't believe I've lived around this area for 3 years now and am only finding this now!!  Came in here on a Sunday, around dinner time at 6pm. Wasn't too packed. We came the perfect time because we got seated right away. Of course did the all you can eat!!!   Menu- they have all kinds of sushi. From nigiri, to baked sushi rolls, to deep fried rolls, and even "yummy appetizers. This is of course all included in the ALL YOU CAN EAT. I know we ordered a few things; salmon lemon roll (my favorite!!! This one is so delicious!), 49ers roll (yes I know!!), I got the garlic tuna nigiri and eel nigiri, for appetizers, the poke stack is a MUST!!  Here's a tip- all drinks are buy one get one free!! Also...lunch prices are $20.95 and dinner is $25.95!  Thank you sakana! Will definitely be coming back for more ^_^

URuNnZH4bNr-W1lLQYqicA.text: Very tasty food. Chefs are very generous. Fish cuts are huge with small amount of rice. Recommended for all sushi lovers. I will definitely go back here and bring my friends!

3_qjnboBWjal2qEiaRkzcg.text: Tired this place again today with a girl friend and I can say that was the best sushi I've had in a long time ! Hardly any rice PURE NIGIRI was so Fresh ! Will def be back

j3cAfIpsi-4QlgWf4Gbt0w.text: We all know Vegas has a solid lineup of buffets but I mean it when I tell you this is the new goto when I stay at the family timeshare. You want a saki bomb and all you can eat sushi this is your place and for $21... Super fresh and such a variety of food. That pear sparkling sake got the best of me... It's so good you lose track of how many you had... Or maybe I just drank too much?! It was 2 for 1, don't judge me.  Either way, I recommend this place. Super chill atmosphere and food you can keep eating. I fell in love with the apps section as soon as I sat down (The Shit was really the shit). Bulgogi was sooooo juicy and worth the effort of trying to say to the waitress. Do me a favor and try right meow and thank me after ;).

MXm4U9WWq2Lr2beyIKikFw.text: Absolutely loved Sakana. The sushi was excellent and atmosphere was lively. We had a 30 minute wait for a table but the service is fast, definitely worth the wait. I'll go any time I'm in town.

c5LVTxgNIvOdBe3JMmRrsA.text: Great food, but horrible customer service. While we're still eating the waiter walks by and says you have to eat all of that in a mean tone. They yell at you for leftovers. I won't come back to this place again because of the service. I'd rather go to sushi neko close by. Same quality food but better service.

ch3GrF-zKuADOw_DJn6zYA.text: First time coming here getting away from the usual buffets on the Las Vegas Strip. I've been to other buffets there but first time coming to Sakana for AYCE sushi! The price isn't too bad at about $25.95 per person. We came here on a Friday night and waited about 20-30 mins. Place is a bit small as there aren't really any big tables. They did combine tables for our party of 12 which is probably why we waited a bit longer as we had to wait for the other parties to finish up.  Good thing about this place is that not only was the sushi good, but also their service. Fast service and great service with help all the time from picking up your empty plates to refilling your drink. The food came quick. Out of all the sashimi and suhi/sushi rolls we ordered, the only thing that wasn't cooked right was the shrimp's head as they weren't really fresh. Besides that, I can't really complain much about this place. The end of the food craze is the dessert as there are plenty of options here but of course we had to get their green tea ice cream. I would definitely come back here for a AYCE sushi craving.

7PCM4t2KxVVjt2md3ErBiA.text: This place was amazing! Everything was delicious and fresh! This will be our new sushi spot every time we come to Vegas! The price can't be beat, and the quality is stunning. The sushi was out of this world fast and service was great. The 2 for 1 alcohol was just the cherry on top.

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kVRjxelKN1g0kh1toJvPmA.text: This place is near UNLV, which is definitely a plus for students and people around that area! The waiting time can be super long depending on the time you go. Most of the time around 6 and after, the wait will be very long! BUT don't let that discourage you because once you get seated and try their sushi, it is definitely worth the wait since it's also AYCE. I like the nigiri sushi here compared to a few other sushi places here in Vegas! As for their rolls, I think I would say it is decent like any other place, but there are some other sushi restaurants that have better rolls in my opinion!   A few of my favorites:  Salmon  Salmon belly  Yuzu yellowtail  Eel  Oyster  White tuna

RIEdHXpOSslC_7aIv_RVlw.text: Never come back here again.... They don't take credit card from other countries, even tho with MasterCard or Visa. That's ridiculous... never here that before. The First Restaurant in Vegas tell me this.. That's sucks... Super inconvenient

The food was outstanding, the prices very reasonable (we had the all you can eat), and the service was great. Will probably try to eat there one more time before we leave, but will definitely be back next time we come to vegas.

6EbPt3Pr-vBCXHKVnhcZBQ.text: Tried this AYCE sushi place for lunch with my wife. Located in the Target shopping center on Maryland and Flamingo. It's at the end of the strip mall and still says Kabuki for the name.  AYCE lunch was only $20.95 which is pretty reasonable. They have quite a decent selection of appetizers, rolls, and nigiri. I especially like that they don't have a lot of stipulations such as time limit? (Not that i saw anyway), no limits on desserts or really much of anything. Pretty generous.  Rolls are good and put together well, with very fresh fish, not too much rice, and just enough sauce. Nigiri sushi was excellent. Nice big pieces of fish and just a little ball of sushi rice. Excellent quality and nice selection. Apps were decent and had some different offerings including bulgolgi nachos and something called "the shit". Not quite sure what it was but it looked like it's name. Lol. Some kind of tempura log.  Good dessert at the end with all the various ice creams.  Overall nice small restaurant. Quiet and clean. Excellent quality sushi served fast and with great customer service. Our waitresses were great very nice and hospitable and made sure we enjoyed our lunch. Great place for AYCE. Looking forward to try their dinner menu next.

ee20pOllWu791JCJksak7Q.text: so so so good! I am a Yama sushi regular and Sakana has me won over. This is my new AYCE sushi spot. The fish is so fresh and the rolls are beyond delicious. Highly recommended!

b65lxHo20IgV-2fc7Gd7ig.text: It's hard not to give Sakana five stars when the nigiri fish to rice ratio is so overwhelming that you could wrap the rice with the fish. Yes. That's how much fish they give you. Of course, this would mean nothing if the fish quality wasn't also very good. I realized last night that it's the perfect ratio. I enjoy sashimi, but I couldn't do all-you-can-eat without requesting a bowl of rice. At Sakana, I felt like I was eating a long cut of sashimi with a little bit of rice attached for good measure.  There are a couple things Sakana does that are a little different. First, they serve uni in basic nigiri format as opposed to gunkanmaki (I found that on wiki); in other words, they don't wrap it in nori. That's not a bad thing. Second, rather than give you a whole salmon kama, they serve it up as bite size portions. Not necessarily a bad thing but worth noting.  AYCE sushi dinners are usually a blur. Rather than try to list everything I remember enjoying, I'll just refer you to Tony T's photos. And of course, I cannot forget about dessert. They have the staples like mochi and tempura ice cream, but I decided to get the less common Green Tea Panna Cotta and the Black Sesame Blanc Manger. Both were a great way to cap the dinner.

STqHZl8Q9kDaQUa4vZ0xrA.text: CONDENSED IN A SOUP CAN: Watching your wallet but want to pig out on sushi and sake? They have excellent service to go with their quality fish and offer a good variety on their AYCE menu - which will only cost you around $20 for lunch and $22 for dinner. Can't beat that! THE MEAT: We went in for lunch on a Wednesday and were 1 of the only 2 tables there. Our server was so friendly and attentive and the food came out in good time and pace. The soft shell crab was light and served with a tasty ponzu sauce. "The shit" (crab and cooked salmon in nori, deep fried and served with yum yum sauce) didn't quite live up to its slang name (I wonder if they chose it for its aesthetic resemblance). The salmon kama was presented beautifully (as all of their food are)... it is a piece not quite on the collar itself but still very tender. The monkey brains will please any fusion fan, it surely teased my palette with familiar crab salad mixed with sweet banana tempura. I wanted to hate it so bad, but got quite the opposite effect. And the sushi, my oh my. The fish to rice ratio is ridunculous! We loved the salmon, hamachi, super white tuna... and the lasagna roll is good if you like cream cheese. How they make profit for serving great quality with an extensive AYCE menu for so cheap in a low key neighborhood eludes me. I do hope they can keep up the exceptional value for your money! I would totally franchise this spot. Binge on good sushi with flip flops here or hide in one of the dark corners with an ugly mistress. GOGOGO! (P.S. I recommend not bringing the kids unless it was for lunch, or if they are capable of behaving like... college students out for sushi and sake.) I'M STILL DIGESTING... The Japanese pop music videos filled with scantily clad grown high school students. Now there's a night's worth of conversation over sake. WANT TO SEE SOME FOOD PORN? :-) yelp.com/biz_photos/saka...

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Monkey Brain - Crab and banana tempura
Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic Tuna, Cajun Tuna, Super White Tuna
Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon Kama

z56y6kdKdft3uWoSqKQiqQ.text: Great food, FRESH fish, VERY good fish/rice ratio, and all for ONLY $22.95!  Yes, I have had BETTER quality fish around town.  Yes, I have had better AYCE sushi.  BUT to have all the above check marked, it makes it a VERY GOOD AYCE SUSHI SPOT!  Service was fast and friendly, orders were taken promptly, and food showed up quickly!  They were a little quiet on this Wednesday night, but there is plenty of room for large groups here!  Some notables :  The Soft Shell Crab...AMAZING! Loved every bite...this was the highlight of the night for me!  It's not limited to 1pp either!!  Maybe I can just fill up on these next time, without them giving me the evil eye!  Nigiri : Garlic Tuna, Hamachi, Super White, Amaebi, Unagi, and Scallops were all great!  Lots of these have little additions to them, so be sure to specify if you want your fish "naked" or how chef prepares them!    Most of the nigiri had such a crazy fish/rice ratio, that you could wrap the fish all the way around the rice if you wanted to...end to end.  It's like AYCE sashimi with a touch of rice!  Since we came in a large group, I was able to try some of the rolls too...everything was pretty good!  They have lots of good appetizers as well, to stand out from the heavy competition in Vegas.  I am sure we will be back :)  Tons of pics! :

g3KZMbDxrodHZOJSrZsPQw.text: Amazing AYCE with amazing service! Came here for the first time on a Tuesday evening for date night and was seated right away. Since we never have been here before we didn't know what appetizers or rolls to order and our waitress answered all questions without any hesitation. Love the names of the rolls; definitely need to start with the appetizers on the menu in red---delicious! Love the fact that you can also order 1/2 rolls; this allowed us to try a few more rolls without over ordering! Atmosphere is a strip mall but when inside can't even tell; love the decor! Water glass was never empty and an empty plate didn't stay on our table for more than a minute! The popcorn lobster roll was so scrumptious I had to take a picture!

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Popcorn Lobster Roll...amazing!

zUGa7gnTMczP47LpBPtEQg.text: This place deserves an updated review after my 2nd visit. With finishing up my Goyemon stamp card, I now feel like I have the freedom to eat whatever sushi spot I please without having the feeling of "oh that could have been another stamp to fill before my card expiration date" feeling.   With that said, I think Sakana should take up punch cards! I mean don't get me wrong, Goyemon is great, but it's the power of the punch card and the idea that I could get a free meal soon that kept me tied to the place for so long. Oh and the fact that they basically set a deadline to receive your free meal.  I really enjoyed my 2nd visit to Sakana. I definitely saw lots of improvements in the menu, although they were minor, they still made a big impact. For example, the subtle garnishes they add on different nigiri. My absolute favorite is the super white tuna topped with sea salt and shredded nori. I couldn't believe the huge taste difference with such a small added detail. Also, the small pieces of ikura added on to salmon belly nigiri were on point! I received complimentary hamachi sashimi pieces from the chef. I was absolutely grateful for it, but the pieces were still a bit frozen and hard to chew through. That was sort of disappointing. However everything else definitely made up for it.   They now provide a menu sheet that you can mark on, which is great! I go a little crazy at sushi restaurants and it's hard to remember exactly what I want for the first order -- there's lots of fish names swimming around in my head. It really helps me and the server that I can just mark down what I want per order.   There were lots of presentation improvements too. I like that they added a leaf garnish (?) between the plate and your order. It makes for a great food photo op :) However, I feel like they still need to work on the interior design of the restaurant. They had scrolls of cloth sectioning off the tables that had messaging scribbled on with what looked like a crayon. It just doesn't represent the quality of their food well. I noticed behind the sushi chefs they had vertical rectangular sheets of paper hanging all over the walls that I would assume represents Japanese custom of a menu (like Ichiza). If they could set the ambiance and decor as a traditional chic sushi restaurant, this place would be perfection. Like if Kabuto and Ichiza had a restaurant baby, I would hope it would be what Sakana looked like.   But the important thing really is the food selection. Still a big fan of their large cut nigiri pieces! This place will definitely be my go-to spot for my next few sushi fixes.

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Super White Tuna (no sauce) -- lightly torched, a sprinkle of sea salt, and topped with shredded nori. Perfection.

9yOahng-axdaCtHIiK1FNQ.text: We went there for lunch and took the All You Can Eat formula for $20.95/ person. Sushis were very good! Worth the price. We would go back for sure. Thank you.

zIPNPDO1CxyVFpOe-qtyRA.text: Wow, the quality of sushi is the best ever. If you are a suchi lover, you must visit and see the beautiful sushi.

e8XGeB5KRYOBVNChwqc3aQ.text: I had bookmarked this place to try, and my sister actually got to go ahead of me.  We both liked this place a lot for their service, and we did like a few specific menu items to go for when in the mood. Honestly reminds me a bit of Yama though in regards to their types of special rolls.  The boyfriend and I had Kevin as our server and a few of the ladies there to help him during the weekend lunch stint. They were all nice and friendly, knowledgeable about their menu items too. It was cool to be able to just chat with the guy between ordering and eating our dishes. The bus person also made sure our glasses were always filled (came handy for the 911 special), and that our table was always clean of empty plates.  The atmosphere is more chill in comparison to its close competitor (always crowded), and the staff is definitely more involved with your experience so it's not like they just talk to you when they think you're ready to order. Decor is cute too. Let's see... They definitely have more menu items than I'm used to, and the servers would be glad to tell you if the items are specifically for dinner or limited. We definitely enjoyed The Shit (appetizer), 911 (even though it was crazy spicy!), Monster Roll, and their Japanese Lasagna.

_oBTcFwDF2m6MXKmxhrIfg.text: Heard this place is good.  Cant really mess up sushi but damn no lines and very reasonable AYCE prices. Rate them and u get a free drink too limited time only!!!  Thanks to home girl for telling about this joint.

8zoBIhosExf_Xb4JOQxI7w.text: Upon entering on a Friday evening, it was rather warm.  They did have fans sporadically placed throughout the small establishment.  I was seated soon after I walked into the restaurant and my drink order was immediately taken.  Shortly after, I was asked if I was ready to order. I replied that I was waiting for my friend.  4 other people over the span of 30 minutes continued to ask if I was ready to order and each time I had to tell them I was waiting for my friend.  A bit of communication between staff would have been helpful here.  When we did order, I ordered as a la carte.  The sushi was really good! Being from Hawaii, I consider myself a sushi snob and am particular about where in Las Vegas I go to eat sushi.  I would come back here again!    The location is tucked away in the very end corner of the Target shopping center, behind the SAS shoe store.  To me, this makes it less accessible, which in turn means more empty tables!  Finally, I would like to note that we were charged for the all you can eat instead of a la carte.  Not cool in my book.  I am a fan, and will probably go back again.

3visgaOamkhNC3jWJ4XDNQ.text: I don't know what Kevin's problem was today but our orders kept getting messed up and it was getting annoying after the 3rd error BUT i was ver happy with most of the items i had. He even made a comment about ordering so many appetizers. Hello, it's all you can eat and i love to eat so take my order and get me the Shit, which he did. It was very good. Their sushi has the biggest pieces of fish I've ever seen on sushi rolls. It also tasted very fresh. Some of the things i had that were amazing were as follows: Bonita Senorita roll, What The Heck roll, the green mussles, The Shit, Double Dragon roll, and my favorite was the garlic tuna. I had a bunch of other things that were good but not worth mentioning. Going back for sure

ushzKnqxlHOHqv_sM_zFuQ.text: It was my mom in law's birthday and I was looking for a place to eat lunch before we head back home to LA. A friend of my mine from Vegas recommended this place as we are looking for a sushi place.  So we headed to this place....We were the 1st in line when they opened at 11:30am so we were seated right away. We all went for the all you can sushi for $20 each which is not bad.  We ordered all kinds of sushi, nigiri, rolls, their specials, salmon collar, appetizers etc etc and I am telling you they were all delicious!!! we loved every single food they served on our table!  Their salmon and tuna nigiris are one of the best I've ever tasted.  The sushi rolls were amazingly good.  They are not good they were excellent. Appetizers especially the spicy edamami were exceptional.  The freshness of their fish is what got me.  This is the 2nd best sushi place I've ever been in my life so far.  Included in the $20 AYCE is the dessert.  We tried all of them and they were all good especially the fried banana and tempura ice cream.  Staff are nice and friendly and very fast service.  Very nice place and clean.  The only thing I didn't like is the 18% automatic service fee for 6 people and up.  Eventhough, If ever I'm going back to vegas, I will still come back to this place because we love sushi! 5 stars!

gUwJOv_uAxwZtplGFHuEGw.text: Dinner AYCE: $25.99 per person. All you need to know is this place serves up some bomb.dot.com sushi and more! With the recommendation from my dear friend, John L. - I had the privilege to try this spot with a group of my nursing school friends last Saturday! This place gets packed so be prepared to wait, especially around dinner time, especially on a weekend! ALL YOU CAN EAT is basically everyyyyyyyyything in the menu except drinks both alcoholic and non-alcoholic. The menu has soooooo many options, it may be overwhelming, but pace yourself because they have so much to offer. My absolute favorite item in the menu was the salmon nigiri - holy holy sh!t! This was sooooooooo buttery soft and full of fresh flavor - you have to try this! The green mussels were also to die for. For the spicy roll I opted for the A$$ spicy bla bla bla, personally it wasn't that spicy. Here's the thing, I don't consider myself a "sushi lover" so when I say this place is good, it's GOOD. I'd hiiiiiiighly recommend it!

z2eAicxGGfwD6E2y4b3Khw.text: BUYER BEWARE - AYCE UPCHARGE:   My buddy and I did the all you can eat. We ordered a salmon skin roll by accident, we wanted the handroll. It didn't taste good since it was drowned in sauce, so we didn't eat 80 percent of it. We explained this to the thin Japanese waitresses and she was offended and told us it was our fault for ordering the wrong item, then told us that we would be charged for wasting it even though we ate everything else.   Another waiter cleared our table then gave us the check, she didn't think we had ordered too much and didn't bill us for the roll. But then the thin waitress took the bill off our table, charged us for the roll, then gave me the bill back. What?!   Needless to say, the price of the roll was her tip $7 for a $40 bill. AYCE sounds like a good deal, but you might errantly get charged based on how the waiter is feeling. Cannot recommend this place.

3iNv0tuOvS3ZAC8Mkkp8KA.text: Picked this place off of reviews. The menu is pretty decent a lot of rolls and nigiri. The options were endless. I think for me the quality wasn't that great. I actually had a lot of skin that I had to spit back out as it wasn't chewable.   The other thing that got me was the service was slacking. I can actually count how many times my server engaged the table.. it was 4. I had to wave others down for help or refills.   The food was good and I had a great time but I am still on the search to finding a new and favorite AYCE sushi spot. My favorite thing I did like was the mango sake, they have a strawberry one but I'll have to try it next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black Sesame is my favorite dessert. This does not disappoint!

BK4CAew8wZLjP3XQuX8Iow.text: Checked out this spot on 3/6/19 Wednesday for dinner at around 830, there was about 4 to 5 parties ahead of me when I signed in. So I waited outside like the other parties that was waiting to be called and seated for their seats. So 10 mins passed by, then 20mins passed by. And I noticed other parties after me was being seated. So I walked in and check the sign in sheet, and I noticed my NAME was crossed out and I was like wth are we serious right now. I been outside the whole time and no staff came outside to even mention my name. (so WRONG) So I walked to one of the staff people and told them I been waiting outside and no one called my name and somebody just crossed out my name. So the staff person I talked to immediately looked for a table for my party and I (thank you for the quick response time). I had a party of 6 as well.   Aight let's talk Food * all I can say is their NIGIRI sushi here is on different level, speaking FISH CUT (bruhh) thumbs up straight up. We ordered a bunch of different nigiri's specially the ones that are LIMITED to just one order per person like  *Salmon Belly *Ocean trout  *AMA ebi(shrimp) *Uni also orders their OYSTERS which is one order per person kind of wish If was all you can eat oysters (Slurp slurp)   Also their HAND ROLLS were good we had their  *salmon skin  *soft sheer crab (Ohhh weeeee)   For desserts they had green tea ice cream / honey toast with ice  cream (Which is aight)  but I had their TEMPURA ICE CREAM WOWWZERS.   Parking * lots of parking stalls fronting the Resturant and it's free parking as well.   Would I want to come to this spot again * Defiantly Guarantee I would.   If I'd choose between this spot and gyoyemon I honestly would say SAKANA. IMO just better cut and quality of fish. But again everyone has their own TASTE BUDS.   A yo SAKANA can we please make AYCE on oysters please thanks .

pelEpM_FKw2eiutHWoKLaQ.text: This is as good as it gets for $25 pp. I'm really surprised by the quality you get given it's unlimited (almost). There are a couple of items that are one-time-only, such as sweet shrimp. Beware, you are charged for both rice or fish leftovers so take your time, don't over order, and don't get too excited. Once you sit down, you can eat as much as you want! I would come back.  I came around 6:30pm, Sunday, and it was a 45 minute wait for 2 ppl.

xM4xSEzjDGlnf8sm9Zmo0A.text: Wow, just wow Some of the best sushi I have had And I have eaten sushi all over Big pieces of fish and small rice

ukFdVl_PwHkGz5S6J18fHA.text: This is the best all you can eat place I've been to. Not just for sushi but literally for any AYCE place. They had SO many options for rolls, sushi, kitchen items, and desserts. The rolls that we ordered were all amazing, nothing seemed like a bad order. We mainly got ones in the "Signature Rolls" section of the menu and they were the best. The sushi were all fresh and they put a LOT of fish and only a tiny ball of rice which we of course LOVED. The best one was the ocean trout! We also got a couple appetizer items that were marked as "must try". The one that was deep fried was very good! My favorite desserts were the green tea flan-type thing and the black sesame flan. If you are in or near Vegas this is a must.

czT7bKyPLjQDjlKVtfdBCA.text: I was asked by a family friend to give Sakana a try and to report back to him about how it was and was it worth it to go. Well all I can say is Sakana is okay or about 2.5 stars (I rounded down to 2). Definitely not the best All-You-Can-Eat (AYCE) sushi place I've been too and there are better options around.  So I went with my girlfriend on a Friday night (7 PM) and the place wasn't hard to find. Parking was a bit crowded, but if you're willing to park farther back in the lot and take a short walk then you'll be fine. When we got there there was wait. This is a good sign since obviously Sakana is pretty popular. We put ourselves on the wait-list and proceeded to meander around outside. We waited about 45 minutes for about 15 other names to cycle through till it was finally our turn. Inside the place was packed (another good sign). All tables had customers chowing down and tables without people were being cleared in preparation for new customers.  The pricing for AYCE sushi at dinner time is about the same as you would see at other places (~$26). The menu had a wide selection of items and similar to other places there were a few premium items that you could only order once. The back of the laminated menu also had an assortment of rolls. However being AYCE sushi veterans my girl and I know not to order rolls and instead stick with the Nigiri. Rolls typically have more rice and they utilize less acceptable slices of the fish since it's hard to see in or around the rolls. Also most rolls are layered with a sauce that can mask lower quality or not as fresh fish. It's the same reason you don't order steak well done since the chef knows that the meat will be cooked all the way through they can just give you a mediocre slice of beef - you wouldn't be able to tell.  What we thought about the food: We ordered several items including most of the items you could only order 1-time and the server went on her way. Our first round of food came which was oysters and fried whole shrimp (ama ebi). They tasted fine, but the oysters were overly sauced. I would come to realize that ALOT of the nigiri we would receive would be covered in a sauce of some kind. I don't like this since the sauce masks the natural flavor and texture of the fish. It's kind of a cop out to allow a wider range of mediocre fish to be served.  The skewers (also only order 1-time) were ......meh. Anything you order that has bacon will taste like bacon. We had the lobster and bacon as well as the scallop and bacon and you know what they tasted like? Overly crisp bacon. You could've put in toenail clippings and all I would taste is bacon.  Most of the nigiri pieces that we received were already covered in a sauce of some kind. Many of the sauces were sweet which I do not like for my nigiri (see above about my rant regarding sauces). We also received some items we never ordered.  Some additional thoughts: Super white tuna - affected by sauce Uni - lower quality. How do I know? The uni was not a continuous piece but actually several smaller pieces i.e from bunch of sources. Sarada Lobster - Don't waste your time and stomach space with this. It tasted like your standard store bought imitation crab meat that's sweet. Hamachi (Yellowtail) Kama - The portion was small. Go to Goyemon or Yama sushi for a better experience. Towering Sashimi Poke (4pcs) - this looked better than it tastes and wasn't worth ordering since the mixture of fish was masked by the sweet/spicy sauce.  Ice Cream - Green tea and Red Bean both tasted very neutral? They were both sweet and cold, but the flavor of green tea or red bean wasn't very prominent.  What we thought about the service/experience: Our server was personable, but very slow. Either she or the back kitchen preparing our order did kind of a poor job. They got our orders wrong several times. Either we never got what we ordered, received the wrong quantity, received something we never ordered or we had to ask 2-3 times for something we already ordered. There was one item that never came out till AFTER the bill arrived and we were already eating dessert. It was something that we knew they had since we had ordered it before earlier and it wasn't restricted to 1-time. What da fah?  Why we won't go back: -Nigiri as well as most of the items on the menu are covered in sauce. If you like your sushi this way then you most likely don't really appreciate sushi/sashimi and just like things that are sweet. Yeah I went there! I'm calling you out if you must have your sushi sweet, order rolls with cottage cheese in them, or don't like wasabi because it's "too spicy". -Rice quantity to fish ratio is higher than at other places such as Goyemon. So you'll get full on less orders and most of the filling up will be done by rice. -Service was a bit slow which is forgivable on a busy night such as Friday, Saturday, or Sunday, but the staff needs to at least get the orders right. One mistake is fine, but 2-3 on the same table? That's pretty lame.

U6hJ6Q2yk8l6f620LynBUw.text: Winner!!!! Drive, Uber or Lyft here! 3-5 pm early dinner is a great time to come. Our new family favorite. This is a sleeper location in a small strip amongst Absolut Dental, SAS Shoes, Fast Signs, Tio Pepe Tires, and Target.  Absolute Faves- Happy Roll, Hamachi Kama, Ama Ebi, Lobster Roll, & Pang.  Enjoy a mini bottle of Kurosawa sake too! They take your appetizer orders and give u time to check off the sushi you desire. You may put in a 2nd order after most of the rust order is consumed. Fast efficient service  Free Parking, worth the wait (if there is one). 11:30 am-3 pm Lunch $20.95; 3 pm -12:00 am Dinner $25.95

rvbp1U3sXR4C8Tm8HnDZiA.text: It's our first time here. We're loving it . We have something similar in San Diego but it's not as good this place by far better. We differently come back some day.  Great fresh fish.

4dqHhvRN4YhTIFnxpwu1og.text: This is my new go to spot in Vegas. I'm not usually in this part of town but this day I was in the area for work. I was going to drive clear over to Summerlin to go to my normal AYCE sushi spot but saw these reviews and thought I would try it. Oh my lord I'm glad I did.   I sat at the bar and the sushi chefs were legit. Really nice and fun. Sit there if you can. Also pro tip: you can order half rolls which I love since you can try more stuff. Their AYCE menu is huge. Lots of rolls have tempura shrimp which I love but some may not. Do yourself a favor and get the lobster king roll, dynamite, and nigiri. You will get the biggest pieces of your life. It's basically sashimi because they put the smallest dab of rice with a monster piece of fish on top. You can even get dessert. GET THE HONEY TOAST!!!!!!!!

YfjLyKeE_YoPBD5rhrhQuw.text: Wow.  I think this place Has the best All you can eat sushi in Vegas!  The fishes are fresh n generous portions.  The menu is interesting with rolls such as Monkey brain which is fried banana and spicy crab.

_f04iU8BjfAYBH1o_EhSvA.text: This place is amazing, the service is outstanding! Our new favorite when we come to town! The price is unbelievable, and the fish is so fresh, love it!

vQpZwF5vr7TZv8KsDcI0Kw.text: For the price, the sushi is really fresh & super good. The nigiri items you can only get once are really good. I really like the shrimp one (don't remember the name), all the nigiri was fresh. I would avoid the salmon lobster on bread, was too sweet for me and i had to finish it. Was a struggle. I went alone so there was not much of a wait. If you come with a group there might be a wait. Definitely worth it tho.

OFS__Rxv690GZNFfD8UiEQ.text: Line is long but it moves fast. Around 10minute wait for two on labor day weekend. All you can eat has a 1.5 hour time limit.   Highly recommend nigiri over rolls, as they give huge portions of fish to rice ratio. And rolls we got just did not compare. Highly recommend the Uni and Salmon  belly. Best uni ever~  Quick service considering the time limit. Really cute decor and ambiance. Clean and cute bathrooms. All in all, one of the best sushi joints I've been to and beats out of any the Strip buffets.

jMhU3eX65KBKAaLdzlvbDg.text: Over 2000 reviews on yelp, we've been trying to come here forever but it's always pack especially on weekends so my husband and I decided to come on a Monday instead which to our surprise, was still busy but we got a table within 15 minutes for dinner.   Sakana became one of our favorite AYCE sushi joints and I'll tell you why. For $25.95 for dinner, you can order everything on the menu. They have a huge selection of appetizers and nigiris. The fishes are fresh, tasty and of good quality. The best thing to order is the salmon belly, uni, ame, and oysters. Even though it's a limited order of one order per person, it's a must!! We tried almost everything on the menu and it was all delicious!!

afObfdvHnin7bDOFe7yCrA.text: We liked the sushi at Sakana.  One word, "fresh".  I liked the uni (pictured).  The tuna nigiri had more tuna than rice.  Yay for me!  We had tempura ice cream to close our dinner.  The service was very fast and efficient.  Go early, as the dinner crowds are awesome.  We're going back for more.  This is a rewrite, I wrote a review on Sakana for Yelp, but unable to find it.

-0RdvPwyKN41edCnwPLugg.text: We opted for the all you can eat but its a Made to order sushi place which is good because u know the food hasn't been sitting around like at the buffets. However we waited over 1/2 hour and did Not get our food. I asked the waiter 2 times and finally he came back and said we already got our food and i asked him if he saw any food on our table??? He was extremely rude and told me not To yell at him when I clearly was not. Other people in our party couldn't believe how rude he was to me!!!  I wasn't planning to tip but he added 20% tip to our bill. I will not go back to place based on the treatment from this waiter!!!!

GWVoPJdP0Ga9hQ3Zi1sGcA.text: Very crowded and loud. Our waitress could've done alot better with refills. Should never have to ask for a refill especially twice. Food was great, best potstickers ever. The golden California roll was amazing.

zgxv4Gop_hpz8LhE2j9wfQ.text: I always go to a different AYCE sushi when I come to Vegas.  But I saw on Yelp this place was popular so we decided to try.  Compared to the other restaurant this place was crowded which seemed like a good sign. Then I tried the fish and they were good but not as good or impressive as the other place.  So feeling a bit dissappointed we tried lemon salmon roll and I was surprised.  This place had really good sauce.  That is probably why there were a lot more younger crowd. So.. if you like fish, and if you want an impressive fish for AYCE sushi go to other place.  If you like the rolls with impressive sauce for AYCE sushi (as you know most AYCE sushi place have only 2 types of sauce) then come here.

-x8Rb8vS7u_ZuaEuygUJfQ.text: Hooooo boy did we get our money's worth tonight! By ordering the dinner only nigiri (ocean trout, salmon belly, oyster, uni, amaebi) alone, you already  easily surpass the $25.95pp AYCE price. I agree with other Yelpers in that even if you come for lunch, pay the extra $5 for the dinner only options!  Highlights: salmon belly (comes with a touch of wasabi that I thought was great), unagi, amaebi, scallop, and the free salmon sashimi thing we got in the beginning (from one of the chefs who thought my friend was cute heh).  I ordered a bunch of saucy nigiri as a lot of people seemed to like them (yuzu yellowtail, super white tuna w/S.O sauce, smoked paprika salmon w/yuzu). Personally didn't care for any of them..the sauces did not add much aside from an oily sheen to the fish?  Do NOT order the Saba misoyaki - lacking in miso taste and it was not deboned. I had to fish out bones from my mouth after every bite. And I know mackerel is an oily fish but this was excessively oily...I also gave their mushroom skewer a try and was equally disappointed. Literally 1 1/4 plain mushroom on a stick - shriveled and each quarter was the size of my thumb. Took note to avoid ordering any of their appetizers in future visits.  Service was friendly but kind of awkward. Our main server "refilled" my hardly touched water, we would get asked several times if everything was alright different people and when we told them we were just waiting on something, they seemed surprised. I really wish they would go with the system where you mark down what you want yourself rather than taking your order (we had to repeat our initial big order several times).  So why the 4 stars despite all my complaints? That fish to rice ratio!! You could literally wrap the fish around the entire rice ball and more. And for the most part, I enjoyed the nigiri I got. Worth the calories and potential mercury poisoning - I practically had to be rolled out!

lvsMsoPrT9MyfERG6fGv_A.text: From all the AYCE sushi places in LV, I think Sakana might be the best. I'd probably give it 4.5 stars.  Location-wise it is pretty similar to other AYCE sushi restaurants, pretty spacious inside and nice interior. The staff are nice and helpful and the food comes out really quick too.  The only downside of Sakana is that the dinner is a bit pricy, $25.95. However, there is a vast selection of food even me and my brother who don't eat raw fish could fill our stomachs with. So this is the perspective of someone who doesn't eat sushi. First off I believe that Sakana has the best selection of desserts from all the AYCE. Just had to bring that out first :) Loved the mini honey toast and green tea pans cotta! Unagi was good and the donkatsu curry was ok. Chicken Kaarage and Pa Fried Chicken was very similar in taste but I liked the kaarage chicken better. The outstanding part of this place was how all the foods weren't salty and just right. Just how we all like it.  All in all everyone liked the place and positively recommend this place.

FaXfXbMqFAUXpJhIAytMpA.text: This is my favorite AYCE. They are always prompt, have great food and great service. If you want a great place for AYCE, Sakana is the place. It's nothing fancy, but it's a fun atmosphere and great for all ages to enjoy sushi until they are ready to burst.

98W3cnEndKqSW57_WoBaPw.text: I would give no star for the service here. The waitress is doing nothing just being mean... Will update later if the food is good.

lPyJg46-uExzbo7RjAyEMQ.text: Oh gosh... I love Japanese food, and I eat sushi often, but this was the best All You Can Eat Sushi restaruant I have EVER visited. The quality was better than all other such restaurants I have yet visited. I only wish it were closer to where I live! But I do not regret one moment of eating here. Sure the wait times to get in were large for our huge group on a busy evening, but the wait was worth it: this place offers such a great menu with a wide variety of options available. We tried items I hadn't seen on a menu on this continent but only in Japan. We ate some specialties that I had never seen elsewhere (I had a sushi donut!). We all ended up really happy with the ratio of fish to rice, the flavour of the foods, the portion sizes and of course the service once we were indeed seated.  The restaurant is not too noisy (which is remarkable given how busy it was). The food and the beverage is absolutely excellent. I highly recommend coming here and I hope to one day eat here again when next I have an opportunity to visit Las Vegas.  There is ample parking here and transit stops just a short walk away.

cfxNyXCA0AWI_rmYOMraaQ.text: This was my favorite AYCE SUSHI in Las Vegas For many years. Not anymore!  The boss lady very rudely told us to "finish your rice" (see picture) - that's at least one order we didn't finish! I told her I won't come back again and she replied with "don't come back". Other servers came over and apologized to me and calmed me down.  No more Sakana!

BqoqJfP4SBwaqGcPm5fRbA.text: Freshest sushi in town. I was finally able to enjoy their ayce the other night. My favorite roll is the "Lisa Lisa" & yellowtail sashimi. I uber people to this place all the time, now I know why!

aw85q1DnE6UUUzIfcZPtlw.text: Great place for ayce. Surprised I never tried this place in the many times I've been to Vegas. Nigiri was on point and super white tuna was my best. I don't care for the rolls but the Sy's special hand roll was delicious. I would skip the lobster baked roll as the topping are just too sweet for sushi.   Service was great. The gentlemen constantly came to our table to see if we wanted to order more. My tea cup was getting filled often. I would definitely recommend this place to sushi lovers.

uGdrQSPmc5UgmSOyTu-WOQ.text: Fast service, amazing food, large variety. I loved the fact I could do half rolls when doing the "all you can eat" menu.  There was so much to pick from! The staff is friendly, and they constantly check on you. I plan to come back when I visit Las Vegas again.

0csU-GA5SruQwrTXFB7Gmw.text: Found this place thanks to all the Yelp reviews. We weren't hungry enough for the AYCE option, but I'd definitely give is a try if we return. They have a huge menu of different sushi preparations (with fun names) and the traditional sides. The things we tried were all good, though nothing that blew my mind.  What we tried: - House salad- cheap iceberg and pale diced tomatoes, but the dressing was good - Seaweed salad- Good, standard - Hawaiian roll, Bam bam roll, A little tease roll- All fine. The spicy little tease with crispy onions was my fave
