I want to give this place a great rating however due to recent experience I just can't get myself to give it more than a star...cuz the food is good...I understand that it was very busy...I don't mind orders being late and at times the orders being wrong I can live...I don't even know where the order went wrong but apparently we didn't get what we ordered and some of the food we did order we got wrong portions of it...the waiters and waitresses I never have had a problem with they were apologetic about orders being wrong and food being late and for the wait...we asked the waiter about our orders and that we haven't received them so he went to check on them...the manager came by and took the wrong orders that came to our table and she was super rude to start with and told the waiter not to take our orders...she apparently assumed that the waiter made mistakes taking our order but if that was the case and she told him not to take our order than she should have sent us an server to take our order or taken our order herself...her prideful ass is nowhere to be seen for like he next 30 mins and when she does show up and not even to our table I ask her can u get us a server we would like to order with someone cuz u took our server from us...so she said ok didn't send anyone to us and our old server comes to check on us like a good server to see if needed something and he decided to take our order cuz we waited so long to be served..he took our order and when the order did arrive wrong amount of food comes out...we are confused and I was like uh we didn't order this much and oh she shows her ugly face and tells us well that what u ordered...how the hell does she know what we order...she didn't even take our order...first of all we were being as understanding as hell to help lighten the load off the chaos and she has the nerve to tell us not to order the food like that...I mean did she take our order...how the hell does she know what we ordered how much we ordered...got the nerves to tell how to order the food we gonna eat...she she for realz...feel bad for the servers there tonight and for the guest that has to deal with her and her rude and snobby prideful ass...I wouldn't be surprised if there are more terrible reviews like this today...food is great the waiters r coo....I for one will not return as long as she is there...that ain't the only sushi place in town...that manager is terrible got to go back to the basics and learn guest services...the waiters got better customer service than the manager

hN47gPD5Sh8Z4LREeh-Nyw.text: The sushi here is ok. If you don't like a lot of rice in your rolls, you might love it. The karaage chicken and tempera vegetables were not worth it. I think the portions have gotten smaller since last year. We waited so long for a 5 person table that I though the food was going to be really good . The service was no good.  No one attended to us, we would always have to call someone from across the room. The atmosphere was good. I recommend the "what the heck" roll. -Bay Area transplant

tWtQmc96REqp2XYtWRZM9Q.text: After all those rave reviews on Sakana, I requested for hubby and I to have dinner here, on a Friday evening.  When we arrived, it wasn't busy whatsoever, so we sat on the other side, which was separated by plants etc.  However, it was 10 minutes before the male server realized that he had customers sitting on that side.    He then took our drink order and though I was ready to place my order, he said he will be right back since another couple arrived.  Service was SLLLLOOOWWW.  It feels as if though they are short on servers.  When he finally came back to ask for our order, of course I order uni, amaebi, then he stop me and said, "We ran out of uni and amaebi. Let me go check."  Then he disappeared for a while.  When he came back, he handed us a sheet to order from and verified that they do not have uni and amaebi to order.  So I ordered items on the special menu (toro steak, salmon belly, white fish), saba, superwhite, salmon, scallops, salmon kama.  Server came back to let us know that they are out of salmon kama, how about Hamachi kama.  We said yeah that's cool.  He left and returned to let us know that they are also out of hamachi kama.  For the items that we did order, the only thing that tasted good was the salmon belly and toro steak.  Other items were doused with too much sesame oil, tasteless, or downright odd (the scallops tasted like they were previously cooked).  So at this point, I had given up on order anything else since I do not want to stuff myself with mediocre sushi.  Earl however, is eating for sustenance.    We never, ever, order sushi rolls at AYCE.  But this night, Earl did.  He eat, just to eat.  We overheard another table said that they couldn't order chicken fried rice because they are out of it.  How they heck do you run out of chicken fried rice when your restaurant isn't even that busy?  We learned from another yelper that visited Sakana earlier that a health inspector came by earlier and service slowed down a lot.  Guess that explains some parts to the evening, but what about mediocre sushi?  Conclusion:  Goyemon is still the best.  We will not return to Sakana.

h2mx_bcu0NAx2Mhz0AYtpA.text: This is by far my favorite ayce sushi place under 30$ in vegas. The chef's are creative and they serve great quality fish in generous portions. I thoroughly recommend the unagi nigiri that is hand torched, crispy to perfection.   The dragon ballz (pause) were an awesome surprise as well. ( deepfried mushrooms stuffed with crab and mayo). And for dessert, the mini honey toast was clever and delicious! They use a cube of hawaiian bread! For the price, you get so much value. I cant say it enough. This place is totally worth the price/wait/drive/inconvenience to go to. Literally nothing I ordered and ate was lack-luster... and I ate a ton.

LL6eT_6YroNYXxn5QwRH5g.text: Thanks Yelp, you nailed it on this spot.  I don't live anywhere near here, but I wish I did!  We love nigiri and Sakana has an amazing selection and a generous fish to rice ratio.   The fish is fresh and the sauces are bangin'   For just $25 per person for dinner, I left feeling that I had  a $75 per person omakase.  The highlights of our meal were the Chanel roll and the Towering Sashimi Poke (must try!).  We need a Sakana on the West side of town!

3Od_e6BIgzv_G2vLrDVW2A.text: We were looking for somewhere to eat on a recent visit to Vegas.  Tired of the Strip and the Buffets.  Found this place on yelp and I'm glad I did.  It's on a little strip mall near Target, and I never had paid attention to it prior to seeing it on Yelp.  We loved the food!  They have a huge selection of rolls and appetizers, and almost everything we had was really good.  We'll be back for sure next time we are in town.

6f6CGwj-d_9av_VfmWA_7g.text: Favorite ayce sushi place ever. Must have whenever in Las Vegas! Lemon salmon roll ftw

I_V253qN62y-ywra3DSRlw.text: This place is my favorite sushi spot!! The staff are friendly and the sushi is on point!!! I always recommend this place for anyone looking for a place for good sushi!!  Spicy edamame is my addiction.

HiMd6HoMIfCiSHrLzDtIZw.text: Decided to try a restaurant off the strip. Now im back for the second time! Affordable prices and good quality

6FtCKZfPDEOR-MLfIwVWDg.text: My boyfriend and I went with a large group of friends there was a total of 12 I believe. Everyone got all you eat except for me. I'm allergic to a lot of fish so rather than chance it I just got a few things other than sushi. The staff was not friendly at all they didn't really say much and weren't very helpful. They dropped a piece of paper for the AYCE people to fill out which was kind of hard with 12 people and one paper. They took drink orders and appetizer orders and that was all we really saw of our waiter. He refilled our water only once after having to ask multiple times. Once the food was out everything was alright. I had ordered the teriyaki chicken which wasn't very flavorful and dry. I also order the bacon wrapped asparagus which was also dry and very chewy I couldn't even eat it and I ordered the vegetable fried rice which was pretty good nothing really wrong with it but it was nothing spectacular either. Everyone who got sushi didn't really have many complaints. The one thing that was very uncomfortable was how all of the staff watched us like a hawk to make sure all the sushi was eaten because whatever wasn't eaten would be charged for. The waiter came back and took dessert orders. I had the fried banana which was probably the best thing I had ate all night but it still wasn't great. When the waiter brought our bill he charged my boyfriend and for 2 AYCE even tho I didn't do AYCE we brought it up and he fixed it although wasn't very nice about it. Everyone had paid and there was still a plate of sushi (someone in our group didn't finish) when another staff member came over and asked about it our friend told him we had already paid and he got mad and said we should've been charged but he was mad at us like it was our fault we weren't charged. Very unprofessional and awkward. The place was alright but nothing out of this world like everyone has said. My boyfriend thought the sushi was pretty good but has had better. Overall I wouldn't return.

GYa0dfdneesejnMripsM0Q.text: This is the best sushi my husband and I have had yet! It's a super cool little restaurant. They made rolls quickly and beautifully. The service was great, very friendly and fast. We will most certainly go back again when we're in town.

X1Iik0MbFsQqsPQduUXo7Q.text: I love this joint and I'm not posting for a free drink. I sat at the bar and ordered the all you can eat dinner for. For $25.95 you get the run of the menu plus desert. I'm f'ing stuffed and happy. Sushi chef Jose is lightning quick. Quality is good.

DVbBeSCnbPSHPj2i7A6Q4A.text: This place is definitely one of my favorites. It's conveniently right by UNLV and the staff is always friendly. I love love love their garlic tuna nigiri. Sometimes I come just for that...

yHTP3itS0oG6krotr9wDFw.text: Awesome food and service! Wide variety selection and easy access from freeway. The appetizers are bomb and the sushi is fresh!

1G1v6hbBy4qSlvkh15zVWQ.text: I'm not a big fan of sushi but I enjoyed their all you can eat menu. The all you can eat price is about $20 for lunch and $25 for dinner. I am a big fan of their honey toast. Their staff is fast and kind.

w8c-nxC5BTvNON61FQHC7g.text: Beautiful cuts of fish and rice ratio for an AYCE restaurant. Too full to write any more.... Food. Zzz. Coma... Zzz

58ZnRRH5Jqbifc1-NFB_cQ.text: Place was super busy. Food came out quick. Cool atmosphere good music. Roberto was our server and he was on it. Def will be coming back. Garlic tuna was on point. And they can do gluten free. Gotta ask for tamari. But they have it. Great spot.

ugDcsl6MJ6EK7K_yCYSQpQ.text: This place is awesome! Now we can go home to NOLA and tell people about this hidden gem! Food was great! We tried everything! Service was good! The lady kept looking at us but the food spoke louder to us! Ty!

c8Of5ZCUlkIf3qFmdA33Hg.text: Went back here on a Friday night for ayce dinner ($22.99).  If I thought lunch here was already outstanding, dinner kicked it up a couple of notches higher!  Aside from more menu items being available during dinner, the mood and ambiance of this restaurant is way nicer.  The place was nearly full of people, the sushi chefs were having fun, and there's just this atmosphere perfect for unwinding after a long work week.  Being my second time here, I can say that the food quality and presentation has improved.  I don't know if food is just deliberately more elaborately prepared during dinner service or if it was a planned improvement altogether.  We sampled most of the dinner-only items and the stand outs to me are the sashimi salad, screaming-o, sashimi roll, and the towering poke.  Heck, everything we ordered was fantastic!  One thing I should mention is that while service did seem to lag a bit during Sakana's peak occupancy while we were there, I can tell that it's definitely not due to lack of effort or enthusiasm of the kitchen and wait staff.  Our servers had a great attitude even when things were frantic.  Overall, our food was delivered just as fast as we can eat them and our glasses not empty for very long.  Sakana is definitely legit and is a must try for ayce sushi addicts.

z0Xi2hU-pHY2ofLuqKpTyg.text: I honestly don't think I've tasted fish as fresh as I've tasted here at Sakana!   My sister and I are the type to order a whole bunch of food and eat away. To us, the star of the show is always the FISH! And boy oh boy, do they keep it as the star!   Not only were the staff extremely friendly and helpful, but they come visit the table often. That's such a great thing when you're doing AYCE.   The food literally makes it out to your table in a matter on seconds. I swear the server walked away from the table, and 60seconds later, our food was arriving. How do they do it?!   This place exceeded my expectations on the service, cleanliness, speed, and most importantly.... the FOOD!! Yum yum yum.

A1kcnNwbtqVGV7uhVQBmrQ.text: The food was great.   In reference to other reviews: Yes, there was an item or two that had a bit more sauce than standard but it was never overwhelming. Yes, most of the food runners weren't very nice but there were two excellent employees including a younger girl with light brown hair (Alice according to my receipt) and a taller guy who also had some light brown hair. I failed to get either of their names but they were both very helpful and kind.   We ordered: baked mussels, red snapper, salmon, salmon belly, yellowtail, mackerel, super white tuna, sweet shrimp, the shit, ocean trout and the sarada lobster. There were a few other items including the honey toast and the grey pudding stuff. The only thing I was disappointed with was the oysters but it's expected.  There were two items that were special including the tomato roll....I know, but trust me. It was a breath of fresh air. Also there was a roll that was on thin crispy wonton that was amazing!

Oo7KgzFKl294EFEglTziNQ.text: Sakana is probably in the top 5 AYCE sushi joints for me. As a native to Southern California, and a avid sushi fan, I have a had my fair share of sushi experiences. This one in Vegas was very memorable.  Located in a strip mall about a mile or so off the Las Vegas Strip, Sakana would be your go to as a Vegas local. The menu is very large with many choices outside of your normal AYCE menu. The ingredients are very fresh and you'll find just about anything you can think of on the menu.   You can order as you go, the amounts are not limited to 3 or 4 rounds of ordering like many other AYCE places. This is a huge plus for me!  The reason for 4 stars, this place is used to its locals and regulars who mostly know what they want as soon as they sit down. Because of this the service can sometimes feel rushed. We had to ask for more time to check out the menu. While this is probably isn't a problem for regulars, If you're a visitor it may be overwhelming.  Garlic Tuna Nigiri = Favorite Item

eZzhmSp3jgBbS8rhtHYLmQ.text: $20.95 lunch AYCE with no wait? You got me! My first visit was 8/29 and I  wish I discovered this place sooner because this beats all the lunch buffets in the hotels on the strip. .. of course assuming you're looking for sushi :)   I had their salmon, hamachi, saba nigiri and were all good since we were nowhere near an ocean haha. It sucks that their salmon belly, ama ebi, and oyster were dinner only and limited to 1 order per customer.  Quick service, would definitely leave the strip for this restaurant again.

24g9mZrP9wTq5RJxOgCg-Q.text: This place is a must if you want quality AYCE off of the strip! A generous menu with something for everyone. Fast and friendly service. The portions are perfect to get a tase if everything. Do yourself a favor and stop in!

Love that they don't pack on the rice in the nigiris, rolls, and even hand rolls. Score! Fish was decent quality, nothing to complain about.   Service was great! Fast and efficient. AaVcYXutZhRNEXtFbEHMmQ.text: Some friends have been dying to get us to come to this sushi joint - well we finally got to the other side of Vegas and tried some of this delicious food.  We had the pear saki - a great recommendation from our waitress and it was so yummy! We had the salmon, baked scallops, wet dream, pot stickers (can't remember the exact name of these delicious thand mango mochi.  Everything was fresh and very well presented.  This place was very clean and seemed to be very popular. There didn't seem to be a very long wait time however.

9m87hF1iOAWMAQLubbxepg.text: First time doing AYCE in Vegas and I was not disappointed. The food here is literally on point!  Coming from someone who has dined throughout various AYCE sushi joints in So Cal, this place definitely serves fresh quality fish that is fresher than some So Cal joints. Service here is pretty speedy and it's a bit different here for how you put in your orders. Instead of using a piece of paper to order what you want for three rounds in So Cal, you just simply tell the server what'd you like and you can order again when they come around.   As for the fish to rice ratio, this place serves up a bit more rice than what we're used to in So Cal, but the slice of fish is also much fatter than in So Cal.  Recommended nigiri picks here:  Tuna Yellowtail Salmon Salmon belly(toro) Freshwater eel Uni(fresh) Ama ebi(very fresh)  Definitely a great spot for AYCE sushi when in Vegas!

uu-9b7XNOjvkark2ySsKNw.text: I was in the area for a conference and tried the following during my lunch AYCE sushi experience:  Appetizers: -Gyoza: I typically prefer pan-fried Gyoza, but in terms of fried Gyoza goes, this definitely tastes better than most fried ones I tried at other places. Crispy yet thin wrap. Good stuffing inside too. I especially love the sauce that goes with the Gyoza. I loved it so much that I used it for dipping sauce for other stuff I ordered.  -Don Katsu Curry: Not a fan. Doesn't have much flavor.   Soup & Salad: -House Salad: It's ok. I was craving for veges,  but kinda regretted wasting my stomach on the house salad. Don't get me wrong, it's not bad, but with all the other amazing options on the menu, not worth the precious room in my stomach  Nigiri (just right amount of rice, not like some other restaurants with mostly rice tiny bit of fish):  -Ocean trout: Amazing! Must try!  -Tamago (sweet egg): Good -Mackeral: Amazing! Must try!  -Fresh Water Eel: Good -Sarada Lobster: Not a fan! It's crushed lobster salad with creamy sauce. I was looking forward to more like a chunks of lobster tail...  Hand Roll:  -300 (Spicy): Amazing! Must try! All the fish is in big chunks. Very frsh. Tiny bit of sauce to give that extra kick without overpowering the freshness of the fish. Just the right amount of rice.   Skewer:  - Schrimp: doesn't look too good, tastes pretty good.   Dessert: -Afforgato (Vanilla Ice Cream with Korean Style Coffee): I was a bit disappointed with the presentation when it came out, but it actually tasted very decent! Not what I expected, but not bad.   Overrall: Excellent great food and freshly made to order but they come out pretty fast. Service is ok but fast. You can tell they are busy, so I get it. I went there for lunch $20.95. Definitely worth it in my opinion.

YZcmu2rjmAZUmwieTOLTfQ.text: A friend of mind suggested for me to try this place out the next time I visited Vegas. To think that we were so hungry and we were going to settle for Sake Rok bc we didn't want to make that 15 min drive from our hotel was going to be the biggest mistake of our lives lol. Me and my group of friends was so glad that we changed our minds bc this restaurant was ridiculously amazing!!   Upon entering, this place was packed with business so you alr know it's going to be good. We were waitlisted for about 10-15 mins which wasn't so bad. This place is like no other AYCE sushi restaurants bc the slices of fish and the ratio of the rice for their nigiri was perfect. Yall know how certain restaurants like to skimp out on the fish and pack it with so much rice? Lol this place did not do that and I hope it stays the way it is.  Just a heads up, there is an 18% gratuity for a party of 6 or more. THIS PLACE WAS WORTH EVERY DOLLAR, I WILL BE BACK.

xYSZEEx7JcsdnaY80QMvHg.text: We love this place! Great sushi & big menu selections! It was busy but the host/waiter was awesome- he took our order as fast as he can while attending to other customers.

ktkh29JWEFitO9NfkFqDdQ.text: Food was really good !! Waiter was really nice and accommodating when asked if we could move tables cause we had a baby, Overall the would come again

7OIcv_Iz4zOM3ivC1YvrfQ.text: This is by far one of the best all you can eat I've ever had the fish is so fresh and you have a large variety to choose from. And the prices are extremely reasonable.  Next time we go to Vegas I'm definitely stopping here again

jTR71s_F6Wt1yFyZGATHIg.text: So this place can be crowded because it's not very big but if you chime at the right time you will be rewarded with a great meal of fresh sushi.  The staff is great, the food is amazing and the value for the price is also good.     It was a dark and stormy night...  just kidding.  I'm in Vegas. It was a hot night as is always the case and it's been a long time since I've been here.   So a friend and I decided to check it out again.   The last time we came they had just sat a party of 37 so it would be a very long wait which meant we went elsewhere that night.   Tonight would be different.     We walked in and were shown a table immediately.  After perusing the menu I ordered a couple of rolls and some nigiri.    The garlic tuna had many delicious flavors dancing in my mouth.  The Call 911 roll had a good spice flavor that was an adventure for my mouth..   The Burning My Ass Roll was good but not too spicy, I was going for more of a kick.   The Little Tease Roll was an amazing combination of flavors.     Everything I had was amazing and it is easy to see why it's always so crowded.   Wait times for rolls was minimal and my water was never empty.     If you're looking for a great spot on the east side just a little distance from the strip you should try your luck with Sakana.  You might hit the jackpot.

yJfs7KtPQiTJg8tdcoR2cA.text: Best sushi A.Y.C.E. in Vegas! Tuna was a bit off for me... tomago was fresh cooked and not cold.  But the rolls and good size portions of fish to rice ratio makes this place a gem. Everything is fresh made so if you get a roll with soft shell crab or tempura ur actually has a crunch! Pork belly was tender and fabulous, shumai and gyoza deep fried and very forgettable.  Lunch for $21 but you won't get the primo fish so come for dinner for $26 if you want the fish belly selections.  30m after lunch open there is a long line outside.  Calling for dinner reservations... they never pickup.. believe me I tried!

They served every dish 2-3 minutes after I ordered it, except for miso soup and dessert that were brought to me in 30 seconds :) The waiter was very helpful, knew the menu well and gave me suggestions. In the evening there's usually a waiting line but for lunch there are a lot of seats available.

MQ5KO9Vh7UmpfFnP4tZ2sg.text: I didn't check-in because I was too busy stuffing my fat face full of deeeelish fresh fish.  It's in a strip mall, as all the best sushi spots should be.  Things to keep in mind: - $25 for an everything on the menu buffet. - You gotta finish urrrythang on your plate. - There will be a wait. - 90-minute time limit.  My crew (whose weight ranges from 170lbs - 240lbs) ordered like 40 plates to share.  We kill't it all.  Not one roll was left on any of the plates.  Nope.    Nada.

hLVXLAtMUgFAOHNUFCdpnA.text: As far as an "all you can eat" sushi goes it was fanfreakingtastic. Total local hidden spot we were recommended and hesitated going not knowing what to expect. We are self proclaimed sushi snobs from LA where phenomenal sushi abounds. All you can eat isn't our thing...but this was a pleasant surprise.  Some "must get" are the white tuna sushi and the lemon salmon. Quite honestly everything was tasty. As others mentioned the rice to fish ratio is very good and you get tons of fish. Rolls are huge and tasty, service great and $20.95 for lunch is shocking. Tip: to avoid long wait times which we hear can be outrageous, come for lunch right as they open at 11:30 or shortly after. Elastic waste-band helps too... wink wink.

If you are really curious, just order one of it and share it because it is honestly not great and just meant to fill you up.   Recommend: Paprika Smoked Salmon  Pro: great fish to rice ratio and better flavor than Goyemon. They aren't that strict on finishing food.  Con: their dessert is not ayce except for their not-so-great ice cream.   Disclaimer: I am Asian. My review is bias because I love ice cream. I ate there on Saturday 19th of December at 1p.m.

rwz0e8dKaudvYhyuacXKNw.text: This place offers comfortable seating and cozy ambience. The all you can eat sushi is such a good deal!!! However it not just about $$, the quality of the sushi is really good too. I greatly recommend it.

b7ScGAQC07VURWs6Z0HO_w.text: One of the best sushi places in Vegas! And the price is very decent for the quality! The Kiss of Fire, and Vegas roll are definitely favorites!

7QvuDOg35wjPPToceZQHaQ.text: Service is terrible! Was there last night (9/19) & overheard the staff telling people it would be a 30+ minute wait for a table. There was a table for 4-6 right next to us that was clean, set & ready to go in addition to a table for 4 across from us & space at the sushi bar.   The server's don't know their own menu, which is annoying. For example, there are 2 flavors of sake listed on the menu: asian pear & "dragon something" (can't remember the exact name). I asked what "dragon something" was (dragon fruit maybe?) & the answer was "I dunno." The sushi takes forever to come out, the table next to us got some of our food & vice versa,  they simply forgot to bring food, & forget about making a speedy exit cause it took us at least 20 minutes to get the check after asking for it 3 times. To 3 different waiters. Ridiculous.   Food is ok but they need to get it together!

NY6C4aHaoELdCU20-8JnJQ.text: If you love sushi and love all you can eat.. then stop by this joint! Lots of sushi to order from. Very fast service.. sometimes a little too fast that they are forgetful of some items you order.. lol but don't let that stop you from your sushi cravings!!!

I0i1cYttPMNCNTz5ZmYCGQ.text: Best all you can eat sushi by far that I've ever had! All my fellow sushi lovers agree.

7V7UY9rK8fo8NNOVEwrxng.text: Love this place they are so nice and fast the food is great and they have all ypu can eat. I love ordering uni and various other sushis and always its good.

0IVopTV5wkP-jDSj5jsk0A.text: Great night with the family. Had a hankering for sushi. Not a side of town I'm familiar with. Did a quick yelp search and this place came up. Over 1400 reviews, 4.5 star average. Did not disappoint. Totally impressed with the quality, creativity and bold flavors. Highly recommend.

EpTFoXGrFc5tiCr2TbxRKg.text: Awesome service. Food is great. I love the AYCE options which doesn't limit you anything from the menu

5hG82drOfShOysHLEMFIWw.text: 5 Stars!!!! Service here is AMAZING!! Before I even knew it plates were being cleared from our table and our drinks were always full. The food also came out very very quickly. We were seated as soon as we walked in and ordered right away (Monday around noon). Sushi was also very fresh with a ton of options (super white tuna was delicious). This is a great option for those looking for something close to UNLV, would highly recommend and I'll def be back!!!

9hhw1MG-E3clPdAX2KYxLg.text: Good food. We love it. Fresh food. Price is decent. Service is nice. This is my second time for the business from Los Angeles.

iNmXJT_cTIi73mvdKIDX9A.text: Very good value for what you pay for. The AYCE DEAL IS AMAZING!!  You can order off the entire menu except drinks AYCE.  We had Lisa, Lisa, King Lobster, Dragon Roll, Hawaiian roll, and the garlic shrimp roll. All were beyond excellent. This place is definitely a hidden gem in Vegas. We filled ourselves up and then some. Oh yes we also order some non rice items so as not to fill up to fast. Oh yes and 2 garlic tuna rolls the best you have to order at least one order.

oDEsIthDrRHHyTRxOQFZRA.text: The food here is amazing for a great price! Service is quick and portions are perfect. Buy one get one free sale too, it's a great deal! Ask for Armando he's the best

bBu_18C1IuTCCXt4FW4Lhw.text: Delicious!!! Love how fast the food comes out, definitely a must try if you come to Vegas

CPsesGz3JUtE_0-_9JaT0A.text: Got seated within 8 minutes and the AYCE IS ONLY 26 for hogh quality delicious, fun, creative rolls. The service is great and our food cMe out in 7 min even though its busy! Will defnitely be back!!

WHwfyViyGnMLyVnrKhg1Vg.text: This place was amazing. Totally casual string with high quality food at a reasonable price. The  attitude of our waiter was icing on the cake. Really enjoyed my visit here. I have to say I punched the address into my car's navigator and when got there wasn't so sure to go in or not considering its at the corner of s dark plaza somewhere far from action however once looked through the window, I changed my mind. So glad we did go in. Will have to go back to Vegas and eat there again.

Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zt13Y2GRzrW8wp1_hjD-Wg.text: The all you can eat here is the bomb! It is well worth the price. I'm an instant fan of this place! Lots of variety! And the fish pieces are huge and good quality. Think I have a new favorite sushi place in Vegas!

pLB83HJvaAsHOvO8nxuCtA.text: I love this place. Not in the best part of town but really awesome food and they have half size rolls. I love their no rice roll too

daKX_jTDuAhwuCBnh0lMFg.text: Sakana is yet another reason to explore off the Strip. I'll gladly take it over most buffets on the Strip any day.   Came for dinner and at the sushi bar. I was served pretty quickly. Perhaps not the most friendliest of staff but they were great at getting food to me efficiently. With the slightly pricier dinner, you get single orders of a couple of exclusive items like sashimi salad and uni nigiri for example. They were of of the latter the night I went but I still had my fill on a variety of fresh nigiri. I thought the ratio of fish to rice was surprisingly decent. Also tried their highly recommended "The Shit" appetizer and it was alright but fans of deep fried items dipped in sweet creamy sauces might like this a lot. Loved the sashimi salad with all the big chunks of fresh fish in a bright dressing.   In the end, I enjoyed the items that I really wanted to eat and nothing else. Glad I ventured out to satisfy my tourists' gluttony.

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nigiri order #1
Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nigiri order #2
Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sashimi salad

eNTSbU5TtjGImlzlWuV5yA.text: Good AYCE spot with some decent nigiri. Please note, if you come for lunch (11:30-3:00pm - $21) it does not include the following: Uni, Ama Ebi, Salmon Belly, Oyster, Sashimi Tower, Seafood Salad, Sashimi Foll, Stuff Tomato, and Q roll). In fact, I am kind of bummed because I reallllllly wanted the Uni and Ama Ebi   We also ordered some of the recommended appetizers: The Shit, Pang, and Pa Fried Chicken. I honestly don't care for any of these three. I would pass on these fried food and just order the nigiri.   SERVICE: - The servers are friendly and at tentative.come  - They don't have a paper slip where you check off the items you want. Instead, the workers come and manually takes your order with unlimited rounds. - We dined here on a Saturday afternoon (2pm), about 10-15 minutes wait.  TIPS: - Come for dinner if you want Uni and the above sushi at 3:00-midnight for $26. - Save your tummy and skip out on the appetizers esp the ones that's highlighted in red (The Shit, Pang, and Pa Fried Chicken).  - Drinks are 2 for 1. We got to 2 draft Asahi 16oz for $6 (pretty good).   - The hand you their menu as well as a Yelp Review 'menu' to encourage you to write a Yelp review to receive a free small bottle of Sapparo, small sake or Soda. I didn't participate in it, just wanted to give my two cents for my dining experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Some stuff that are only offered at Night time
Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Don&#39;t come for lunch, come for dinner (3:00-12:00am instead)
Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Come for dinner ONLY. If not, you won&#39;t get Uni, oyster, Ama Ebi, and more

T5gd5AQ-qDKYrlCVHqIlBQ.text: I'm giving this place a one star because ..... I did the all you can eat sushi & they messed up 2 rolls I ordered, so I basically paid for all you can eat just for one roll & fried rice & dessert .... also they make you pay for coke refills , they give you coke from a can & charge you $1.50! So just bring your own cans of coke... the server admitted to messing up the orders & did nothing to resolve the issue ... just admitted that it was wrong, this was my second time coming to this sushi spot ... the first time I came I had no issues which is why I thought it was a good idea to return. Over all I'm super disappointed this time around.

9TkXLW4LClfFtE9dc_U85A.text: This place is fire. AYCE sushi for great price. Includes classic, speciality, spicy, deep fried, and baked rolls. Also includes soup, salad, nigiri, and dessert. Service is friendly and consistent. Rolls are really tasty and fresh. Tried the 49ers roll, Playboy, and Salmon Lover rolls which were all delicious. Definitely would come back and would recommend to friends. Located adjacent to the SAS shoe store in the corner (was a bit of a challenge to find).

3QnTXVAzBSNBuzFwE9pfBw.text: I'm so happy I FINALLY tried this place. It was the best AYCE sushi I've had in a long time. Service was great and there were lots of menu options. They also had 2 for 1 beers!  Portions are a little larger than I like when doing AYCE but the fish was nice and fresh! Can't wait to go back for some more

edmc2qzfehSvmIlundFstA.text: Went last night with the family.  Small local spot in a strip mall.  Saturday night and busy but really didn't have to wait too long.  Sushi was really, really good.  The rolls were interesting, fresh and delicious.  The nigiri was great also. Good value AYCE.  Will definitely go again

oubkHeO9DuHR3Z_naJslsw.text: Nigiri served the correct way! Not these Americanized sushi places where there is more rice than fish.   Love it here! Never had an issue. The place always looks clean, service is on top of their game, food comes out quick and tastes delicious. Prices are about the same as everyone else, but you get your money's worth! I'm not going to pay sushi prices to get full off rice! This place does not jip you. One of the best AYCE sushi in Vegas! Definitely a favorite of mine!  Parking is never a problem :) Music is at a good volume. Decor is nice and cozy, yet welcoming. They are quick to get plates out of your way. We were quick to get to our table when we got in, and greeted out as we were leaving.

brC7V75QeUSpFpzF9Xp_OA.text: You guys!! This place got me believing in AYCE sushi again. I have been stuck thinking 'where there is AYCE sushi, the fish isn't fresh'.   My friend picked this spot for our girls night dinner, and I'm so happy we went. Alcohol was BoGo free. AYCE dinner was about $25+ (similar price to other AYCE sushi joints in the city).   I love that we're able to order half orders on rolls. Tiger roll is my go-to, and I've had so many different ones all over Vegas and Cali, I'd have to say Sakana's version is the best.   Their Sake Nigiri was so fresh and generously prepared. Amaebi with the fried head was amazing!! Everything else I ordered, I remember being so fresh and delicious.   Mind you, it's a mission for me to get there since I live in the Southwest, but I'll be back!!!

aw5PfwOGQ1ClejxyC0UlUg.text: This place was good and awesome for the price, the only thing is my wife got sick, her sister got sick, and her mom got sick. Our cousin went there just yesterday (6 days after we did) and got food poisoning as well. I got sick but not as bad as them. I ate everything they did  except the shrimp tempura and the uni. Idk other than that id give em 3 stars. Is anyone else getting sick? Maybe its the 115 weather and the fish is going bad? Be safe everyone.

tD_2GoPdrc_ZlSNg6ZRJSw.text: This place has been closed multiple times for failed health inspections (do a quick google search - my link got removed), which is suspect in and of itself, but of even greater concern for a sushi restaurant.   My orders get lost there frequently and that's enough for me to not want to return, but how about the fact that they serve escolar (laxative fish) to cut costs?  When I order white tuna, that's what I want, not laxative.   Save your money. Go elsewhere.

bv2WqS24cuOdoga3yn1NFA.text: Their AYCE deal is such a good find! So many options and we weren't disappointed with any of them. Our favorite dish was the ocean trout nigiri with garlic ponzu. Soooo delicious.

ziIVc9iZAVBNSnrhWVytWQ.text: This is my 3rd time eating here from California. The word that best describe the sushi is "FRESH"

rF4Blu9Hy7Lo1o3MzfcV6A.text: Amazing service and sushi! Just beware for the shady people who try to get seated with your name. No there was no chance of confusion.. I have a super unique name. (Regardless, not the restaurant's fault) They sat us next luckily and everything was amazing after that! :) Must visit this place when in Vegas!!

y9wCEsZ4YRKiQ8r8HPkHEw.text: Decided to try this place; a last minute change of plans.  Decor was really nice, place was clean.  One thing I liked was the seating.  I didn't feel like I was sitting on top of each other.  No tables with the little divider wall.   All wins in my book. Food was great.  Had the garlic chile edamame, shrimp tempura, a tiger roll and a few orders of albacore.  All very delicious.   Also tried the gyoza and the dynamite.   Definitely a must try!

NXgiF0TDZZKG4YVlMGgiPQ.text: Only good thing to say - decent quality sushi.   Terrible service! Did not ask for ayce, but our server apparently ran our orders as ayce. Huge upcharge when my girlfriend and I both ordered conservatively. Of course when our meal was over our server was gone and we were left with a big tab for ayce when neither of us ordered or wanted all you can eat!   Even worse, for ayce, our service was atrocious! Asked if we wanted anything else once, forgot to give us ginger or wasabi, etc!   Honestly will avoid in the future! Feels a lot like being stolen from when you're charged for all you can eat without ordering it or giving any indication of it! Zero stars. Very negative experience.   Would not recommend.

2rpQz29aiEBGuLgoBqstuw.text: Had to try the sister restaurant of my favorite ayce sushi spot, Sushi Neko, and went on the busiest time on a weekday for dinner around 5:30pm after work with 2 of my buddies.  It was quite packed, but we got seated right away!  The restaurant is pretty small compared to Sushi Neko, with the same ayce menu and the same type of quirky and dim ambience. You're table is quite close to others, but I was totally fine with that.  The busperson and our main server was very very attentive and quick considering how busy it was.  We got our rolls ordered fast and it was awesome!   I definitely recommend this place- because if they're that attentive asking if we'd like to order anything else constantly, and the rolls were coming in that fast on a BUSY time for DINNER.. Imagine any other time.  I also think this is the 'cheapest' ayce for dinner if I'm not mistaken. $25 ( $28 after tax ). About a dollar off or so than othe dinner pricing I guess.    Oh and they definitely put a generous fish chunk with a little rice ratio for nigiri's, just like Sushi Neko.  Thanks Sakana!

0Zrh3iD8GTS80_DvYmwHIQ.text: Such yummy sushi and great staff! All you can eat at a decent price. We always come here when visiting Vegas!

7hYBTsHQnaLTz-GQQA31LA.text: Very generous portions of fish for the nigiri!  I wish this place was where I lived. Great staff, fast service, quality sushi. Come here for the AYCE!

LC-JFiDfyiSuCgK6ebj3wA.text: Yes! My goodness! This was my second time and it was just amazing as my first time. The chefs really know what they are doing. All rolls were delicious and the services was spectacular. I highly recommended and I'LL BE BACK.

Situated seconds from unlv, many of the patrons probably come directly from class, especially noticeable by boarish behavior... The food is on point, however our waitstaff seemed to be overwhelmed, forgetting certain portions of our order (uni worth quail egg...mmmmmm)still going back! Try anything and you'll see why

IKQtZuxGHPZ8kCwoBdGy2g.text: I don't know where I been goin all my life. But it's nothing compared to the sushi here.  Amazingly well done!!!

5bjHTmlb8d5pi6Vv46Lymg.text: 1st time in Sakana, had the AYCE. It was great! I enjoy to try new sushi places all the time, and this one is now one of my favorites!

7TqO0PWbae30ToWvFuPTwA.text: I LOOOOVE this place! We didn't have to wait, the food was amazing, AND I love the environment.  Plus, the all you can eat special is awesome.  I definitely recommend the tempura ice cream. DELICIOUS!

O_VnfwaHD6ZV40HugFp-EA.text: Our party of 8 went to Sakana Sushi back in November w/our Taekwondo team after tournament. Tonight, we had a party of 20 after tournament. I tried to make a reservation but they wouldn't take it because they already had other reservations & were expecting it to be a busy Sat night. Our large party decided to take a chance even if we had to split up. I put in 3 names for parties of 7, 7, & 6. I let them know we were willing to split up in any number of ways as long as they could accommodate us. There were tables opening up & they mentioned they would try to seat us together. After waiting about 30 mins, the staff was able to put tables together so we could sit together as a team. The staff was great in accommodating us! Everything was delicious & the staff was very friendly. We'll definitely go back when we come out to Vegas!!!

M4MU2ASyiv0kJwne-0PXlQ.text: Super fast and convenient service as well as good music to vibe too ! The Jalapeno bombs were some of my favorite things to order !

v_PokBbIf7W1GFTfn6UP6A.text: So after nearly a year, we came back here for another try.  Since then it's quite clear that from Grand Opening to now, this place has gotten popular.  This time around we stocked up on the nigiri: Garlic Tuna, Albacore, Cajun Tuna, Octopus, Surf Clam, Sarada Lobster, and Ocean Trout. All delicious.  This place still apparently has some of the absolute best Surf Clam. They use nice portions for all the seafood.  The Salmon Skin Roll is excellent, just saying.  Full Moon Roll is still one of the best here. The Japanese Lasagna was good, not amazing.  Towering Sashimi Poki is still really great, and only comparable to Sushi Doh's "Nacho Daddy".  Seafood Salad is decent. I actually preferred the cucumber out of it. The Bulgogi Nacho is tasty, and different all around.  Green Tea Panna Cotta for dessert, a nice touch.  I would definitely come here a 3rd time. I'd also recommend giving this place a try if you haven't.  Service is still very good too! :)

IJ7h06nSrB21PSAK5sECKQ.text: Dragon the Chef is hilarious, you Must sit at the sushi bar! Very helpful and considerate on what to choose, how "heavy" a roll is, etc. Does not make the experience awkward at all. He gave me a Starburst while I was thinking of what to order next hahha! Also, I think the ratio of fish to rice is amazing so if you're downski for nigiri, this is the place to be. Eat slow and get the Handroll. Yum! Lots of interesting and unique items on the menu, and the lunch/dinner AYCE prices are more reasonable than others. Only problem is finding this place since their sign is still paper, but hey, a diamond in the rough this place is  definitely coming back

28qqoXXn9XuYiYccb1jZCw.text: Stopped by this place on a Sunday night. The first thing that strikes me about the place is the decor. It has an identity crisis. Part of it looks like a normal sushi restaurant and then there's a wall that looks like a real life Pinterest board. Just wooden arts and crafts and etched sayings and such. It seemed out of place.   There were a ton of servers working but it seemed that it didn't lead to great communication. We were asked a few times by one server about ordering and then asked again by another server. I'll take this though over having no one talk. Having too many people trying to take your order is a  good problem to have.   For the food, I got a hand rolled tuna roll. It wasn't great, and for the price is disappointing. Though, we had a tray of their special roll of the day and that was pretty tasty.   Remember how they were so many people taking our order? None wanted to take our money. That's always the thing that boggles my mind about restaurants. I want to pay for services and it's hard to flag someone down. That was a bummer. Plus, some of the seating is hard wood blocks. Probably a Pinterest craft but it should be more for decoration as it did not make my posterior feel good.   It's definitely a quirky place and it's worth a shot, just get a regular seat.

VW80gwCO-3qK5Brh3GTHnQ.text: Awesome awesome awesome awesome im loving it so hard hahahahahahahahaha bery goood bery bery good hahahcifjeosnskcjsnssbkvksbkskvkskbsohosboshihosg

j7WrImE1AE7aLTGFwZTgQw.text: They have a large menu of sushi and the quality is pretty good. This is my second time here

Z8VdLn8QLBdbUrMP-UvqRQ.text: Sushi is my favorite food, so when I saw the stellar reviews at Sakana I knew we had to try it on our recent trip to Vegas. Expect a wait, but believe me, it's worth every second. The menu is extensive and amazing - hands down the best I've ever seen. The service is outstanding; Hambee was our waitress and she was super fast and very attentive. The sushi itself was phenomenal and the best I've ever had - my only complaint is that my stomach wasn't big enough to try everything on the menu! We love all-you-can-eat sushi and couldn't recommend this place more.

z92N_lMdFobsxvrZavU0kA.text: After going to few other sushi place, I realized this place put way too much sauce on everything. And why call it skewers if they just deep fried them.

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The place looks very messy. The furniture is built amateur

hX7O52ttuejDf0ykHAO2Zw.text: It was worth the wait!! Lol we decided to have dinner here on new year and waited about 30 mins. As soon as we sat down, everything was great! the service was super friendly and the food came out fast. It's not like some of the ayce sushi places where they don't check on you anymore after a large order lol the server was constantly checking on us and the bussers/runners were always refilling our drinks and taking our dishes. The fish for the nigiri is cut thicker and bigger than everywhere else. If you don't like a lot of rice this place is for you. I prefer my fish cut thinner but it was really fresh and delicious so I didn't mind the thicker cut. The rolls are also bigger here, make sure to ask for half rolls so you can try a lot. For appetizer, the shit is a must but the pang is so so, it had too much mayo. Oh yeah the mayo! They're kinda heavy on the mayo here so read the description of the rolls if you're not up for that kind of richness lol like the monkey brains had a LOT of mayo. That with the mushy bananas was definitely not one of our favorite rolls lol we finished our meal with a great green tea panna cotta and the mini honey toast. We also tried their ice creams. Great way to end our meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shishito peppers
Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pang

KmF8UBUlte21tbz48yvsbw.text: I love the lobster roll and monkey brain! Also the nachos are super awesome. I come here with friends and do the all you can eat or just get a roll or two. It's very well priced and good quality. The decorations are so cute and even when it's very busy it never feels packed or hectic. Honestly, my favorite sushi place in Vegas!

EyGa9AqmywyIUoRtTViL1Q.text: We went to our favorite sushi place in Vegas tonight.  It was wonderful as always.  Chef Cy kept the sushi coming!  Our favorites are the Tiger Crunch roll and Popcorn Lobster roll and Hamachi.  The creamy shrimp appetizer is filled with yummy cream cheese and the tempura shrimp is always freshly made - so light and crispy.  Great meal again!  We bring all of our guests here when they come to visit.  The A-Y-C-E is an awesome deal at about $25 for dinner.  I usually get mine a-la-carte now.  We've been here so many times that I know my favorites.  We can't wait to come back!

HWE9_9glPDbMbiQYwGjInQ.text: $25 all you can sushi  but a great amount of selection of rolls, nigiri, and appetizers make this place a steal.  the food is good the customer service is even better.  really recommend and love the hours for a nightime crawl

qG5l1o_orjcex1_pyq_vmQ.text: I have been here so many times I lost count my boyfriend and I drive 30 minutes, sometimes get stuck in traffic just to come eat here! The burn your ass roll is our number one favorite role in Las Vegas he says "in the world!" the sauces are all one of a kind you can't find anywhere else that makes the spicy chili sauce they do also the popcorn lobster roll is very good along with all their appetizers the service is very fast sometimes too fast but it's better than a long wait. Lunch price for All You Can Eat is amazing but spending a few more dollars for dinners so worth it and still pretty reasonable for all you can eat. I Love Sushi I eat it at least twice a week I've been in Vegas 8 years and this is still my number one place even beats Osaka in my book

C2VmqtkpcGZ3GNKvRRFW4w.text: I was very pessimistic about the location & the restaurant when we got there, but this is truly a hidden gem and I should know better not to judge the book by its cover.  We went on Father's Day for dinner and had the all-you can eat buffet.  It was worth every penny and more!!!  All of the fish was FRESH since I'm assuming the turnover ratio there is high.  My dad used to be a sushi chef and he agreed that he liked this place!  Also the SERVICE is awesome!!! Very, very friendly staff.  I don't give 5 stars often here, but this place deserves it!!! My brother said it best -- This is like a Japanese Tapas place!

cTMmRmzpJYm0Hy9MrcYalw.text: My girlfriend and I came here for the awesome AYCE deal. Great food, service and atmosphere. We will be back next time I'm in Vegas!

hYTGlEKFeMEdS6kQylUfjw.text: I'm always sketchy when it comes to an 'All You Can Eat' sushi restaurant. I was with a group and decided to just suck it up and buy in since I was the only one at the table with reservations about it.  I was more than pleasantly surprised with the variety on the menu and even more ecstatic when our waiter told us that desserts were included! I love Mochi and the coffee Mochi was Delish!  The fish was extremely fresh and cut thick. The rolls were big and they weren't cheap or skimpy on the amount of fish and shellfish that built each dish.   The 'Burning Your Ass' roll, 'Lemon Salmon' roll and The 'Johnny' roll were a crowd favorite.  The only thing I'd change is the sauce on a couple of the rolls. Some were a little too soaked which made them a difficult to eat and over powered the dish.   The restaurant was clean and the decor was modern and fun! The walls are covered with cool art, big chalk boards with colorful chalk and a plank wood tree climbing up one of the walls into the ceiling. Did I mention Hello Kitty was the decor in the women's restroom? Any girl would love that. It has an all around Japanese Hipster feel. It was right up my alley!   The staff was friendly and our waiter was patient with our big party. I will definitely be going back every time I'm in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seaweed Salad. Simple, refreshing and delicious.
Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Burning Your Ass Roll. Loved it!

o-gwGK7GXfiq7iYR8D7s4A.text: Love this place! The food and service are wonderful. We go here at least a few times a month, just can't get enough! The appetizers are my favorites! Try the pork belly, nummy. The atmosphere is also very welcoming and upbeat. Give this place a try if you haven't already.

vhB4HFyXAmn-QtgGNaUBpQ.text: I just changed my rating to 5 stars from 4 stars. That's because I went again fir their dinner  AYCE and enjoyed it a lot. Dinner has more on the menu especially uni and amaebi which I love.  The raw fish is exceptionally good and fresh.  It's a hidden gem! Tucked away in a little plaza but when you get inside you know you are in a Japanese restaurant and when you taste the food you'll know it's good quality and will satisfy your tastebuds.

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great food!!
Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch menu
Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Decor

3MAeDOyaxdQs8backG4tlw.text: What more do I have to say that hasn't already been said about this place? It's my favorite sushi spot in Las Vegas, even though the place is kinda small and it's gets super packed, the servers are very attentive and they bring out the food in a timely manner. The ayce is super extensive with all kinds of different rolls to try, must stop spot for sushi lovers for sure.

VIolJcsOILUvjp1gPY51gA.text: Service was curt but at least they did not forget any of our order, which happens often at AYCE. They push several appetizers on their menu as "must try" - I tried to ask what was in the Pang and The Shit but not only did the waiter not answer me, he put them into our order and we were forced to eat (or pay extra for without eating) both apps which turned out to be all fake crab. I was just asking about them, NOT ordering them!  Nearly every roll has fake crab in it. Ordered the King Lobster roll because it did not list crab as an ingredient, but not only did it have crab, it did not have lobster. Even with asking for sauces on the side, the rolls were also all sweet so we gave up on them after a while and concentrated on nigiri.  Nigiri was okay though the rice ratio is off. A lot of people like it this way but it is far from authentic. With the long slice of fish leaving a tail that hangs off the little round ball of rice, they look like sperm. (I did notice that the more we ordered the bigger the balls of rice became, but that could have been a coincidence.) The salmon was the best fish they had. The super white tuna (ono) was both pretty good too. Unagi and yellowtail were fine, nothing special. Tuna and albacore were so-so. Ocean trout was stringy. We liked the two seared salmon items, but the garlic tuna and the 300 albacore tasted too similar. We were here for lunch so did not get the dinner-only salmon belly, oyster, uni or amaebi.  Mini udon was good - the broth was a little on the sweet side, but the noodles were nice and chewy, not overcooked at all.  Agedashi tofu was okay. Flavor profile of the sauce was off and the breading was a little too thick for agedashi.  I'm not usually much of a sweets person but the dessert may have been the best part. Both the green tea panna cotta and the black sesame blanc mange were very firm and not too sweet. Both had developed a skin on top, so if you like pudding skin you'll like this. I don't know if they changed the policy since that other guy's review where he was able to order unlimited desserts, but we were only allowed one per person.  Unlimited refills on $1.50 iced tea. They have regular and green, and both can be unsweetened.  I didn't see any signs about the free drink with review. All I saw was a sign saying they could only split bills into 6 checks per group.  The ladies' room was painted in fake Hello Kitties all over the walls. They were obviously amateur but not bad considering it was done freehand. And there was a lamp that looked like it was from Ikea - the nearest Ikea to Vegas is in West Covina, CA - my local back in LA!  They played a lot of Korean music videos, including 3 different Psy songs. They also played a Girls Generation song that sounded like they were saying "I've got a boy on my chin" - is this a song about having a dead conjoined fraternal twin fetus on your face?  They did let us order the AYCE lunch with 3 minutes to go before dinnertime. Can't say for sure I'll be back but it was worlds better than Sushi 21.

Pg2GnVImNnYUiqgHpq8O6A.text: didn't even try the food so this is just based on customer service . first there was answering the phone to know how long the wait is . second we show up and it's a packed house . with no host to take down a name or anything just a waiters/waitress walking by and us having to ask how long the wait is while they really ignore us .

gsDjVHUyO4TkWlgwfFyDdg.text: Oh gosh..another sushi craving, where to go? My friends and I decided on Sakana. This was my first time, but one of my friends has tried this place before so she steered us in the right direction.  Service: it was pretty empty in the restaurant when we stopped by at 2 pm on a Friday. The staff was pretty helpful. The waitress always made sure we had water and asked us if we needed anything  Price: 21+ for all you can eat. It's definitely on the cheaper sides of ayce sushi places, which is always a plus  Food: I'm going to be honest, I don't remember everything we got, but I honestly feel like everything they have is good! The nigiri was awesome! The fish the rice ratio was perfect! You should just order a bunch any of this. The monkey brain really stood out and so did the green tea panna cotta.  This place definitely needs a try if you're around the area!

iVxz34LOma6grPbJ6_XqxA.text: One of my favorite AYCE sushi spots in Vegas!  I would give them 5 stars but I don't care for the small pre-scooped ice creams.  Other than that,  its perfect from the service to the sushi!  My favorite is the nigiri & pork belly!  Their nigiri is really fresh, perfectly cut, and has a small amount of rice in it.  They also allow half rolls on the 8 pcs rolls, so you can try a variety of rolls if you want!  Support your Locals!  Eat Local!

txtdhD2wSCCNhIanNMkgFg.text: OMG. I've died and gone to heaven!  They are cranking the sushi out super fast.  The flavors are wonderful and the food is hot.  A must try off the strip.  Great deal for $21 lunch.  I may not eat the rest of the day and it may take a forklift to get me out of here.

IMnTvMECSMCjx9bFUU0Y8g.text: Went here on New Year's Eve.  It was busy but the wait was not too long or unexpected.    Service initially took a little bit as they were super busy but the waiters were all moving at a blurring speed.  Once they took our order, the food arrived quickly and was good quality and taste.  Ordering more for the all-you-can-eat sushi was easy, fast, and arrived quickly.  Waitstaff was extremely friendly and especially composed for such a busy day.  Would go here again next time we're in LV.

nbTl5pt1pSD2grztKbm8UQ.text: Our waiter and waitress was so polite. As soon as we came in they escorted us to our table. He said anything that we needed to let him know and he even greeted us at the end and told us to enjoy today. I think his name was Kevin I'm not too sure. But he was awesome. The service was awesome and the food was awesome! I recommend the lobster king roll :)  I highly recommend this place and for their dessert you need to try their honey toast.

xICZU-7CCkKkkE7AuaaX5A.text: What can I add to 1000+ reviews and nearly a perfect 5 stars?   This place kicks ass! Great service, very high-quality sushi and all you can eat from the Sushi Bar, not a buffet.

KsyY-_xUK8xCcdjMRs0HNg.text: One of the best sushi places I've been to. I think I ate more that day then then ever have before. Everyone in our group ordered the all you can eat, and we did not regret it. Now, I don't eat raw fish, so I ordered California rolls and the Wet Dreams rolls. They were so good I had to order two more. On top of that I order the miso soup and the green tea ice cream, both very good.  The service was also great.  There was always some one checking on us every 5 minutes without being overbearing and the food came out quickly.   Definitely will be back the next time I visit Vegas.

Xibci6PqQuMqo1TZEgBc_g.text: Quality AYCE Japanese food. Sakana is worth every penny. All the raw pieces that we got was fresh. Hot food aren't bad either.  Everything was good I can't even decide on a favorite.   Definitely better than all the buffets you'll find on the Strip.
