rAR3lvSETnU7BsIdGQaLGw.text: Best AYCE sushi in Vegas!!   The fish quality is always the best and their fish to rice ratio is perfect!   I always stop by here whenever I'm in Vegas and is so much better than the hotel buffets!

A3kTH0LYhvKABVRx8YzOqA.text: Best AYCE sushi in Las Vegas!  We drive all the way to the other side of town just to eat here. The sushi is incredibly tasty and fresh.  You might have to wait a while to get seated during peak times but it's definitely worth the wait.  Be sure to try the cajun and garlic tuna, amazing!

57CB1DB1S7n3XEO83dBcKg.text: Everyone's been raving about this place but Yama still rules this area. Sakana has a very similar menu to Yama but the rolls we ordered were doused in mayonnaise-y sauces. We sat at the bar and asked for recommendations but instead the sushi chef just started handing us sashimi that I personally don't like to eat. Maybe this is a plus for some people but it filled us up to where we didn't get to order other stuff we wanted because we didn't want to be charged for leftovers. We tried "the shit" appetizers which is advertised as a must try but I think it must just consist of leftover fish deep fried and served with the spicy mayo sauce. All their appetizers are tiny which I guess is expected. Nothing stood out at all. Definitely will be sticking to Yama or Tomo in the neighborhood.

YSmLjbLpRKB7LWmmVk7GGg.text: I have a rule about AYCE sushi and that is: Just don't do it!   I can't help it. I try so hard not to be a snob about food but ultimately I am just so picky. I'm so glad I bit the bullet on this one and squashed the inner voice screaming at me not to risk the bad experience.  WORDS CANNOT ACCURATELY DESCRIBE HOW THIS PLACE IS BEYOND FANTASTICALLY, INCREDIBLY GOOD!!!  I tried to start off easy and pace myself but found my self throwing in laundry lists of orders each time and feeding like a bottomless pit that had not eaten for days. I left this establishment on a euphoric food high and dreamy daze for the night.  Pro tips: 1- Sip your drink. You need to save that precious stomach space for more sushi 2- Try the riceless items so you don't get sick of all the sushi rice 3-Save a teeny bit of space for the mini honey toast 4-Order the garlic tuna because it will knock your socks off 5-Now order the garlic tuna 2 more times because one order is not enough and that second order isn't going to be your last...  Did I mention that this place will leave you deliriously happy? Turns out that money can buy you happiness in the form of sushi for only $26. Time to re-evaluate my life goals now that this new data has been made aware to me.

NLC-GtqR4yX189OK0tzX-g.text: They only have so many reviews because you get a free drink if you review them right then and there and show them. Of course they're going to get high ratings. I value honest opinions when I consult yelp, so I didn't take the free drink.  That said, the sushi's nothing special. If you were to buy it piece by piece, you may actually spend less than the AYCE deal.   Orders come out fast and very hot. I would advise you to let fried or baked items cool down for a minute or two. I got blisters in my mouth.

r8aK_WUjZtAYTNLGiHCx8g.text: This place was freaking amazing.  Service was fantastic. Everything was fresh and well prepared. Presentation was great and original. This is one of my new favorite places. Go  Enjoy Go again

C3VnQSb5gUdy-1rePrg1yw.text: Came in for their all you can eat. Food looks good. Service was fast and didn't take long for a seat.

Nck1HMjtXduMZIu-LXZOGQ.text: So my friend and I have been coming here for a few months now since it is closer to us. Sakana was great until our last experience. I had ordered nigiri garlic tuna and the fish was a darker color and very thick cut. Did not taste fresh at all, our sushi rolls had way too much sauce on them maybe trying to mask the flavor. Customer service lacked as well, one of the servers (had a beard with glasses) kept coming up to the table staring us and walking away totally creeper status made us feel uncomfortable. And to top it off there was a hair on my food. Instead of having the manager apologize and offer a discount or waive the drinks he stated that it happens all the time and it's not under their control, like I'm sorry what? It happens all the time? Like is said instead of apologizing all he did was offer an extra dessert.  How unprofessional is that, especially coming from the owner of the place. Clearly he doesn't care about his customers so due to that I would definitely not come back here again. Make sure you guys check your food before eating it!

NsOAFPo19iPNdJGj2NqF3A.text: Great service and good food will be trying the love my ass had a lot of rolls and the the jackpot is the best

VKljQWOrONrDx6L5tYFKhA.text: Delicious sushi! Great service! Love the music! We live close by and this is our go-to sushi spot. Awesome staff and the place always has a fun local vibe. We love it!

Ih9LU5McPvy8X9M3pyS74g.text: I'm very picky with my sushi. I believe that sushi is an art and its incredibly hard to find a place with the perfect balance of fish rice and toppings. I feel like this place had good fish. That's a big deal because most places in town don't. they were a little heavy on the rice which is kind of typical. a lot of places give way too much rice to make you full faster and then charge you if you leave any rice behind. Albacore is my go to on any menu. I already know that if the albacore isn't up to par the place wasn't very good. fortunately the fish its self was delicious but they put an over whelming amount of toppings on it. i could barely taste the fish. I still haven't found a place that is as good as Sushi Koma in town. Also, I don't like the new remodel of the restaurant. the chairs are uncomfortable and its too claustrophobic.

P1nT957n5rHtxMffMR9-Ag.text: The wife and I decided to try this place a week ago. The sushi choices were good (not too many cooked options for those of you that like cooked choices) and the food overall was decent. Nothing wow about it, the primary reason we went here was because it's open late and our usual spot (Blue Fin) was closed. The server was not at all helpful when asking for recommendations he was like a dead fish (see what I did there?) definitely not going back there but maybe if you go and give it a try you won't be as u lucky as us and get the same guy.

KszarhMhiEvQcy2Q1P5N5g.text: It seems as though more and more locals are finding out about this gem tucked away in the Target shopping center. After having a sushi craving and not willing to wait an hour for a nearby sushi restaurant, I hopped on Yelp and low and behold there was Sakana. Didn't even know this place existed. The food is excellent and the service is fast and friendly. Love the garlic tuna and yuzu yellowtail.   SN: typing this review has made me crave sushi. The struggle.

__03SjOgzvZh9mPvxwrHsw.text: This was my first time eating sushi and the experience was incredible. The food was amazing, but personally the raw fish wasn't for me. Happy to have tried it and this was a great place to go. We were seated immediately and the service was top notch.

zXl0oaxLNMAXtLn_X5y7Yg.text: This place was recommended by my friend and he has recommended others that raved about the place so i decided to go. I must say I enjoyed it. We had the lobster roll which was bomb by the way! We also had the "burn your ass roll", "call 911 roll" and the Japanese lasagna.. Which were good. We have the chefs special roll as well which was ok. I wish the lobster and the japanese lasagna had more rolls. They had only 4 in them. But other than that, it was good. Id go back there again.

S3kBA9DVN1E29yh1ZPDMBg.text: Still love this place! Sakana is still one of the few places I go for sushi because of the amazing service & quality of food. I first went to Sakana when it was fairly new & that's when my obsession with sushi started. They had decent service but since then their service has become much more impressive since they got new management. They still have all the same delicious items & I'm still in love with the nigiri. I do miss their very cheap prices for AYCE it's gone up a couple of dollars but it's still worth it & cheaper than other AYCE places but they're still much better. I do have to say the desserts for AYCE is limited. Before you could have as much as you want now you can only have one of each dessert not including the ice cream. Other than that in still satisfied.

R8A0ct3NygMHHD31xYYhqg.text: Good rolls. Friendly service. Cool decor. Cold beer. Fair prices. I recommend.

eACoH9ircigMmnS-lSQVcQ.text: We have been going to this place for about three years , and it has gone from the best sushi I have ever had,  to out experience last night.  The service was horrible, the dumb waiter was very slow and tended to others until we had to call him our table . Plus they waited until we had multiple empty plates before they cleared table.  And the most important part was the sushi , which tasted old and frozen for far too long. The sushi was very chewey which made inedible.  All in all , this place has gone from a excellent to straight up gross. I've never written a review before,  it's a shame that it has to be a bad one . I will never go to this place again .if I can give it negative stars I would. Unfortunately I have to find another sushi place.  Suggestions welcome.

fFnfCiSoitnWN_5493m8SA.text: We love their AYCE sushi!  Make sure you sit at the bar to get the best service from the sushi chefs!  They are entertaining, friendly, and very creative.  The chefs make us special dishes all the time.. I eat all the raw sashimi, and they are always really fresh!  They also have the cheapest prices for AYCE around town in Las Vegas!

N5QD4tkSoGYmgnXQfwzMGg.text: I've lived in Vegas for 8 months now and this is one of many sushi spots I been to and I keep coming back to this one. I love this spot for its service, quality of food and taste. It's a small spot so if you do plan on going try making reservations.

ah00A7_XoEo7ndbit_UTog.text: Nothing special. Not sure why so many great reviews. Went here for an anniversary dinner and regretted it. 2 for 1 Asahi was good and that's about it.

PKzqTk2OmexdAQO6oxEVlw.text: 1st time here. We usually go to Makino. Don't think I'll be going back to Makino.  Better quality sushi, roll, etc.  will definitely come back.

z_ians7mY-YB5lspM_zIVw.text: SUPER FRESH FISH!!!!  WOW! I'm still amazed at how fresh their fish was. I'm very sensitive to raw fish because I can detect even the slightest fowl taste in raw fish. But, all the nigiri we had ordered were so fresh that they all melted in your mouth! I loved the cajun tuna the most as it added a little bit more flavor to the tuna. We also got the popcorn lobster roll, which is also another item i've never seen elsewhere before. Their rolls were made of fresh ingredients as well and the popcorn lobster added the perfect crisp to the roll.  I think their prices are very reasonable, but their portions are a little smaller than normal. However, their AYCE price is $25, which makes it all well worth it! They were also very generous on Thanksgiving, they had given us a free plate of sashimi (not sure what type of fish it was) for our table of 9, and that was really fresh as well. All in all, I'm super happy to have found this place as their service was good and patient with our large party.

lLOlLwbwyh_cdJL1skwN-g.text: So used to going to yama sushi across the street. Well they were crowded butts to nuts, so I came here. Not disappointed at all, this is my new sushi place hands down. Very fresh I'm so happy.

m4qhaJuZs8JXGjv5dxXcVA.text: Best sushi all you can eat in town. Great service, good food with affordable price. The Shit and Ocean trout are two must try dishes.

xMF6VxlJZTSVPHS6TzzITQ.text: Our favourite Japanese sushi place whenever we go to Las Vegas. Beautiful variety of all you can eat sushi. The shit and ocean trout are two must try dishes. I personally love the house made green tea panna cotta dessert the most

Z8MFh1osaF5_0gvgIBaX1g.text: 1400 reviews.. hmmm.. must be GREAT right? That's what I thought and gave this place a try.  I was visiting vegas from LA and stopped by this place for some sushi. The food quality was pretty good the 1st round and came the  second round, everything went downhill from there.   They have people write reviews on yelp to get free drinks...no wonder they have 1400 reviews. The manager or whoever the hell he was (bald guy) was pretty rude and I don't think he knew what he was doing. He tells the paying customers to " Eat the Rice!" I understand you want the customers to eat the rice so that they get full faster so they don't order up the whole store but you don't directly tell the customers in a condescending manner to "eat the rice".   Charge me extra...i don't want to eat the rice. Save your money and go to another AYCE sushi place. I know for sure I wont be going back.

dQewr5NfWIJmhtMB1wg3og.text: First time here, and was surprised on the results. All you can eat sushi is always a plus. The food was very good, service was good and stayed in touch with the table. Also had a birthday at our table and they went over and beyond what they should of done. Was a great experience.  Must - order the Tiger Roll.

Bqd-oB3vaxD2vDvCwye6YA.text: This is the best in my own opinion the best sushi restaurant in Las Vegas because the deal is so good that for lunch all you can eat $20 plus dollars you got the whole entire menu and buy one get one free Asahi drink the best deal ever and it's really really good more bang for your buck

i1K1Xh7dH_o6w0cHfc6j5A.text: Best sushi place in town! Their fish is fresh and they give you thicc cuts when you order salmon sushi. This is also the only sushi spot I've ever seen to have the Orange Blossom roll in Vegas. It can also get packed around dinner time so make sure to come in right before to beat out the wait. But overall, this place is totally worth the price! :)

N51SRhUNmPq86N3RRyrZdA.text: When I first came to this place it was great, in fact its usually packed but Im here right now to havw dinner with my hubby (just 2 of us) they have 4 clean empty tables and I have been waitking for iver 15 minutes, they won't seat me because the empry tables are for 4 people, it is 9:10 PM! There is no one else waiting, please use common sense!!!!!!

onM4m26Af6tC0DymjK3NTg.text: The fish was so fresh. We were a party of 7 and we tired so many different rolls and none of them disappointed. Delicious. The 2 for Sake and drinks was cool too. And the honey toast was perfect.

kXZLB69ZPrYPm7NlbLhqAw.text: Averaging around $26 per person for all you can eat, this is a great sushi bar that is worth its money: that is if you go with a very empty stomach! Their waiters and waitresses are all very friendly, coming by once in awhile to check if you want to order anything else.   For the sushi itself, they range in price, but are all very good in flavor, freshness, and aesthetic. They are flavored on the sweeter side, but the eel sauce is amazing! There is a huge variety on what you can order. My family and I loved every single one we ordered. They have some spicy options too, which are delicious.   Their appetizers are bomb. Order as many as you want, they're part of the AYCE option too. The bulgogi nachos and the tofu were definitely my favorite.   Bring your appetite because they are very filling!

2vz1shOES3YKh4MFnh_AMA.text: All-around, my favorite spot for AYCE Sushi! I've tried a handful of others in the area but keep coming back for the great food, vibrant atmosphere, and outstanding service! By chance, I discovered this place the day I moved here last year; I was driving around and saw the "Sakana" sign out of the corner of my eye, looked it up on Yelp and thought, "Sure, why not?".. AND I never looked back.   Sakana has an extensive variety of items and even though they're known for their AYCE, the quality is still superb-- 40 appetizers, 30 nigiri, 80 rolls to choose from.. where does one even begin? Best to choose a fish and ask your wonderful server for recommendations on rolls. Some of my favorite items are: pork belly, "Pang", garlic tuna, seared lemon salmon, salmon lover roll, no name roll, wet dream, and the oh-so-simple but delicious affogato.  The restaurant is a bit hidden in a shopping center, it does get busy during peak times, but it's still a shorter wait time than some in the area *ahem Yama*. Sakana is intimate with smaller tables, some booths, a few group tables, and a group room. The decor is contemporary traditional, and the music/videos usually playing in the background is K-Pop.  Lunch is $20.95, Dinner is $25.95, and there's 2-for-1 specials on alcoholic beverages. Enjoy, and don't skip out on the ice cream & dessert options!

WWWQHRBvi_xZ_LgqTuxB_Q.text: For how busy it was, surprisingly most of the food came out pretty fast. I was pleasantly surprised. We had to wait an hour for a group of 6 on a Thursday night so we made a long list of everything we wanted to get. Food came out quickly and were all pretty good! I felt bad for the servers because they were so understaff. There was one bus boy and two or three servers for the entire restaurant. It wouldn't hurt to hire at least one or two more servers during rush hour.   They forgot our order towards the end at one point and had to remind them twice about a dish. It finally came out. Then we asked for desert 3-4 Times and they finally realized that they forgot. It was just ice cream and mochi.

pbiQcwEIUKk3pdpMz3BshQ.text: I spoke with a waiter who seated us because no one answered The phone when I was trying to make reservation throughout the day... He was very condescending... it's a great place for all you can eat , but the customer service is far from acceptable ..... Then after paying we were still eating and another associate felt the need to tell us that we had to pay additional for any left over food. I still had my chopsticks in my hand and reminded her that we clearly were not done eating ... I don't believe I will be back . I am very disappointed...... VERY

bg5kEAozlMhCk_b75dYLjg.text: This is a decent place, but dont expect super quality fish or authentic sushi.  This is a place for quantity, not quality.  The All You Can is pretty impressive with offerings including 95 percent of what's on the menu, including the speciality rolls AND they bring the full size roll (what?!).  And their entrees are also reasonably priced.  Being close to UNLV, it's got a hip vibe for the college students... Kpop videos, young servers, etc.   Mr. loved the spicy tuna roll and wants to come back. I would consider, but can't say this is my 1st choice for sushi.

BwnW1Wq60tympplEMoNd-Q.text: We came here on Sunday for lunch. We are from SD so our local friends brought us here for all you can eat!  SERVICE - Wonderful! They were quick and attentive. Very friendly as well. I loved that the owner (we think it was the owner) walked around and stopped at tables. He was hilarious! He cracked jokes and made us feel right at home.   FOOD - Amazing amazing deal. We have all you can eat sushi at home but nothing like this! You can order appetizers, rolls, AND dessert! The rolls were huge and fresh. The rolls we got were so good! The lobster rolls we ordered were all delicious. Appetizers, rolls, dessert, everything was excellent.  Next time we are in Vegas, we will be back!! We seriously have been craving this since the day we got home.

3gfGfN4BGt3VALsezYGctw.text: $25 for over 100 choices of rolls, apps, etc.? Duh -- no-brianer.   Baked lobster - must have. Bugolgi - great option.  I mean, honestly... everything was good to 'great'.  And, our waiter was amazing... well, service in general, since more people came out to fill waters and bus, and they were great.  I was BLOWN AWAY by this place.  It's at the back corner behind Target and the entrance is near some dumpsters that stink but even then... lines.  So that tells you something.    This is a must try.

MDi8Kten1aEDUAJ2Ax7TUA.text: Eh I've been to Sakana a lot and there just doesn't seem to be much consistency. The food compared to their sister shop Neko just isn't the same. When my boyfriend and I went for lunch there we were greeted with a bunch of no's. We asked for a bigger table and they said no because they were expecting a lunch rush (never came). We wanted to pay more for the dinner so we could order the salmon belly (no because they don't prepare it early) we had two pieces of sushi left and the busser was hesitant to take it because he wanted to check with the AYCE. Idk it's just never a good experience the last few times I've been there and I probably won't ever again. Sushi Neko is way better. We only came here since they were remodeling. But the food is just so-so. Fast services but still just an underwhelming experience.

-zbK3jsXRAruJjGxNM3JMA.text: This is right up there in the best-bang-for-your-buck category for LVNV! The fish is fresh and served at a reasonable ratio to rice, unlike some all-you-can-eat places that force globs of rice down your gullet to avoid giving away too much precious meat. And the service is very nice.  The selection outstanding! Lots of great Asian appetizers are part of the all-you-can-eat package. They also offer daily specials that are off menu. I strongly recommend trying the sea trout. In case you don't know what this is, have a little faith, take the plunge and and just try it. It's nothing funky.   I'm a fan of Gorilla Sushi which only a 5 minute drive away. Tough to say which is better. Both are an excellent experience and I dare any True sushi aficionado to find flaw. Sakana is great!

GXw0GOwuG_pqQ2GODOUQrQ.text: Been dining at this place ever since it opened and let me tell you, this place has always been #1 in my heart. The set up of the restaurant and the menu has changed over time and it's completely amazing! The lunch is 21.95 up until 3pm and dinner price is around 25-26 which is usually the standard to most sushi places here.   Service ALWAYS CONSISTENT. The workers here are very fast with refilling waters and clearing out the dishes on the table every time I come here. The sushi chefs prepare the sushi at a good amount of time so expect your sushi to be at your table within a few minutes. Completely never have to worry about waiting so long from my experience with anything at this place!  Food The fish to ratio on their rolls and especially their nigiri is a COMPLETE WIN! I can honestly tell you that you will not be disappointed in the ratio. The fish is completely fresh and it just melts in your mouth.   They are very good with their nigiri. Super white tuna and garlic tuna is definitely a must. The flavors on both nigiri work so well together. It completely melts in your mouth. If you're an unagi fan just as much as I am, you must order unagi here! The best one I've had so far. The chefs warm it up to perfection along with the rice and also to top it off, they glaze it with some kind of simple sweet sauce. I am completely drooling just explaining this. It's a MUST try!  Their appetizers are very good too. Bulgogi nachos, anything tempura there is hecka good. Whoever is battering it and cooking the tempura is doing it right! Hamachi Kama is very good too especially when you add some lemon juices to it. Baked green mussels... Wow, so much flavor. Can definitely inhale that every time I'm here and pork belly! Oh my god. Super tender and flavorful.   The rolls are very good too from what I've tried. I definitely need to expand more with rolls. The no name roll, Lisa Lisa, wet dream (if you like cream cheese), and Japanese lasagna is usually what I get. If you can't finish a full, you can actually order half rolls!  Reason why I rate this a 5 is because they've been so consistent with service since day 1! The chef is super nice along his staff. You can easily connect with the sushi chefs with no problem. The atmosphere is completely chill and relaxed AND the music is always good here too. Thank you sakana for the wonderful service and yummy food!

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Specials board.
Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3dJv-5qFRdd8fjH2u0N-Mg.text: Wowwww... I'm sorry but I'm not a big fan of sushi just bc it's usually too expensive or not that great but Sakana is doing sushi right! All the nigiri was amazing.  My personal favorites was the super white tuna, fresh water eel and the seared lemon salmon. There's so much on the menu it's unbelievable.. do not get the shit, pang and pa fried chicken bc it says "must try." We got tempted and it was just ok. They just fill you up and restrict you from eating more :( but overall SOOO GOOD and SOO WORTH the price

yH5Wud1bV4x-Uj9dLT3Axg.text: While enjoying vacation in Las Vegas earlier this week, we learnt of this restaurant from Yelp which had an average of 4.5 star rating, and decided to give it a try one evening.  When we arrived at the restaurant, we were surprised that it was not as crowded as anticipated, feeling that the rating and popularity might be over-exaggerated.  Our skepticism was soon swept away as we were warmly received by a friendly waiter, Kevin.  He walked us through the menu and helped us in placing an initial order.  When the dishes came, we were very impressed by the freshness of various types of the sushi.  All were absolutely delicious!  We had only tried less than a quarter of the items on the menu, but that was all we could take.  I personally would highly recommend the white tuna, raw oyster and salmon belly sushi.  The all-you-can-eat price per head is less than $26, and I can assure the readers that it is worth every penny of it, especially to those who have an exceptional appetite for Japanese sushi!

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kevin and me
Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon and salmon belly sushi

Hjlegiou7g35G0UbInpHsA.text: This is one of the best AYCE sushi places I've been to! Mainly because their nigiri is fresh and they don't stuff you with rice. For $25pp at dinner, I thought it was pretty reasonable and I ate a LOT. Their fish to rice ratio is as one of the other reviews says about 3:1. It definitely means you can eat more sashimi and less rice, which I appreciate. We ordered almost all the nigiri on the list for dinner and my favorite was probably the hamachi and yuzu hamachi. The seared salmon and eel werepretty good too. A lot of the rolls were also pretty good, but the rice there might fill you up a bit. I ordered a double dragon roll and someone else ordered one of the spicy rolls which were both delicious. The uni was actually pretty fresh when we got it compared to some other reviews and my friends liked the mussels and oysters. I'm just not a big mussel/oyster person in general. We ordered everything off the list that we could only order once, but I thought they were just okay.   What they did lack in was probably organization skills. We had to wait quite awhile to get seated and we were a little confused why a table of 3 who came after our party of 5 was asked to sit down first in a long bench area in the middle of their restaurant when we clearly could have been seated there. Luckily we didn't get seated too late after them as people were leaving, but that was a little annoying. Also one of the appetizers we ordered way early in the evening never got to us until the end of the meal even though we kept asking every time.   All in all, I would come back because I thought it was pretty worth it for all the fish and rolls we ate!

n19tqpwDdj5wgYE-rU0g0w.text: This place has good quality of sushi for the price. Service is great . For $20.95 all you can eat, no other place can beat it. Not only for price, but also for the quality of food they serve.

I thought at first she's trippi'n or just tired which I can tolerate, but no she's just plain racist because I saw the way she treated the other white customer. I call it for what it is. XPhCAzJxqwEYKqtBHOMbSw.text: Salmon! That's all I had a chance to take a picture of.  Everything was amazing. We had the no name roll, the Chanel roll, the dragon roll, the Vegas roll, and the salmon lover roll.  Everything was made fresh to order. If I lived in Vegas I would come here often

All you can eat for ridiculously low prices.   The menu is huge and their sushi chefs crank out rolls at unbelievable speed.  If you are in Vegas I highly recommend Sakana.

uwb8k-52nOdO1l4m1Ko6pg.text: Fun atmosphere, great service and a must stop in  Las Vegas.  There are not many restaurants that can take you off the strip these days, Sakana is one that can and Woo as your server, you'll come back again.  It's 8pm and a full house with staff to support the amount of guest.   All you can Eat dinner $25.95 Lunch is $20.95. Salmon Sushi, very fresh, great flavor and good portions  Tuna Sushi, Fresh with a sweet taste Be Happy ; ) Roll, if you're not happy, you will be.  This is an amazing roll.  Spicy Crab, Tuna and Salmon just melts in your mouth.   Bam Bam Roll, Super White Tune is Super good. Towering Sashimi Poki, great flavors Snow in Vegas, it's fresh, but not on my reorder list.  Red Snapper was a little much. Lobster King Roll, Sweet, Crunchy and all the flavors join together with each bite. What the Heck Roll, Tempura batter a little thick and over fried.  Spicy Tuna and Jalapenos explode together, not a reorder for me.  No 1 Chef Makes Roll, Tempura batter a little thick and over fried.  Spicy Tuna, Salmon and Super White Tuna mixed well with Jalapenos.  Not a reorder due to the Tempura batter and frying ; ( Deep Fried Banana, need I say more   A few key notes: You must eat what you order You can order 1/2 Rolls  If you order a full roll and only eat a fee pieces you'll be charged for the roll. Just order what you can eat ; )

-oonTo5-8Egg8-vcvr41OQ.text: This AYCE sushi restaurant was pretty good for the price $25 per person. But they do charge for drinks and hot tea! And there's a 1 per person limit for some selected nigiri's like uni and oysters. I thought the sushi was delicious especially for AYCE. I liked the garlic tuna, white tuna, and yuzu hamachi because of the different sauces they add on. Their spicy tuna does taste different from Hawaii though.. my boyfriend kept saying he didn't like the sushi because it tasted like "mainland sushi" and not as fresh. So I guess you get what you pay for..

c3z2-pF4qVfj-IHxeLsRMA.text: I didn't get AYCE so I honestly don't know much about the rolls but I got the Sashimi bowl and was pleased with the outcome.  The slices of fish were fresh and gorgeous looking.  Fat slices and was fantastic with the sweet rice that was underneath.  A bit too much rice for my liking but I was happy.  My friend got the sashimi platter and I had a tuna slice from there.  The tuna did NOT taste like mine at all... it didn't seem as fresh as it was mushy and stringy..  Large parties, they don't accept reservations on a Saturday night.  Also they only split the checks up to 6 times.  If you are visiting Vegas, this is a decent sushi restaurant but I advise to just go eat a yummy buffet on the strip!

UwScncH0Bxk5SZ3RXqR4oA.text: I heard great things about this restaurant.  Everyone seems to like it.  I did like it enough to go back, and I am picky with sushi.  It was not the same quality on the strip sushi places, but it is very good and comes at a reasonable price.

7iqjvGFGe5UizKPz8Z2zsA.text: This place is just amazing! The customer service could use some improvements and the wait time but other than that the food is just amazing. The pricing is just right. I've gone multiple times bc of the deliciousness. They serve you in a timely matter and have a wonderful selection of sushi. I've tried they're all you can eat and boy do I recommend this place to friends and family!!

nYJKF8htRCcyOgkEAOhKnA.text: What can I say? This is my fav ayce sushi place.. Read below for Sevice/Food review..  Service: Been here about 10ish times. EVERYONE here is nice, prompt, friendly, and just really frigen awesome. They refill glasses every time you're 1/4 below or so. They delightfully recommend items off their menu. Sushi comes FAST after you order.  Food: My fav tasting sushi in town. See my photo.. Their nigiri is unreal. GET 50 ORDERS OF THE SPICEY ALBACORE AND GARLIC TUBA, HAHA.. rh3ImuKNowX-Jn0PjHAJJg.text: Wait time is a while but well worth it! $25.99 for all you can eat! But don't waste because they'll charge you ala cart. Everything we ordered was amazing!! So yummy!  Service was quick & friendly. The menu is huge so it might take a while to go over everything. There is some hidden gems in there though.

UqDknI-z2fKg40tg7gzZ4Q.text: The sushi here was incredibly fresh and tasty. The pieces of fish were large and the amount of rice was normal. It's nice they don't skimp on the fish and they give nicely portioned fish to rice ratio. The restaurant was a bit small which is fine and the service was good, however slightly slow.

ki5p30OMUDVY4uMT_HJ3YA.text: Very good all you can eat Sushi abs fast service too! I will definitely be back again in my next Vegas visit

l_QsfMQ4GKjIM5d5bqPbww.text: We just had the worse service ever .   We invited our group of 13 people to Sakana. Most of them have never been here before, so it's such a shame of what happened.   Advice: don't bring your friends here, it'll just make you look stupid for suggesting   First off the the attendant spilled water on one of my guests and didn't even apologize. He just giggled and walked away to get a rag. Or that's what it looked like.   Then the waitress, after being so rude from the beginning with her introduction on wasting food made a very inappropriate comment. She said even if we waste a bowl of rice they will charge us. Not sure if it was sarcastic, but definitely unprofessional. It could have been worded better. We've been to almost every sushi place in Vegas so I am very familiar with how waiters and waitresses word things and explain rules. This waitress was just horrible!   Then she told one of our guest that he can't just order dessert (even tho it's on the menu with a price).  He'd have to order a regular food item In order to order a dessert item. I understand if we were just a total of 2 or 3 people, but we were 13 people and just so  happen one person wasn't hungry but wanted to hang out with us.  I'm a Business owner as well and I know some rules can be adjusted. If 12 people are eating, why can't 1 person only eat dessert.   I'm sure the owner would be very disappointed In This waitress. She was so horrible   We all ended up walking out and getting seated at Yama sushi right across the street   We will never go to Sakana again.  The restaurant basically lost $300 in food sales not Including tips because they would not sell only dessert to 1 of 13 guests. Not to mention all the potential return future visits.   Plain stupid  Day after follow up:  We ended going to Yama sushi across the street and they seated us with no problems. When we mentioned one person will only be eating dessert, they just said it's ok like it's normal for them. Not a big deal. We tipped them very well

q1pM-UV-nRj092-LUGs6NQ.text: The food and menu is amazing. The service is terrible.   My boyfriend and I discovered this place and thought we hit the jackpot. Returned a few more times and determined the restaurant is under staffed resulting in slow service.   This last visit ended my desire to ever return. My boyfriend and I took our parents to the restaurant for their first time. We waited a decent amount of time to be seated. Once we got our table, we continued to wait for our waiter to come and take our order. After waiting so long, we decided to order every roll we would want when our waitor came, so we wouldn't have to wait again if we wanted more food.   Our waiter, Ron, finally came and took our order. I, my boyfriend, and my mom order 9 rolls total - 3 each.   We continued to wait for our sushi. About 40mins passed and my dad - politely asked - how much longer for our food. Ron, the waiter, replied with a tone of disrespect, "you ordered nine rolls."  I am not a person who gets upset normally, but it upset me that my waitor would reply this way when we just wanted to know where our food was since we had waited so long.   Really sad and probably won't return.

eb6i9gkHLM_LFJGTmTg3Mg.text: First visit to Salana and I enjoyed it very much! My sister, Crystal suggested we (family) try this place out. Of course, we ended up choosing the AYCE dinner ($25.95 per person).   What we ordered (all of the items were one time dinner only):  - Ocean Trout marinated in garlic ponzu (too fatty) - Salmon Belly (I didn't care for it) - Oyster (delicious) - Uni (Sea Urchin caviar) (THE BEST UNI I'VE EVER HAD!) - Ama Ebi (Sweet Shrimp) (delicious)  You can order anytime (lunch/dinner):  - Ikura (Salmon Roe) (delicious but too SALTY) - Yellowtail (Hamachi) - Garlic Tuna - Super White Tuna (tasted so good) - Yuzu Yellow Tail - Sarada Lobster (it was ok) - Aomori Scallop (was too dry) - Surf Clam (was "meh") - Tobiko (caviar which had hints of citrus and wasabi flavors... I didn't quite like it) - Calamari Tempura (the meat was too tender. I like it when the meat's a tad bit chewier.) - Shrimp Tempura (it was ok.. the batter wasn't crispy) - Seafood Salad (wasn't great.. It looked like they gave all of the leftovers)  Dessert:  - Mochi Ice Cream (coffee): It tasted fine. I just wish they didn't split it down the middle. - Green Tea Panna Cotta (It was good!) - Black Sesame Panna Cotta (This tasted gross to me, but my sister and Mom enjoyed it very much!) - Green Tea Ice Cream (I couldn't taste a whole lot of the green tea flavor which really disappointed me!)  My entire experience here was great! Our server, Jeong ho, was nice and attentive! Seating didn't take very long... I remember waiting less than 5 - 10 minutes! I was glad that the nigiri sushi tasted fresh!!  I would definitely recommend this place to everyone who loves nigiri sushi!! Come during dinner time so you could try everything! I would gladly come eat here, again!

Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Top: (I forgot what kind of fish that was) Middle: Sarada Lobster (right)/Aomori Scallop (left) Bottom: Surf Clam
Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yuzu Yellow Tail

l8We3adiyG6QEvuXibGgSA.text: My friend introduced us to this off-the-Strip AYCE (all you can eat) sushi place and we've been coming back ever since! If we're craving some sushi for a great deal, this is the place we go. Talk about less rice, more fish - and they have a good variety too!  PARKING: Parking can get a little scarce here, but the restaurant is located in a plaza. You might have to park a little further, but you should be able to find a spot. Spots can be a bit tight.  WAIT: We've only ever come in for lunch (so not sure how the dinner rush is), but there is a wait. Luckily for us, when we've come here the past few times, we haven't had to wait for more than 30 mins. Depends on the rush though! Try to beat the crowds and get here earlier than 11:30am for lunch. Even after 1pm, there are groups of people rolling in.  SEATING: Indoor seating only and there are several tables (it's pretty big in there!). Lots of tables for two as well as some tables to accommodate larger groups. They also have a sushi bar if you prefer to sit there (or ask for first available).  FOOD: The AYCE menu literally comes with everything. You can order sushi, hand rolls, specialty rolls, and even side dishes (think teriyaki, yakitori, miso soup, salads, etc.). We always order a lot during the first round and the servers end up making a face that seems to signal "They really think they can eat that much?". The answer is YES. We can eat that much.

LRT9Osquxp-bZr0gar94jg.text: AYCE sushi that's good quality but also affordable is truly difficult to come across yet Sakana did it. If you haven't eaten here before, now would be a good time to. Or anytime is a good time to.   Where do I even begin? Let's do bad news first. There's gonna be a wait here, but it's worth it. So wait it out cause you're gonna be getting amazing sushi. Okay, now to the actual important stuff. The rice to fish ratio is amazing, you get maybe a tiny bit of rice for a generous piece of fish for the nigiri so you're getting 75% melt-in-your-mouth-quality fish and 25% rice. Also, order more nigiri, try to limit yourself on the rolls or you'll get full too quickly. They have pretty good handrolls and appetizers and skewers too if you wanna diversify yourself from nigiri and rolls. They have a la carte prices next to everything and I played a little game of how much did I eat compared to what I actually spent. For 3 people eating ayce dinner at $25.95 each, we ate about $180 worth of sushi. If you want to gorge on rolls go ahead, I won't judge you.  So there you go, ayce sushi at great prices, quality, and portions. What's not to love about Sakana?

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6GIPJW_juh1SGqGcCSBxNQ.text: I was so excited when I discovered this place just off the strip. All the reviews were right--fresh and delicious sushi that you definitely want to squeeze into your itinerary!   We came on a Tuesday night around 7 and there was no wait. Immediately we ordered the salmon belly, uni, sweet shrimp, and oysters. These are all items you can only order once when doing AYCE. The salmon belly was TO DIE for! These items alone are worth the AYCE price since they are normally $4-5 each. They also had some sashimi specials that we could only order once. We didn't bother with the sushi rolls since we didn't want to fill up on too much rice. Mostly just ordered nigiri and if you like the raw stuff this is the best way to go to maximize your belly space. The last items we ordered were the shu mai and the shit. I didn't care for either items honestly. Those were the only dishes I would've rather skip but everything else was great!  As everyone mentioned, you can't have any leftover items or they will charge you extra so take it slow and order a little at a time. The service was great so it was very easy to continuously order additional items.

Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yellowtail, salmon and tuna sashimi on special that day
Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Uni, salmon belly, garlic salmon (?), sweet shrimp and oysters. Delicious!

5fzwXtfA5OrqmRShq0Z_UA.text: Love sushi? And buffets? Well, look no further than Sakana.   For $20.95 you can get AYCE, fresh, hearty, sushi rolls for lunch. I tried nearly all the tempuras and left wishing I had space for more. ALL of the sushi rolls on the front AND back of the menu are included in the AYCE.   They do have some rules that it may be wise to follow, like for example, you have to finish everything on your plate - so pace yourself. They only let you order a few at a time anyway, but just in case you're feeling ambitious, be careful!

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cUVdUueC5uYEfPXq_xdplQ.text: Now that I've been here I can say that I would've COMPLETELY missed out if I hadn't come here on my Las Vegas trip. It was that good. The quality of the fish itself was incredible, and if you consider the price ($26 for AYCE dinner), it is insane value. I love that you get A LOT of fish per nigiri and just a little rice so you don't get full too quickly. I think towards the end, our rice ratio went up, but that's completely fine!  Some of our favorite nigiris were: ocean trout, salmon belly, super white tuna, freshwater eel, garlic tuna, yuzu lemon tail and seared lemon salmon  [the first 2 you can only order once at dinnertime]  Other items that stood out were the Pang (a cheesy salmon garlic bread appetizer) and No Name hand roll   We came at around 9pm, were the 11th party on the waitlist, and got seated in 20 min. Ordering was super fast and efficient. The food came out with barely any wait. Great establishment.

Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eel, 300 albacore, super white tuna, salmon, tuna, tamago, clam

qv_aXvgBO1037qJNE-FY2A.text: What an amazing restaurant this place is! The restaurant is located off the strip but it is definitely worth checking out if you are a sushi/Japanese food fan!!   Came here on a Monday night for dinner. Got here just after 7.30pm and noted down our name and table size on their waitlist. We were a group of 12 so it was quite tough to get a table straight away. We ended up waiting for 30 mins and split our tables to a table of 8 and a table of 4.  The restaurant offer all you can eat (AYCE) sushi for $30 during dinner. You are given 90 minutes to order and also finish your food in that timeframe. To avoid wastage, the restaurant imposes $6 per dish for wasted food.  Once we all sat down, the waiter provided us with a menu list to order from. Similar to some dim sum places out there, you note down the dishes as well as the quantity you would like to order.  We ordered a whole lot of sushis, skewers and appetizers. We were hungry and almost at a blink of an eye, we were overwhelmed with sushis coming at all different directions - in a good way of course.   The food was so good (and there was so much of it) that we did not even order a second round. I am not a fan of raw fish myself but I was with a group of sushi fans and they gave their thumbs up. I myself enjoyed the shrimps on the skewer, tofu, California roll and tempuras. I looked at the menu the next day and realised the restaurant also offers noodles/ramen as part of their all you can eat offering.  Would definitely recommend this restaurant who is visiting Vegas and is into their sushi/Japanese food. Just remember to strategize your ordering to ensure you get to try out all the different dishes.   Dinner ended up costing $40 p/p which included drinks, tax and gratuity. The restaurant is approx 15 mins in a cab from the Strip, depending on traffic. Also not everyone in your group needs to order the AYCE menu. We had a few vegan friends who ordered off their regular menu.

d5LXYFiKYLI5SPMftCAlAQ.text: This was the best AYCE sushi buffet I have ever been to. First of all, prices are unbelievably cheap - lunch was $20.95 per person! Second, the selection was great - not only could you get a bunch of different appetizers, you could also get nigiri (and they give big slices of fish and don't try to overload the rice!), a whole bunch of sushi rolls including baked rolls, hand rolls, and specialty rolls, and dessert. The food was all delicious and we all left super stuffed and happy.  Some of the food that we really enjoyed: - Ocean trout nigiri  - Salmon nigiri - Eel nigiri  - Dragon roll - Spider roll - Fried banana dessert, black sesame dessert   Would skip next time: - Tobiko sushi - had a strange fishy taste  - Lobster nigiri - tasted more like imitation crab  - Tiramisu dessert - dry  - Quail egg sushi - literally had a raw quail egg  - Bacon wrapped scallops or lobster skewers - the ratio of bacon to scallop/lobster was way off and all you could taste was bacon   Would definitely come back if in Las Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bd6fDrJSbQYDuDWKbYhTjg.text: Fast, efficient, high quality made to order ayce sushi - I'm still a fan! This place is so worth the trip outside of the strip.  How can you resist amaebi, uni, ocean trout, and oysters!? Those are one-time items, but still... what amazing quality for the price!

jN_qX-uPC_4fRvn_0hCJMA.text: I was looking on Yelp for a sushi joint to try out and this place had a lot of good reviews and the food looked bomb. I went with a group of 5 for lunch and we ordered the seared and lemon salmon, yellowtail, halibut, rolls, and so on.   It was annoying how the rice on the rolls kept falling apart. They're supposed to be nice and sturdy when you pick up a roll. The eel and ponzu sauce were bland to me. Everything else was just basic. Not worth my money tbh.  The service was okay. The server needs to have a positive personality because it looks like he's not having a good day. It could've been better because I'm a high tipper based on service.   Cute decor but that's pretty much it. I wouldn't come back here since I've had better quality in California.

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jLrV64vBvIK0Z-Sd-8bbgA.text: Probably one of my favorite sushi places in town. We came by on a Saturday night. No one was really there but it got really busy a few minutes after we wrote our name down.   Sakana opens up to a beautiful center table with a floral backdrop. It's a small place but plenty of seating. We got seated after about 20minutes.   We all decided to do all you can eat this evening. It was about $26. We ordered the specials and a few orders of sashimi. One of the reasons why I like Sakana is that they don't pack their sushi with rice. It's actually heavy in the fish and limited in rice. Also-the service was really fast.   They get the orders out fairly fast. Service has always been good at Sakana. The staff is a little quiet but that's okay!   We also ordered some uni and it was fresh! It didn't taste---off. haha. This is definitely in the top of my sushi list.

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States

98NGmGxUlzwPDYNvYsl_gg.text: This is my favorite AYCE sushi spot and a hidden gem! The sushi to rice ratio is amazing! They don't stuff a lot of rice which makes it the best compared to other places. The fish is fresh and the rolls are delicious. A lot of variety and choices on their menu. I honestly feel that you get more than your money's worth eating here.   The place is decorated nicely, feels like I'm in Japan! Good for date night or just casual grubbing.   They get very busy, so expect to wait for lunch and dinner rushes. Overall the wait is worth it, knowing you'll get good, quality sushi. Make sure to add this place on your list, you'll be leaving full and satisfied!

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hawaiian Roll
Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna and salmon nigiri

xyC8yXorEJY7lMhfK_Weag.text: This place is probably a 4.5 stars, but I rounded up for one reason only: the unagi. The freshwater eel is the best eel I've ever had at a sushi restaurant. The quality of all the fish is pretty good, but the eel is definitely a standout. All of the other appetizer dishes were okay. Got the agedashi tofu, hamachi Kama, salmon Kama, vegetable tempura, and miso soup. The miso soup isn't very good.   The service is okay, pretty chaotic and a few times had to tell numerous waiters that we were missing some items. The restaurant is really crowded, though, and the staff tries to accommodate more to the bigger parties, which makes sense.   Didn't get the chance to try the rolls, but I'll probably be back in Vegas in the future and maybe I'll get to try them then! The No Name roll looks really good :)

VyKif3SpJd2vJgfAf2y04A.text: Wow. Just freaking WOW. I didn't know what to expect, but I was blown away by the freshness and quality of the nigiri and sashimi at Sakana for the dinner price of $26!  I ate uni, fatty salmon belly, mackerel, octopus, some foreign roe I haven't eaten before among a bunch of different pieces! Pretty sure I downed 50 or so pieces of sushi and a few fried skewers, karaage, and fried shishitos! I can't remember all the pieces I ate, but I have to say I liked the nigiri and sashimi better than the appetizers! I would load up on sushi for the all you can eat, seeing that there is a 90 minute time limit (I did, however, inhale my sushi feast in an hour). The chefs making the sushi were amazing -- the guys easily remember your lengthy order and cut generous chunks of fish for each piece of nigiri! Some pieces even seemed to have more fish than rice. Lol  One thing to note is the wait -- I got there at 8:00pm Friday night, and waited about 30 minutes to get seated (party of one). If you come in groups of 3 or more especially, prepare to wait awhile (40-60 minutes).  Pro tips: make sure to get the special 1 order only items on the menu and the white board behind the sushi bar -- these are the richest and most indulgent dinner pieces you'll get on the buffet.  I was certainly not disappointed and will be back if I ever find myself in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Never ending sushi

CktAfBswm45ivbdHSFPnQQ.text: The service was fast, we went in for AYCE lunch, and our server was very patient with us, since it was our first time there! They were quick to grab our empty plates, suggested what we should try when we described our likes, and the food was amazing. Best sushi I have had in a very long time! We will keep coming back!   Dinner was a bit of a wait because they were busy. It was also crammed; but food was still very delicious!!! I am just a tiny bit disappointed we had to keep asking for refills over and over

rVVfHSFJ81mEFP2bjGFW6w.text: *rolls outside after eating my weight in sushi*  Okay, the AYCE option is worth every penny for what you are able to get! The quality, presentation, and selection is all there and I could not be any happier. This place is just slightly on the outskirts of Vegas, but worth going to if you are looking for a sushi place without spending a fortune.  As part of the AYCE, they have some prime cuts of fish such as fatty salmon belly that you're only able to get one serving of, but that's okay. Let it melt in your mouth and order something else. Variety is the spice of life so get your single serving of this and move on! Plenty of options to choose from.  I'd advice you to only get the half rolls at a time and do not get too overzealous and order too much because your appetite may be larger than your stomach. Trust me, I know from experience.  Hope you enjoy this place as much as I did!

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. *drools*

UKZYbIn9amiPb_nSewxLLA.text: Where do I begin with this review!? I absolutely love this place and dream about it constantly since I don't live locally. Both times I've come I happened to have the same server. He gives little suggestions here and there "Oh you definitely want this one here..." or "try the black sesame dessert." The service is very fast, and I love the ambiance with the cherry blossoms hanging from the sealing. There is usually a small wait where you sign in yourself, but I only waited max 10 minutes in the past.   The AYCE specials for lunch $20.95 and dinner $25.95 are awesome. There are a couple items that are one time only (ocean trout, and for dinner one time only the salmon belly, oyster, uni, ama ebi). The ocean trout is incredible, and it is all such a good deal! You can't go wrong with any of the rolls, but I especially liked the Be Happy:) roll (soft shell crab with tuna/salmon all drenched in mayo/eel/so sauce), and the no rice (dinner only time) rolls because they stack on the sashimi. I also love the agedashi tofu. It comes with a dessert, and I would recommend the affogato (ice cream with korean style coffee).

FRIi0XL4PiI3ahDxLB-phA.text: Sakana is the most impressive AYCE sushi restaurant I've ever been to. And I've been to many good and bad ones as you can tell by reading my other reviews. We loved this place so much that we went twice in a week, first for lunch and then for dinner.  And the reason for the five star rating is... their NIGIRI! If I could, I would have only nigiri every time I go eat sushi. However, most AYCE places load each piece with rice, either with a decent or a paper thin slice of fish on top. But SAKANA is not such place. Their nigiri has a small ball of rice with a thick and long slice of fish on top. The best part, all the different topings and sear combinations to keep it exciting.  That said, the rolls we had were surprisingly full of rice with an average taste. The baked ones were alright, but for the most part I wouldn't bother. Just go with the nigiri!!  Their bacon wrapped lobster and scallop skewers are very good and so are the baked mussles appetizers. Included dessert is quite amazing too. First place I'll visit next time I'm in Vegas!!

I order so much salmon. I judge places on the freshness of their uni and this place has prettty good uni. They have this sashimi dish called something tower, that's really good too. I just wish it was open later, I believe they close at midnight.

-A2Z7QuI40xHW8ONTzVQKQ.text: Good AYCE sushi restaurant.  Fish seemed fresh, and rice was well seasoned.  Enjoyed the options for hand rolls (some of which were also available as specialty rolls).  Wanted to sit at the bar, but not enough room.  Service was ok, but a bit hit or miss (order and service staff seemed to cover a lot of tables, bussing staff was on the spot - hence my preference to sit at the bar when possible).   Solid choice for AYCE sushi - very competitive with other options in LV, but not quite distinguishable as the best or among the very best, without some menu and service enhancements.

vlEkjJsAbobBDjfZ3Pnz5A.text: My friends and I love this place! The food is tasty, the service is great, and there is always room at the bar. I recommend for the turn up or the relaxed night.

EuPtHrCd7fKcuntJJ_pkLA.text: Ok so I'm gonna be slightly nice with this review.. My boyfriend and I actually LOVED this place we came often since we live nearby... Then one day we came back and they were very busy... ( might I mention the place is so small and not many waiting seats.. so it forces you to stand for however long it takes! ANNOYING but we thought they were worth the wait. The 2 for 1 beers are dope.) Well we end up getting seated and ate. I didn't really order much but  it was a good night.  About 4 days later I'm craving sushi again and end up going just to see that they are closed with a huge health violation sign on the door.. I was very let down & freaked out. It remained for about a week.. and we actually ended up going back to eat there once we saw the sign was gone...But the day we came back they were circling around asking if the food was good with a booklet.. I'm assuming cause they possibly got new fish?? idk.. the violation must of had to do something with all the questions... Anyways my boyfriend ended up getting very very sick  that day!!! :( and I seriously haven't eaten sushi since then... Sakana definitely left a bad taste in my mouth. New fish old fish no thank you!! The vendor or whoever they get their supply from is horrible!

K1tzmFOvtv3Pv-gLU2GcPg.text: Our first time here and it was a great value for the price!  Fun atmosphere too.  Excellent service. We had miso soup, house salad, Dancing Eel Roll, Rainbow Roll and Salmon Nigiri, all  very good!  Will come back when back in Vegas!

The fish was very fresh and the ratio of rice to fish was definitely heftier on a fish side. )) The presentation was wonderful and the service was fast. It's a wonderful place for your buck, considering price/quality issues. They also have a lovely decor, with lots of whimsical toys and my favorite - Totoro character sitting cushions.  The only reason I took off one star, is because I was offered a corner table (I was with a kid) and when I looked under the table there were pieces of food and a chop stick left by the previous patrons. The server apologized for it, but did nothing to clean it up. ((

YMQGlUj0BX36v3q_vXpDnQ.text: I have never reviewed on Yelp, but I thought I should after being at Sakana for the millionth time. This place is sushi heaven, from the cute decor of My Neighbor Totoro booth cushions to the charismatic, sweet sushi chefs I love it! The customer service has always been excellent, and the playboy roll is my absolute favorite. Best sushi place I've been to and totally worth the $26 for all you can eat. I don't think there's ever not been a line of customers waiting outside to enter this sushi chamber. Since I started coming to Sakana I haven't been anywhere else because I'm scared I won't like it considering sushi is a once every three months kind of dinner for me~ cuz $30+ and broke college student.

maujr17OtsUCXRrQu6-Yuw.text: I wish this place was a lot bigger. The food is great, and for the price you just can't beat it. They have a whole bunch of rolls to choose from and a lot of korean mex japanese fusion dishes available. Sushi is pretty good for Las Vegas fish. The fish to rice ratio on their nigiri was really good. Didn't have to hide half a chink of rice in betweens plates here lol. Overall it's a great place to have sushi but plan to come early lines do get really long here especially on friday and saturday nights.

NoCskfUlasSgox3dRu1zVw.text: This place really is a hidden gem to me.. All alone in that little corner of the plaza.  The name Sakana kept popping up on my yelp screen telling me its new and near my location.. Finally, my buddy and I had time to stop in for ayce sushi.  Being die hard sushi eaters, we were impressed by the selection they offered and the style of ordering. Instead of orders; they go by rounds.  I felt that everything we had order was prepared very nicely.  Service was on top and constantly around to refill my water.  I have got to say, the rolls were very decent sized and covered with a good portion of fish.    Overrall, my buddy and I had not stomach issues after.  A+ since my buddy tends to get sick after ayce adventures with me.  Place is a little hard to find, *hint* it says Kabuki

rhgvv_iqnZn8DO2ymzMRCg.text: We had a wonderful night at Sakana.  The food was great and the service was polite and helpful. Great place.

t-W92umC1rnWtPF7kRSqyQ.text: I'm not an all you can eat person, really. I'm normally done with one with one roll but this place got awesome rolls that I can't stop at one plus ema ebi, oyster, chicken karage, they are all yum yum!

WpRodqG0U2RsZOuLu0vOSQ.text: I literally have no complaints. It was a Tuesday night, and it wasn't busy so we were seated immediately. Our server was nice and cracked a few jokes, as we walked in even the guys behind the sushi bar making food all yelled "welcome!" The fish to rice ratio as I've read in other reviews, was correct, so much fish! Loved that. All that rice fills you up quickly so I was glad I could keep trying more. Fish was fresh, love there tuna and yuzu yellowtail with jalapeno (favorite everywhere I go) I came here wanting to try a few new things, like salmon eggs, it wasn't bad, but not my thing. I know a lot of people who love it though. I also tried the pork belly which was sooooo tender. That was good, I tried there Asian pear sake and another one that was yogurt based? Tasted like peach? Both good but I liked the peach one more, tad bit stronger. Every dish we tried I had no disappointments. GREAT PRICES! There AYCE is awesome! Possibly my new favorite sushi spot, sushi food wise. Only wish they were in a better location. Defiantly going back!

hHspWlBo5PUOc40p0bPSdA.text: We went after 2p and was seated right away.  They have all you can eat lunch until 3p for like $21 and you can order everything off the menu.  Since it was 2:30p already and we were not that hungry, we opted to order al-la-carte.  The menu looks good though.  It has all kinds of skewers but mostly rolls.  We ordered the 'Snow in Vegas', 'Lemon Salmon', 'Chef #1' and they were all good.  We also had the monkey brain which is tempura banana with spicy crab (interesting).  The server was very attentive.  Since I have my child with me, the only drawback is that most of the rolls are spicy and there were many 'bad' words on the menu.  Other than that, I would definitely go back especially when I am hungry for Japanese rolls.

rn6DcBWGtQcM2EtmV9LuEA.text: Hole in the whole gem! I've never had YAMA sushi and when we went, there was a ridiculous line. Well good thing there was or else we wouldn't have found this place! I YELPed and saw all the stars. The moment we arrived we were seated right away and had drinks and food within 3-5 min, no lie. There was not one time we did not have food in our mouths, service was that good. The chef at the sushi bar was really nice and made us a habanero roll but tweeked my roll since I have shellfish allergies. Since then we have been regulars! I've brought so many people there and they all love it. Highly recommend the call 911 for those we love spice and their nigiri! Fish is so fresh and this is the only AYCE I've been to who gives thick slices of fish and little amount of rice. We are regulars here. The other great thing is the 2 for 1 drinks which include soju!! They have a variety of appetizers which are all amazing. Great customer service, great food, always leaving stuffed and in a food coma!

SMSDL4ie5M9pnduD9dBGjA.text: PERFECT in all ways, haven't  been disappointed yet! Food is great, service is great, the only downside is that more and more people are finding out about this place.... :( good for business bad for me lol!

nKa1FXV02kCxWzD4fMEaLQ.text: I love the atmosphere! And their service is always fast and good! And their sushi is SO good! I love coming to sakana! And their proportions are awesome!

OoiLW8TDfmcoiBO-7UZdXw.text: I got married in Vegas about a month ago. My new husband and I love sushi, so we really wanted to find an AYCE sushi since we end up eating our body weight's worth.  We were going to try a different sushi place, but their electricity was out, so we turned to Yelp. I'm so glad that we did!  The place looked a little run down from the outside, but the inside was nice.  It was about $20 for AYCE lunch (which is an amazing deal since we ate so much). Service was a little slow at first, but it wasn't too bad after we got our first plate.  The food was amazing! Usually with AYCE sushi, they load the rolls with a ton of rice, but the fish-to-rice ratio was great.  Everything tasted really fresh and there were so many different rolls to try (none of them I disliked). It was so good, we want to make the 10 hr drive (from AZ) just to go back there.  We even joke about moving next door. (:

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EYKaVb6KfqwcG7CqlMtIOQ.text: Another great AYCE place in Vegas with it's own unique offerings.  Sakana seems to have more rolls with very "interesting" names which you'll have to ask your waiter to find out the ingredients.  We tried and did like all the popular ones but having to ask what each was made of was a little annoying.  Sushi was great and fresh.  Portion size of fish is larger than Goyemon.  Ama Ebi was served without rice which is different but kinda nice (space saving).  The grilled pork belly app was really good.  Would definitely go back.  Service was fast and you order by checking off on a sheet for most of the menu which I kinda prefer as you get to see how much you are ordering per round.  Rest of my table was a little disappointed by limited dessert menu (compared to Goyemon) but I didn't mind.  Didn't come here for dessert.

mcrTy9DLPBpZscNsrvlpsg.text: Amazing and delicious!  Every roll was wonderful!  The ayce price was very reasonable too considering what they offer!  Our chef even offered a special roll that wasn't on the menu and was amazing too!  We will definitely be back.  :)

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy Sushi!

LTuSCVhRMYu14JGU_dUslQ.text: They are really fast with the food and really interesting rolls good service  first time here nice atmosphere  good music fresh rolls will be back.

7Gc1y6VLIeuUIU-bpobWvg.text: We came around 2pm and were seated immediately. The wait for the food was a little bit longer than other AYCE sushi places, but it was well worth it. The rolls, appetizers, nigiri, and desert all exceed my expectations. The rolls did not have an excess of cream cheese, which is a big turn-off for me. The staff was also friendly and attentive.  This place is definitely my go-to AYCE sushi spot now.

wiXPQK0Io5S_dYQSEvPdfQ.text: Sakana is the best sushi place I have ever been to in Las Vegas. They use portion sizes of nigiri with giant pieces of fish and small amounts of rice. The batman, the sashimi poke stack, and their raw sushi are my favorites. Their roll names are absolutely hilarious, the price is affordable for AYCE, and lastly their awesome 2 for 1 sake!!! Also, their dessert is one of a kind from green tea panacotta to mini honey toast! The owner of this place is this gorgeous Japanese lady who is so cute and attentive. I have never had a bad experience the what...7 times I've been here?! This place has stolen my heart! I love you Sakana!

IvGHH7q-hTAJpZU4wGm_Ww.text: Really good sushi for the right price. Not as crowded as some other places.  Staff and chefs are friendly. Highly recommend this place if you want to eat off the strip.

Ns3ch5S6kqK1AVF6Vpux1w.text: Five stars is not enough for this place.  We are regulars for a reason.  The fish is always fresh and there isn't a bad item on the menu.  Make sure to order the shit, pang, and the sashimi roll.  Also, drinks (alcohol) are buy one get one!  If you like sushi, you need Sakana in your life!  My favorite sushi spot in Vegas.

DErkmqJNk0EAiGqavZLdiQ.text: I love this place, I came here the day after I move I was looking for a sushi place to eat at and it was either this place of yama I've try Yama it was quite good but not compare to here I love everything about this place. I love the rice to fish ratio that was probably the best part and also that my husband liked it here was good also since he's not a big sushi fan. He kept talking about the tempura ice cream so it must like it. Since the day I came here I've been dreaming of coming back I definitely will see you very soon sakana.

Bf8154jpvOJXL2qGQM1FYQ.text: Need a Soda!!!!! Loving the yuzu yellowtail and the something wrong roll as well service is really good and can't wait to eat more right now. Fish quality is good so far and the sushi rice is good too. Love the fact that the appetizers is available on the all you can eat.

nlc1I-5WxR3Jtc-kLGDNyA.text: The waiting time isn't long at all. Service is fast and attentive ! Great food, would recommend to anyone.

esw-szpt5B0Awv6fyBwRfw.text: Great AYCE Japanese food! Food is fresh and the staff is friendly. Will definitely come again next time! :)

MK3yu7zTUc08KL2oCxu5xA.text: Went for the first time yesterday, I love the atmosphere very animated. On the menu there's two recommendations which are really good I recommend them lol. One think I didn't like is that they don't have a fountain drinks which meant they don't have refills. Other than that it was great.

mxbD1zBrXDcHnDQQNXN_aw.text: We arrived a little bit after 6:30pm on a Monday night and got seated right away. Halfway through our dinner, the restaurant got full and a wait list got started. The staff was welcoming and our server took our orders promptly. This is our first time trying out this restaurant and my wife and I agree that everything is so fresh and delicious! This is going to be on our "must visit" each time we come to Vegas! Ask for the 300 sauce, as it is a perfect blend of savory and spicy flavors. We also enjoyed the skewer selections.

gGDY1FlIYuR6RjIVEpVFUA.text: Excellent all you can eat.  Everything fresh.  Large cut of fish with small amount of rice.  Highly recommended.

y6PwykGOoqMc0IYUoprOQw.text: This is one of my boyfriend and mine's favorite late nite places to eat. The service is quick and the food is fresh and delicious. They have made some great atmosphere changes lately too. The lady with the bunny apron is the cutest; she sometimes gives us free miso soup! ;)

RC0Q_h280alkbQ38aOXZDg.text: Best sushi spot ever! Fresh tasting and top of the line service.

1u8DyobGcUZ9EZBbyAHV3Q.text: Love this place. I've been here multiple times in the past couple of most. The sushi is fresh and there is great variety. Service is always fast and friendly. Gio is a great server! So are the others I just don't know their names. Lastly, the prices are great for AYCE. I definitely recommend.

1cExQMK4N_vDWAY4TU_y-g.text: This place never disappoints! But today it seemed as I was just at the wrong place at the wrong time. As I was waiting for my order, two servers behind me clashed and spilt all sorts off liquids (including beer) which got on my sweater and pants. Of course, they were quick to clean the mess and very apologetic, I ended up moving to the end of the bar. Then as I was enjoying my sushi, a server picked up my drink and refilled it with water..but I was drinking sprite..lol. Common mistake, the server brought me an additional sprite on the house. Again, this place never disappoints! Overall the food was great as always, the team just seemed like a hot mess!

wBST4qi2oLeC6ssd0ITweQ.text: Amazing sushi. Had the all you can eat lunch deal for $21, and it was well worth it! Will make an effort to come back again.

UC7X7qPzmEd_0710RCMUyA.text: Our first visit here is one we will not soon forget! It is located in the back out a shopping center,  arriving at 11p.m. on a Thursday night. With several cars in the parking lot we were hoping it was a good sign of a local favorite, and sure enough it was! We sat at the bar and were able to ask for suggestions...every bite aMaZiNg! We went for the AYCE and were not disappointed... Fave rolls: Wet dream, what the heck, be happy, Mexican, baked scallop just to name a few. We will be back!!
