MRiclZ9P2_WvtPi5p4a1JQ.text: Was on a mini vaca in Vegas and was craving sushi! So I headed to yelp and found this little gem!!! It's an AYCE restaurant and I typically tend to stay away from them but I'm glad that I decided to eat here!! The staff is courteous and extremely helpful!! My water and tea were always topped off and the waiter was on point always ready to take my order or ask if I need/wanted anything else! I had a wonderful experience here and can't wait to visit them again.

mpOkLG_h9MA2eXopQb_4wQ.text: Great service, our server was very attentive and made sure our orders were taken as soon as we finished our plates. The food also came out pretty fast once the order is placed.  A wide selection of items on the menu for AYCE, quite impressive. They also don't give you a lot of rice relative to the fish size. In terms of AYCE quality, this is pretty good. Don't expect excellent quality sushi, but it is pretty darn good in terms of AYCE within Vegas.

_-5Li_nL-aJ9DZz_w9Mdcg.text: After spending 3 hours trying to figure out where to eat we came here. We didn't want to spend so much money on food because of the location or the name. We wanted to try something that was more local versus something that revolved around tourists. We came across this place while we were looking for sushi. Looking at the photos of the food/inside and we really liked what we saw.   The entire experience was great! We had to put our name on the waiting list but was seated quickly. I noticed the entire night that everyone who had to wait was seated quickly. 5 minutes seem to be the max time which is great!   The environment was great! Good music (our personal taste) and great decor!   We ordered a few items: Tonkatsu Ramen (Was a little bland and tasted like it came from a packaged ramen pack)  Chicken Katsu Bacon Wrapped Lobster Chicken Karage I Love My Ass Bam Bam Roll Summer Crunch Chanel Roll  If we hadn't done the A.Y.C.E. deal we would have paid around $60 for our meal. Instead we paid around $56. Not much of a difference but we didn't eat til we were full due to us going out right after.   The food tasted AMAZING! The fact that you could get the appetizers for a cheap price was good! The rolls were great as well. The few that I did try was good! My boyfriend really enjoyed it as well! He inhaled EVERYTHING and didn't want to leave!   Highly recommend this place to those who want something the locals go to!

L5-cZ64OW-6eUiNQ1gcNnA.text: My coworker suggested this place to me a few times and one random date night we decided to give it a try.  The decor is really fun and when you're inside it's doesn't feel like you're in Las Vegas,  the service was quick and not over the top (Anikka our waitress was the best!), last but not least the Sushi!!  It was amazing and fresh!!  The fish to rice ratio was perfect and everything we ordered did not disappoint.  When you go you have to try the: Yum Yum Roll Garlic Tuna Salmon Belly Nigiri  Halibut Nigiri  Salmon Nigiri  Karaage Chicken

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3JADWA2aXE_lBC7Hey_tPg.text: Came here for lunch with a few girls.   For the price I thought it was quite good! I'm from Chicago and we have our fair share of AYCE sushi joints. For some reason, every AYCE sushi place leaves me tongue feeling strange after having their raw fish... and this place was the same.   We ordered a bunch of different rolls and nigiri. Nothing out of the ordinary, rice to fish ratio was good.   The only memorable item I had was an appetiser. I've left an image of the "Dragonball", a battered and fried mushroom filled with cream cheese. The same filling you'd expect from Crab Rangoon. It's served with little crisps and eel sauce.   Ya gotta try it at least once. Where my DBZ peeps at?!

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zDVGMpgSdFchwZOUlPw12w.text: Arrived before 6pm for dinner on a Thursday. We had a party of 6 and we were seated immediately. AYCE $25.95 and the quality of seafood was a great deal. The portion of rice in their rolls and nigiri was small which means more room for a variety of sushi. They also had a 2 for 1 special on drinks. We tried their yogurt-flavored soju and it was yummy. In the end, you can choose from a good variety of dessert including fried bananas a la mode, mochi ice cream, and fried ice cream.   Service was on point too. The food and drinks were served quickly. They cleaned out the empty plates in a timely manner.   I definitely recommend this place to locals and visitors.

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spider hand roll was ok. I forgot the name of the roll. It it had lobster, spicy tuna inside.
Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amaebi &amp; uni. 1 order pp for dinner.
Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hamachi &amp; salmon

yHJsFxNCxsg44n9y_uNq-Q.text: It's really a good restaurant. The food is delicious and cheap. I will come back again if I visit Las Vegas next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. impressive!

pFUbm3kOlO4a0MGwURDKww.text: Food is great but customer service sucks David was our server. His very intimidating and rude!!!  We barely sat down and he was already asking for our orders, didn't even ask for drinks order yet.  We felt like we were being rushed, and we felt that the way he asks about our orders as if we don't know what to get, granting we dont't know what to order 'coz we're not Japenese. He could've asked us politely. It definitely affected our whole dining experience.  Been there several times but our previous servers did our orders right without any intimidation, without any questions. We ordered the chef's special same thing we order everytime time we were there, we even showed him a picture of it but he kept on insisting that the quantity wasn't right and that we wouldn't be able to finish it. Instead of just ordering it, he went on and on up to the point that he was being argumentive and that really annoyed us we had to request for another server.  They should improve on their customer service and be mindful of the customer's dinning experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States

X8hUW21_iYWX3KrnXnMZNg.text: I cant wait to eat there. I left a review before, but the sushi is sooo good had to do it twice. Lol

aFk_8LPxvXw9hRPVk1pKTw.text: In most cases All You Can Eat Sushi, or any foods, for that matter, does not appeal to me. However, in Las Vegas it seems to be a "thing". We came on Boxing Day for lunch and it was packed.  Once sat, the service was quick and attentive with no frills, but very nice.  The food was very, very good. All the fish was fresh, buttery and melt in your mouth.  There did not seem to be any shortcuts because it was AYCE or that is was lunch.  So many choices on the menu so be adventurous, but not glutinous or you will have to pay extra (see the bottom of the menu I attached).  We are here for five days and my husband is looking forward to going back during our trip.  It is off the strip, but totally worth the cab ride over.  Excellent between food and value.

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7hhaPBzBV2tqHO0sQsjDXg.text: Not being from Vegas we wanted a place to eat sushi that was off the strip. I found this place on Yelp and had to check it out. I was a bit skeptical when I saw "all you can eat" on the door but felt comfort in the fact that there was a line out the door.   Bottom line the sushi was great and the server was helpful and did not rush us. The entire menu was included for $26 plus your drink was a little extra but free refills.   Anyway I highly recommend if you want a place off the strip.

glv94Rd4zL4M_OSUlDvCYg.text: This is probably the best all you can eat sushi restaurant I can find. It is only $20 per person for lunch and $25 per person for dinner. There is no limit on what you can order and this place has more variety compared to other all you can eat sushi restaurants I've been to. Interior decoration is really cute and staff is attentive. Wish I took more pictures, but I was busy enjoying my company and food, I forgot! Will definitely be coming back for more.

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KNMhCUbuf7yWfaFuoQyZxg.text: I have been to many sushi place in Vegas. This is the worst place. Try sushi house of Goyemon or Yama sushi instead. Trust me if u want to have a good time and enjoy the food. The sushi comes with too much rice. And they ran out of premium sushi and charge us full AYCE price.

VjqnDi9cuhGVf9iNtDandw.text: Came here for Sunday lunch for two at $20.95/person AYCE. Lunch hours from 11:30-3pm. Loved the super white tuna, garlic tuna, and bam bam roll.  Service was fast; we were seated and served quickly. Lots of parking spaces in the shared complex. Highly recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic tuna, seared lemon salmon, &amp; super white tuna nigiri

4cdSsB6hr6cTyC0iE-20fg.text: Off the beaten path, this Sushi spot has a great all you can eat menu. Between the Yelp reviews I scoured and our very helpful server (shout out to a former Bay Area dweller) we had one tasty plate after another. We went on a Monday night and we waited under 5 minutes to be seated. The place was clean, the seafood was fresh,  and the portions were exactly what one might expect for sushi.   We shared the Uni, Ikura, Pork Belly, Superman, Green Mussels, Salmon Lover Roll, Wet Dream, Double Dragon, The Shit, and Baked Lobster Roll. Great names, right? Although I wasn't thrilled by the hot dishes with cream cheese (and I LOVE cream cheese), I think it's worth trying at least one unconventional creamy hot dish. Having a single plate of each one of our choices was ample making the few items that only allow one request per person insignificant because we didn't feel deprived or cheated in any way.   This place was definitely worth the taxi ride to/from the strip. This is a great place for a foodie challenge, I recommend taking an open minded partner or group. If I end up in Vegas with another sushi lover I'll definitely introduce them to this spot on a Monday night.

Ip7VvjkMkNcAE82DSNHcow.text: This has got to be my favorite sushi place. Their fish to rice ratio is perfect, the rice isn't more than the fish. The no name roll is the best!

9K4o4S3wqiTIJsQb-dfaRg.text: What a great place! Everything is pretty fresh and tasty. Service was on point. Not great for children though because 8 years old is full price and all my daughters and her friends would eat were the edamame beans. Next time I'll leave the children home and go with adults only.

-Bt3Omk5J5TwRqleQhj_9Q.text: Their sushi quality has gone down. The sushi is very stringy and the rice falls apart easy, but otherwise staff respond quickly to orders and the rolls they put together are good. Can be busy but even then it's not a crazy wait once you're seated

SPFQ3-xsFI98lMy6iCDrUw.text: Jonesin for sushi, during my stay out in downtown Vegas.  Place had a lot of reviews (one of the things I look for), and rated 4+ stars.  Very good experience, overall.  I was not disappointed. Sat at the counter, and the chefs hooked me up with the AYCE.  Great variety of rolls, I was stuffed after four... high quality ingredients!  Enjoyed myself thoroughly

yenLgwvwUvtnIzI_EDUkSg.text: Worth the wait! Food came quickly and it was fresh and so good! The hamachi Kama came out kinda overdone but everything else was yummy! I only regret we were allowed just one order of dessert each.  Agedashi tofu, seared lemon salmon, and sashimi poke were among my favorites

UJjT75ccwODRMg6GzffT0A.text: The food here is okay, not as good as California sushi. The service was okay, the server is not very friendly. We came in for lunch all you can eat for $20.95 which is a pretty good deal, allows you order the entire menu for all you can eat. The server was nice enough to let us get the lunch deal because we came in 1 minute before 3pm before lunch ends. The sushi is okay, not that fresh, the appetizers were somewhat tasty and flavorful. The names of the sushi is pretty funny. There was an appetizer called the shit you must try, I thought the name was pretty funny. Overall I would not be coming back for the food.

iNj4PnhSnE3NG-hIFmzrXg.text: I've never had an all you can eat sushi like this. My husband is a sushi fanatic and coming here didn't disappoint his pallet. Lisa Lisa roll was amaze balls and j had a few good spicy ones. I'll come back for sure

qhV7HPySa7bgPRnq4k2YMw.text: This place was amazing food was great, service was amazing told the server it was our first time and he was patient and explained how it works. The food is superb and it's not too pricey

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. CALIFORNA roll
Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu

dnTp6Tad-xL1oyHzMmfFXA.text: Great food and even better price! Was very shocked to learn that all the sushi is all u can eat! That never happens!! For sure will be returning.

eJ9R7h6k61q-pnZ1v1VMew.text: The quality of fish and variety was really good  they even even  have belly salmon and uni but they limit u to one per customer. The ALL YOU CAN EAT @$21 lunch and $26 dinner is respectable.  There are a few problems however.  Foremost, there was a wait to be seated cause it's not a huge place and this was on a Wednesday evening. Next , the service was pretty slow.  Again, it was really busy so we didn't mind that much. Don't order baked things unless u rlly want a wait as they only have one oven.   The thing that really stunk was the NBA Finals were on and they have two TVs that only show USB stuff. No cable. It was showing some cooking dvd which is just unacceptable to me and why we can't go back til they have it.     I put it #3 in AYCE in Vegas for now

yUDvOViBDWg1_X2c06QR3g.text: THIS PLACE IS SO GOOD. I'd recommend getting the nigiri only - the rolls fill you up really quickly and didn't taste that good to be honest, we only ordered 2 in our meal. But the nigiris were so worth it, a proper portion of rice, which big thick cuts of sashimi.  I'd say the servers are slow to seat people (could be intentional), but we'd definitely come back the next time we're in Vegas!

fJm5F_9ebwQLSe9hzhvzsA.text: Delicious AYCE sushi, we've hit this spot about 2 times already while being in Vegas, I'm usually a vegetarian but I allow myself seafood 2 times of out the month to indulge in seafood. Great place, great service!

qjbQ7O41V8GZ6-aqzlWO7Q.text: This restaurant is located inside a plaza..  One of the best sushi restaurant FRESH fish ... everything is fresh , quality fish  My favorite includes the salmon, tempura, lobster king roll, fresh water eel, tuna, super white tuna, ...  will definitely come back again..

eTCVA84CA6wLIcFtD45nUQ.text: Great AYCE sushi restaurant at an affordable price! My experience at Sakana was pretty similar to the majority of the reviews already posted. I like how the nigiri sushi at this place gives roughly double the size of fish with about half the size of rice when compared to traditional sushi. All the sushi I tried was fresh and delicious. They menu is large and if you're not in the mood for sushi, they also offer food items like chicken katsu, teriyaki beef, udon, etc. I do feel that there are other AYCE sushi restaurants with a larger menu compared to this place. My only complaint is that although the servers are very friendly and helpful, service is slow. Overall, good experience and worth a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States

K7khhR8SM7wH-5kagMtC6g.text: We were a party of 3 and came here on a Thursday around 7PM. The wait took over an hour, so make sure to call in before or make a reservation. The sushi was unique and it's the most memorable AYCE sushi I've tried. We were also lucky to be able to sit next to the cherry blossom tree. However, they were just really busy and forgot a few of my orders but it's understandable. Overall, the pros are tasty and special sushi with a fun environment. The downsides was the long wait and how busy and loud it was.

4ITPqlVhLVgS_3hoARdIgA.text: Rolls were good. Atmosphere was very cute!! We got the bam bam roll, kiss of fire roll, and no name roll. ALL WAS GOOOOOD

y_of8772tjCInbOwJblH8w.text: Very delicious and worth coming back again, and again, and again. My favorite sushi restaurant! By the way, Sean Scott, my closest friend, loves it here too. He doesn't have yelp, so I'm writing this for him lol

m_ZaHesBhsYTlp_buVtLKw.text: My usual is sushi Mon but this spot is my new favorite.  Service is good and a very good rice to fish ratio! Try it out.

Ap1nVNGiFdSenq4VBs1OXg.text: At first we went here thinking it was a normal sit-down Sushi restaurant, but we did not know it had a Buffet option too. It was very hard to believe that the buffet was only $22, which included a vast variety of options. I had to clarify if I understood it right, lol. So what I think is amazing is that they make everything you order FRESH! There is nothing cheap about this place, quality wise. Everything was delicious and I really enjoyed it. I will definitely come back again!

FT4MjpAuobP_YVVr1Poe9Q.text: Terrible service and the most ridiculous left over charge if you don't finish your meal with all you can eat even if you haven't spent the all you can eat price. Managers are poorly trained and zero focus on customer service. This place brings las vegas down thankfully it's not on the strip. If you go to visit don't go here!

NgsPhaUT9dsv_oFecrxb_Q.text: Excellent service. Premium cuts of fish. Sakana is the go to AYCE sushi restaurant and the sushi chefs wave and say hello! I'm like hay gurrllll. No but really though, wonderful place. Go for their nigiri! So good.

WQDdWnvBHg5DFte7dFmI4A.text: My husband and I are avid fans of sushi and are regulars to a another sushi place. A friend recommended Sakana so we decided to try it out.  The first likeable thing is that we were quickly given a table eventhough it's a Friday night. I also liked that there's enough space between tables so my husband and I can actually talk and enjoy the food without being unintentionally bothered by other customers' conversations. Staff are courteous and prompt, too.  We liked the baked green mussels, shrimp tempura, garlic tuna, Bam-Bam (and I can't rember the other one). The seafood salad and hamachi kama are alright but would not be on top of mind. Too bad those two are our usual cravings. Other than that, the place is good.  #

rxZgQRD6uShBhrt_8T44SA.text: Leaving a review here so I remember to go next time. Unlimited sushi is usually something I only saw in Europe for lunch hour, with not-so-fresh menu items that would be left over. This place is the fucking bomb. Everything is amazing! Uni tasted like it came straight from the sea. Waiters are so polite! Place gets crowded a lot so plan on waiting at least 10-15 min on a good day.

2Cv6SFs2Ce6OaKo5pwWvvw.text: Went here for my birthday and I was so pleasantly surprised that this place was better than our usual favorite sushi place Yamasushi.  Food and service was great.  Place was a lot roomier than most sushi places.  Everything we tried was delicious.  We will definitely come back for more!!!

R9Ml2NyOiiPqWmFO9NQX3A.text: Iv been coming here since it first opened and that probably why the staff remembers me and my family. The staff is amazing their always so polite sunny is so sweet and really good with kids. The chefs Dragon and Sye are the reason why I don't go to sushi anywhere else but here. I mostly eat the nigiri sushi, the raw fish is always so fresh. Even on a busy night there always checking if we're doing ok, refilling our drinks etc. their the best. I tell everyone about this place! I come here for my birthday every year and everyone I take here always leaves saying their coming back! THIS IS THE SUSHI SPOT.

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon, smoked salmon, albacore, tuna.. Anything Nigiri you can&#39;t go wrong!
Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sashimi salad &amp; Shrimp tempura

9GG_zs6W7zRcy7aPQdUS5A.text: My favorite in Vegas! I went twice because of its best taste, and very good price during the short stay of four days!

MOxWuwqQj0AvwascLeGAjQ.text: Tied for best all you can eat sushi ever. My fiance and I have been to 20+ all you can eats and this is top tier for sure. Huge selection. You can order half rolls on most items which allows you to eat a large variety. Most importantly the fish is fresh! This is a must for us now everytime we come to Las Vegas now.

6hz5CCKVw6FCWOaXY2_AGw.text: I think I found my new ayce sushi spot! The best part about this place is the rice to fish ratio! The don't try to cheat you with large amount of rice in every piece of nigiri. Food comes out fast, nice service. $26 for ayce sushi dinner is also cheaper than most. I don't see any negatives. Definitely recommend!!!!

XzpNfEElWhNhRkL1gmEhIQ.text: Good price, value and not too much rice indeed! I tried the hand rolls - spicy scallop (nah), the s special (tuna was fishy). The appetizer - the spicy fried tofu was good, pork belly can be softer, the lobster bacon can be bigger, the shrimp skewer was small, the chicken skewer was good, bulgogi we so so, the tempura was so so, the shit was really good!! The chef #1 roll was not bad, ca roll was ok. The one I loved the most was super white tuna, torched paprika salmon, and my son favorite was the pop corn lobster!!

f1-7l6wEvAcZRR8vidvaUg.text: Looove their nigiris..they're always fresh! You also have to try their bulgogi nachos!! Also the Chanel roll, Hamachi kama, and japanese lasagna roll. One of the best sushi places in vegas! We always go here everytime we're craving for sushi.

kzm1XXLCTTW1pLW22SbgfQ.text: Awesome portions! Definitely one of the better all you can eat spots. The wait wasn't long, about 10 minutes on a Saturday night for 4. Everything we ordered did not disappoint, ranging from super white tuna to ocean trout.

uxIrJIkDDoLKLJjS64I1Qw.text: Fantastic place. We've been going here constantly over the past year, and the quality is always consistent.

Thxnu69IcORyYVdpYwUpWg.text: Good cuts of fish. I recommend this place when visiting Las Vegas.. very polite servers working hard in a busy atmosphere..

lc7a46CFav294KxHOviotQ.text: Our stable place every time we are in town! Really good quality seafood. Love the salmon, white tuna, eel. When it gets busy, they tend to mess up the orders. Overall worth it though.

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eek and makerel
Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Paprika salmon
Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon

4mZHJtbEZ6uRdPiXexb01Q.text: I have been to most of the sushi joints in the valley but this one takes the cake! It has an AYCE option at an affordable price with a pretty extensive amount of options to choose from. I have never cared for the K-pop music videos they have playing (would prefer maybe a sports game like other sushi restaurants) but they play other music on the speakers so you do not really notice it. Almost always busy at night but would you really want to eat at a fish place that was empty?? Good service and I have yet to try anything there I regret.

i2XkdK5ZgY6v86kmw7HQNw.text: Sakana is one of the best sushi places I've eaten at since I moved away from california. It is definitely the best all you can eat. At a good price, you get the top quality sushi. A must try are the white tuna, salmon, fresh water eel, and all the 'one time dinner only' special nigiri. The service was excellent as well despite a more than full house. If I lived in vegas, I would eat here like every day if i could. Thanks for the great experience Sakana!

iOmpH57cMXzL8kDcOJvFWw.text: Looking for something delish and different? This place is it! Living in south summerlin area I usually don't travel too far out for food usually stay within 10 mins of my area, but this little gem was all worth every bite. If your looking for a place similar to Oyshi but on the east side of the strip this place is it. Actually this place was worth the drive for sure.  We came in around 6:30 the line was about 20 mins wait. And thankfully we did because at 7pm there was a huge line out the door. It's not a really big restaurant either so maybe that's why they had a wait but try to go early is always the best.  My fav things.... Ahi poke chips( had 4 orders it was that good) Super white tuna had this garlic sauce was delish  Monkey brain really yummy and different.  Bulgogi nachos was good but the chips were kinda stale to me.  And than our usual platter of unagi, salmon, white tuna, ahi tuna, yellowtail, sweet shrimp.  Quality and freshness was good.  Only thing I didn't like was they only sold can soda so they want you to buy more but it might have a been a good thing cause I didn't need more than one anyway.  I'll make this trip again soon.

S4XK-MA7QBuyaKmXeFPuHQ.text: This place is very affordable and the sushi was great! It was very fresh and the staff there are nice people. The business is on the smaller side but overall not a bad place to go for your seafood fix.

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I love sushi!

iZdXG18QaGPgpYt_qu-t_Q.text: Had an enjoyable enough experience. Orders came surprisingly quick and the quality was top notch. Honestly didn't have anything to complain about until dessert. Unlike every other all you can eat sushi place I've been to in the Las Vegas area, they limit one dessert per person which left a damper to my party's dining experience. Would have been a flawless experience otherwise.

mBP7ni2Q3fXn0QqrEZWsFg.text: This place is definitely worth the trip off the strip. $25 AYCE is just amazing. There's a huge variety of rolls and nigiri that they offer, and they don't even mind if you order 60 of something (we had a group of 12 and some of us were really ambitious....). The staff were all very pleasant and accommodating, especially for how many people we had and how much we ordered!   The fish to rice ratio was perfect!! I could wrap the fish back around the rice, which is so much more than can be said about most sushi places, much less AYCE. I also really appreciated that they actually made the effort to bring the nigiri out quickly enough that the fish would still be relatively cold, but the rice still warm! Unfortunately, the sushi rice didn't really hold up too well, but I guess I ain't complaining if I didn't want to eat that much rice anyway.  My favorite rolls were the Screaming O, Something Wrong, and Burning Your Ass (LOL.). There were some rolls we ordered I really wanted to try (like all the other spicy rolls) but our group was weaksawce and ordered way too much of a few of the same things so we had to cancel a bunch of orders in the end. Guess it'll have to wait for next time I'm in Vegas!

n3AvDZjeF70uLqEALAQuOg.text: Great AYCE sushi! Prices reasonable even if you order al a carte. Dinged one star for not having real crab as an option.

ObzrF2X_yjSvpIZCNz3dQg.text: I loved it!! All u can eat menu is extensive and food is delicious!! Will come back every time I'm in Vegas! Place is a bit hidden and out of the way, but Totally Worth It!

FHARcDd8rvKZMjPPhzahMQ.text: This is our new All-You-Can-Eat sushi place. We never even looked this way until I read the Yelp reviews. This place has a few things going against it (location and signage) but the sushi, price and service outshines the odds.  The price is less than $25 for all you can eat and the sushi is served with little rice! That's my favorite part. We didn't eat big gobs of rice every piece. I'm into "cooked" sushi while my boyfriend eats the real sushi. We both left happy because there were enough items for both of us. Lots of options for the "cooked" sushi eaters like me. The service is great too. We've been back a few times since.  The inside could use a facelift so don't be discouraged when you walk in.

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegas roll - salmon, crab, fresh water eel, cream cheese, avocado w/ masago &amp; eel sauce.
Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken &amp; vegetable yakatori
Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sashimi roll - crab, salmon, yellowtail wrapped in cucumber.

R-rx7m9AludnA8jH1C55zw.text: Why didn't I know about this place earlier?!  Okay, well for starters I almost gave up since the sign outside still says Kabuki and not Sakana!  I was actually already going to take one star off for the fact I drove around and around...until I read a little yelp tip that finally led me to this treasure.  When we walked in we were immediately greeted and asked if we wanted a table or sushi bar....I said table, but the sushi bar chef yelled sushi bar at the hostess and apparently he calls the shots =P  Eating at the sushi bar was definitely an advantage, we called off our orders to the chef and he made them on the spot!   For starters this place has AYCE for $22.95...cheapest AYCE in Vegas that I know of.  So most important part of AYCE is freshness and the rice to fish ratio for the sushi.  I swear there were not more than 20 kernels of rice per piece of fish!  I would equate this to almost eating sashimi with the small amount of rice per piece.  The salmon, white tuna, unagi, seared tuna were all extremely fresh and well prepared.  Okay, so the best part is how they sear off the tuna and unagi with a blow torch....it was still piping hot when I consumed it, pure heaven! The specials that day were salmon belly and toro steak....again more bites of perfection!  We tried a few rolls that were on their dinner/one time only part of the AYCE menu as well.  The towering sashimi poke with wonton crisps...I could have just sat there and eaten that all night, cripsy wonton shell with fresh fish and a touch of acidity....too bad we were limited to one order per person =(.  We also tried their Screaming O and the Sashimi Roll, both of which were well prepared as well.  The only thing I honestly did not like....the plum ice cream (this was slightly atrocious to be since it reminded me of the pink amoxicillin (antibiotic) medication I had as a child that they tried to disguise with some unknown flavor.  But, minor flaw given they have plenty of other options for dessert.  Make sure you look at their updated menus on the counter as well....the one that is laminated that they hand you is missing a few items.  If you love AYCE sushi....you have to try this place out.  I say comparable to Goyemon/Sushi Mon for a lower price and less rice =)

5htYJnu__pSfDNEXRqW7zw.text: Came here with a friend after a craving for fish on a Sunday afternoon.  Sakana is located in the corner of a shopping center with Target on Maryland Ave; sort of easy to miss because it's tucked in the corner.  The place isn't big, but not crammed in any way.    We decided on the AYCE sushi option, as the menu is vast.  The only downside is that there isn't really any sashimi; or rather, the sashimi is not just simple raw cuts of fish, but instead sashimi dressed up in sauces, fruits or veggies.  However, there are definitely many different interesting rolls to try, and they were quite good.  I'm more of a nigiri and sashimi eater, but I definitely like rolls as well.  All in all, the fish here is just average, but the rolls were definitely creative, nicely presented, and tasty.  The cooked food was actually the best part of the menu surprisingly; the pork belly and tempura calamari was top-notch.    Have I been to a better AYCE sushi buffet at 24.95?  You bet.  But this one's not bad and will do for a pinch if you're in the area.

Z7Rd_0TJagxHwEkku2yu4g.text: Pretty much the best sushi I've had in Vegas. Good service. Amazing.  Good atmosphere.  we get around to a lot of sushi, and we keep coming back here. About the only downside is getting a can of soda instead of refills.

uhhUegvVUQVwdkrqedG1RQ.text: The place is a little small but the sushi is amazing. They also have a relatively modestly priced AYCE option.

m1OD8WuskwpL0ea-JE9bOQ.text: Been in Vegas for two days...been to many restaurants and overpaid on most of the meals we've had here. Until I stumbled upon here, lunch AYCE ONLY 20.95!!! Service was great, overall quality and taste of sushi was superb! Best place we've eaten so far. Now I can go home happy!! :))

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked mussels and baked lobster roll.
Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Some special rolls...all rolls ordered were equally good!

1RLl_7G0PxfuuP9z1kec2g.text: Was a little hesitant going in, but I was blown away. Everything was fresh, the atmosphere was cool, and the sushi chefs were fun and let us try new rolls. The 2 for 1 beer is a great deal! Best AYCE I've had in vegas by far.  I most definitely will be back - might even be my new go to sushi spot.

AuiZxOkv6au5oxujZyI7GA.text: "Why me, Jesus? WHY ME!?"   So I didn't actually say that, but THAT'S HOW I FELT after eating here when everybody else apparently had the time of their lives. We rolled in on a Friday night and saw the below -   + Party of a lot of people in the dining room. OK, a crowd is a good sign. + Seats at the sushi bar. On a Friday night with no wait? I'll take it.  + Huge fish to rice ratio. That's my attempt at "low carb."   We sat down at the sushi bar and our server came by with our drinks pretty quickly, and we hit the ground running with our orders. At this point in the story, it's important to note that on a Friday night with a massive group that took up half of the restaurant, there were only two sushi chefs. Not for the sushi bar. I mean, for the whole place.   I gave them the benefit of the doubt for the first few orders because I knew that a group of that size could definitely put a dent in the operation. But after our requests kept getting sidetracked time after time, it became frustrating as we saw our orders get plated with more focus on the presentation than the service speed...only to see it get served to someone else. This was on top of the fact that a few of our orders were also "lost" - not just at the sushi bar, but in the kitchen too. Those bulgogi nachos that I finally mustered up the courage to try? I'll never know how they tasted because they never hit the table.   Ehh, so maybe this was an isolated incident - I can see that happening. I'm willing to give it another shot, but with so many other AYCE sushi options available around town, it's going to be a while before I swing by again.

Y9sYUGq5Fx4gV-FpyAgldQ.text: My daughter has been bugging me for a few months now to try this place, so when she decided to treat me, I accepted.  The place is a bit hidden in a large plaza, and if I was not with her I wouldn't think I would locate it easily.   We went for the AYCE offer they had, and I can tell you the food and service was amazing!!!  And it's worth every penny and then some.  Everything we tried was delicious that I cannot even tell you what my favorite item even was.   Only downfall is the seats, we were seated against the wall and the seats were all pretty benches, however, it was very uncomfortable.  A small cushion is provided, but made no difference.  If they had better comfortable seats I would have given this place 5 stars.  But our overall experience with the food and service overcame this.    I will be back.... Regularly!!!!

khg2fI0tjZgAAT0yW9SyxQ.text: We looking for a different type of food in the area but the place we found was closed. We saw Sakana next door and gave it try because of the good reviews. It didn't disappoint. I wish we lived in the area. If I were, I would be back here almost every week!

rNZGufHW4DwuGK1fgNIz8Q.text: I am not of a seafood person, but came with my husband and a friend who like sushi.   I had the Bulgogi nacho...YUM!!!   And just the right sized serving (although when it came I was a little worried it wouldn't be enough).   I finished my meal with two desserts... Tempura ice cream and the fried banana.   Both were really good, but I think the ice cream paired better with the tempura than the banana did.    The atmosphere is lovely...a bit eclectic.  It does get a little loud, but we were able to chat.

XOt70PywPkrgqHplpM9asQ.text: I was sooo looking forward to checking this place out.  Based on the yelp reviews, it sounded like a good place, but this is one of those times that yelp had done me wrong :(  Came here about a month ago for dinner with a few friends on a Friday night.  Probably will not be back.  Service wasn't bad, but the quality of the sushi and fish just isn't worth it.  It's located on the corner of Flamingo and Maryland, in the Target complex.  It was a little difficult to find, because there was no actual sign that read Sakana.  From what I remember, I think the restaurant used to be called "Kabuki."  I think that sign was still up.    Anyway, there was 6 of us.  When we walked in, there were a bunch of empty tables that had yet to be cleaned up--maybe low on staff?  There's a sushi bar and a few TVs that played some Asian pop music videos.  Quite entertaining to watch lol!  We were seated shortly after one of the employees had a chance to clear up one of the tables.  She promptly brought us our beer and water as we requested (I remember them having beer specials--I think a 2 for 1 deal), but it felt like it took forever to order and get our food.  We ordered a variety of things from the menu--rolls, appetizers, nigiri.  The food was less than mediocre.  One of the things we had ordered (I can't quite remember, I think it was the albacore) was fishy--to the point where I had to spit it up into my napkin.  Mind you, I love sushi. I know my sushi. And I take pride in the fact that I know the difference in quality.  The appetizers weren't bad.  I liked the chicken and the mussels.  Other than that, I felt pretty let down.  And I felt like I let my friends down for suggesting the place :(... Oh well, ya win some, ya lose some. Probably won't be back again.

LqqEUmrQqplaVwt5-b7S4g.text: Great food! All you can eat is a great deal! Service was quick and very efficient. Definitely will be back when we visit Las Vegas again!

6W-ke-9dXIfqzQvyv4pzTg.text: We make the trek off of the strip to check this joint out. Don't be fooled by location, the prices are amazing, the staff is great and the food is BOMB.COM  A menu with over 74 rolls. YESSSSS

IEtSXfWlkKOoslcP_dS_9A.text: Saw this place on yelp, read the reviews, then decided I had to visit this place while I was in Vegas.  I love Sushi and feel my standards are pretty high.  I had never been to an AYCE sushi place so I was a little skeptical.  Fortunately I gave this place a shot.  The sushi was excellent.  Everything we ate we loved.  They have so many different rolls with so many great flavors.  Do yourself a favor and try it out!!!!  Oh, and at the time we were there it was 2 for 1 when I bought a tall bottle of Sapporo!     I honestly feel guilty for how much I ate...  Upwards of 10 rolls, 4 appetizers and 2 desserts between my fiance and I.

XHq3kICrpI8NRIW_uEHtyg.text: I was afraid of this place when I walked in to the somewhat sketchy stripmall with the wrong restaurant name on the outside.  However, once inside the experience was great.  The AYCE is 20 for lunch and 22 for dinner, one of the better ayce deals in town.  However, this is one of the few places you can fill up without using the AYCE.  Rolls were all marked 1/2 off on the printed menu so you could get a 4 piece roll for 4.95 and an 8 pc special roll for 8.95.  Someone who is full after 2 or 3 rolls can slide in under $22.00 and still manage to taste several different items.  I tried the roll called "the Sh$T"  It is really good.  I would get it again.  The waitress explained what was in it but I didn't pay attention. Something about crab, special sauce deep fried, blah blah.  I also had the soft shell crab appetizer which was part of the AYCE.  It was good, but not great.  For rolls I had a red dragon, a baked scallop roll (4pc) and the last roll, I can't remember its name but it was awesome, the best roll I had all day.  THis is definitely going into my rotation.

VT6evpdsCAaRhLAc1ya6ew.text: This is one of my regular stops every time I come to Vegas. The sushi quality is excellent and on par with some of my favorite restaurants in LA. I recommend getting the ocean trout, smoked paprika salmon, garlic albacore, and salmon belly.

Y_IVMErgM5mULN09WKZxJQ.text: Wow, amazing. Fresh fish, great taste, amazing value. Too bad they don't have one in LA

pkmVjXoy5Dl_jE01MTxplw.text: Hands down my favorite Sushi place in the continental US. Too bad I live in Orlando FL!!! Every single time we go to Vegas, we make it a point to eat here. Better than ANYTHING on the Strip and way more affordable. You must eat here if you are visiting Vegas.

Upc9qbfl-gvQoduoQLH_6A.text: I've lived in Japan and so I've tasted good, authentic sushi before.... having said that, I'd say that the sushi at Sakana is the best I've ever tasted outside of Japan. Huge, delicious portions. Highly recommend!

XVecmukbhra-UMxN0Foi-Q.text: Always a good time I don't mind waiting coz it's worth the wait. My favorite place for a night out

FQupl3fipNzZawztjbXy5w.text: Had to try this place after the such high ratings given by other Yelpers. I have to say it was a little disappointing.  First, the pros:  Service was great. The sushi chef was super friendly and attentive, as was the wait staff. If you have a chance to talk to Chef Sai, by all means do so.   The price for their AYCE is definitely the best in the valley, given the selection.  Now, the cons:  Not only is this restaurant far from me, the signage is also incorrect. Luckily it was the only sushi restaurant in the shopping mall.  The food was really hit and miss. The nigiri and other sushi was fine. The selection of nigiri and rolls is similar to other AYCE sushi restaurants. The selections from the grill however, were just terrible. I remember ordering the grilled shishito peppers, a favorite dish of mine. The shishito peppers I got that day were sooo salty it made my eyes water.   So, the price and service are a big draw, but because of the food and location, I won't make any special trips out there.

vcGyM0Z9Rv88TGOgcWTY9g.text: I've been told this is one of the best sushi spots and I can see why. Can we talk about the decor first?  There's nods to the motherland (Japan) and my favorite director/animator Hayao Miyazaki. Let's talk food. In short you won't leave hungry. But be warned if you do all you can eat. They charge you for what you can't finish.

Tr5Qsm2sFMRxXh3Va0c-3A.text: Sakana is pretty chill all you can eat deal. A lot of their rolls can have cream cheese in it and some times they just over do it.   Overall, it's nice place and nice environment that allows you to get away from the strip if youre trying to get away.

hkoKFy-Awbpye1i7rSPQug.text: The food is great, service is good, waitress are hot, the place is cozy, the music is dope, everything is cool, recommended!!!!!

Pl33VlYO46SjIN1B3lx27g.text: This is one of my favorite places to go to for all you can eat sushi. There menu has a large selection of sushi and for a cheaper price compared to other places. Fast service and friendly servers!

Xs1FnZbUOu8FxhQlJm2izA.text: I gave Sakana a 4 star only bcuz they started slow at bringing me the food but other than that, the size of their nigiri was perfect! The rice wasnt over loading even their rolls it wasn't 3xs as big as ur mouth lol it was bite size, where you can order more and try other variety! I would definitely come back to SAKANA & eat again!!

Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JTQXSCNC5z9xi2E214zQsA.text: This place is great!  The Sushi is the best I've had in Vegas so far and the staff are wonderful. Me and my family love this place!

z1pR6J6KFPjFh3mpGx34hw.text: I'm all about all you can eat places and I must admit if this place was in SD it would totally obliterate the AYCE game. Came here on one of my vegas trips, we decided to stop by before checking in our hotel. The menu was very scattered and it was hard to interpret some areas but I think it's because they have so many options. I would say 4x more options then your neighborhood AYCE restaurant. Some of my favorite appetizers were the fried pork belly and bulgogi nachos. I had the orange blossom roll which is a great starting roll and then I followed it up with the golden tiger roll which I have to say is one of the best roll I've ever had. My friends ordered a bunch of nigiri and they all taste fresh and authentic. The texture and portion of the fish they put on top is larger than most which I think is awesome. The nigiri that stood out the most was the salmon nigiri, definitely recommend! What sets these guys apart from the rest is they have a dessert section for their AYCE, which is unheard of. I got the mini honey toast topped with ice cream. Dessert sections for AYCE are dangerous! lol. Besides the menu being all over the place I noticed the restaurant was obviously short staffed with the waitresses looking like they are running around with their heads chopped off. You feel really bad for them and can't even get mad because it is AYCE and everyone is ordering every minute. I will make coming here a tradition every time I arrive in Las Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Golden Tiger Roll @ Sakanas

T_NWGnOHjJJXgapcVrj0vg.text: Absolutely the best sushi I have ever had!!! My husband and I visit Vegas at lease three times a year and it's our tradition to eat here every time we go no matter what!!!! I only wish a place like this would open up in Cali SushiRox!!!!  Ohh our favorite is the Stuffed Tomato!! Please try!!!

iZ-8lXkyfFWTuWFsfIuFiw.text: It's our 200days anniversary!!! We want to have some sushi so we tried this place. When we got there they have some table already!!! It seems good signal to us. The sushi was so fresh and fish and rice ratio was perfect!!!! Orange blossom roll  and popcorn lobster roll was great!!! They gave some special for us!! Salmon belly sushi and mango salmon sashimi was awesome!!! Everybody was so nice and service was quick!!! I didn't forget tempura ice cream for my dessert!!! Everything was great! This place make my day!!!!

zARwZo5HKLPSRSqKBNFpsw.text: Place was fantastic. Best sushi I have ever had with plenty of seating, a clean environment, and reasonable pricing. Loved this place.

cxhN096zKaVAtLkd0C2IKg.text: Can't say it's the best AYCE sushi in LV since we haven't tried many, but definitely was worth our money! Sushi was fresh and on point, good customer service, and all for $21 for lunch!  Oh and AYCE also includes dessert. Must try: monkey brains, yuzi yellowtail, and the shit!

gee2PS4mUCWilKu_XigsbA.text: This is my favorite ace sushi ever,there food is awesome and the service is fast same with server..I highly recommend.

KcwbRUHqGLrpbi8IpLd3-A.text: 3.5 stars for the sushi.. They temp their sushi very well. Sushi Chefs know what theyre doing when it comes to their sushi. My favorite is their nigiri, especially their super white tuna. must try! Sushi Rice is perfectly cooked and seasoned, Appetizers are good too, spicy edadmame, Grilled hamachi,  pork belly, the shit are good. nigiris are the best in their menus. sushi chef cuts fishes well that size of the fish hugs the rice perfectly. Good fish quality, great knife skills for the sushi chefs (which affects the taste of nigiri).   On the other hand,  I deducted 2 stars for their "unfriendly services" from the servers. I eat here atleast twice a month because they have the best nigiri so far for ayce. everytime I come, Servers are either, ignoring you, rushing you to finish your meal so they can close early, they always forget 1-3 of our orders everytime I come here. The old lady server never smiles at you and she has a resting bitch face so that never helps and I asked a question of how long our group can be seated, she cut me off before I can finish my questions and with an annoyed look she says "just wait okay?"    I would always comeback for the sushi but I would never leave a good tip for a lousy server.

c3XQddgnokyRU1wJezDq-A.text: Fast friendly service. All you can eat is a great deal. Fresh and delicious sushi! We're from out of town and sushi is always a treat. I ordered my favorite Shrimp  Tempura roll .  Keep up the awesome business.

aLlb6bSgJs6U3RcTdIGZxA.text: The food was decent, but I've had better. Wouldve rather had gone to Yama Sushi across the street. The service is what gets this place such a low rating. Our server often times forgot things that we ordered even though we politely reminded him a few times and then he accused of of stealing a can of soda. They charge per can here and he swore that he put a certain number on the table even thought we showed him the empty cans that we had (only a few people had anything other than water) and then when we told him that we were told it was free refills (because we asked) he made us point out and call over the sever  who told us that information. SUPER AWKWARD.  it was a a $0.50 can of soda that he THINKS that he put at our table. We told him "what do you want to see our purses? To prove we arent hiding another can". it was a little ridiculous. Then when we were paying some of us just paid together to make it easier on him to not have to split so many checks (there were 6 of us) and then he came back to ask if we had all paid...like WTF?! First the soda then checking to make sure all the bills were paid instead of checking with the cashier.....I was done. We arent sketchy looking people at all that one business owner might be worried about. We were a group of well dressed ladies  25-50 looking to go out after work .   **ALSO, just saw they were on dirty dining less than a week ago. so BEWARE. Someone posted the link that showed the pictures of fish being left out and the area not being clean**

nmJjfr4W9yi9KI2w0UesrQ.text: Come from Los Angles and first time visit the restaurant. Nice atmosphere. Good quality sushi and all you can eat! Will come here again next time and recommend to all of the sushi fans.

XAEMzSS3mzCJuHMRBUE3Dw.text: Good service. Awesome ambience. Fun environment. Great sushi selection! Convenient location. AYCE sushi for $25.95

MQn6EKhk-AVv53WTqrni6Q.text: We're coming back for more of those salmon belly sushi! The portion of rice and fish is on point. Spider roll is one of my favorite thing on there.

JAah_zh6ZsvjMRmAx67Nyg.text: We arrived at 6pm on a Saturday and the place was barely 1/3 filled. Got our initial orders in for our party of 6 and their servers forget things like hot water and lemons even though there were multiple servers that checked to see if drinks had been ordered. Hint: this becomes a trend. Furthermore when the servers brought our food, they wouldn't say the name of what it was, and when we inquired, they would give us a look as if it was some outlandish request before muttering the name.  Food is mostly average and the only thing that stood out were the giant pieces of straight up bone in our yellow tail tuna nigiri. How is that even possible???? Lastly, our 3rd or 4th orders were conveniently missing things. By that point, the place was reaching capacity, and all the above issues was informed to our server. Unimpressed with the food and service,  we decided not to reorder and we didn't think we were missing out on much.   The review sounds nit picky, but these were the things that absolutely stood out and brought it to my current rating. Give this place a try if you've exhausted all other dining options.

ZcRrZXZGKPp61_mWg-vIDg.text: Price is right. Friendly service too! Writing this review before I've eaten so this is about the atmosphere, cleanliness and staff.

A19ygkzGCiyu1qieBvzWJQ.text: One of the better sushi restaurants for a larger group; the overhead fans are a great feature to keep everyone cool!

YuQjoULu_DkyrEkXPTWBQQ.text: Fish is fresh, service great so come hungry for the AYCE, they charge extra for extra food left over. My friends and I have made that mistake before haha... but it's all good I took the food home and ate it the next day but fresh is definitely better haha.. (they charge per roll order or nigiri order left behind) I'll be back. I've been here a couple times already but haven't checked in all the time.

D1WdsjnCeaIhtgtTkOVBqA.text: Great location overall! Love the atmosphere. It is centrally located right next to Target and a couple minutes from the Las Vegas strip. Definitely recommend this place.

ZXOWBK0fBg5JWmoKEAXCpg.text: Ahhhhhhh this place is sushi heaven!!!!!!! Sadly If I could review sushi alone, this place would be 5 stars but I'm keeping one star because service was ridiculous. I came in with a good friend and my FH. The place was pretty packed with about two tables open. We were told it would be a wait and a party that came after us was seated before us. I think they stepped out and we're waiting as well. There was still one table available but the wait staff were quite busy and sat us almost 25 minutes later at the open table that was available the entire time.  \_()_/  It took a few minutes to get water and menus and all three of us were going for AYCE sushi. I'd say every roll we ordered we thoroughly enjoyed. They were out of salmon kama and oysters which was a bummer. My favorite was the little tease roll, it had spicy tuna and cucumber inside and was topped with Cajun tuna, deep fried onion and jalapeno with spicy mayo, garlic ponzu and eel sauce. So effing delicious! My boyfriend had almost every nigiri on the menu and he was impressed with the rice to fish ratio, big portion of fish to rice! Nice! All the rolls were not stuffed with rice and we really did some damage and were not stuffed quickly as they give good portion of rice to fish in all their rolls. Service was lacking. We had to ask many times for water and had to fall down our waiters to order more rolls. Even though service was pretty bad I would still come back because the sushi was that amazing.We definitely didn't browse the menu as much as we should have and next time I will be ordering the things is skipped out on my first visit here because I will definitely be back!!!

Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Too many rolls to remember the name! Sorry. Didn&#39;t like this one anyway.

b1N8XzdR6FZ4dzRm9PZfuQ.text: Best sushi in town! They give the biggest pieces of fish with the nigiri orders and they are super fast! Great staff as well!

iHMY0w9pnGek1wE4qOesww.text: Confession time.  Let's get this out of the way: Before Sakana, my sushi experiences were limited. How limited? As limited as a grocery store. Shameful as it may be it's the truth. And that's not the worst part. I thought I was getting some really great quality items because these grocery stores came full stocked with what appeared to be a genuine sushi chef behind a small pane of glass displaying their craft. Needless to say, my bar of comparison was low prior to trying Sakana for the first time. But thanks to Sakana it is now so much higher. How did I go so many years without going out for Sushi?! Fast forward a bit and now I've visited Sakana thrice in the last month or so. Why go anywhere else for sushi? Every visit I have opted for the AYCE option and it's been worth every penny. With 3 visits under my belt I've had the opportunity to try a multitude of offerings.  Some standouts have been: The Shit, which I regrettably skipped over my first time but will never visit without ordering again. The "dipping sauce" that is paired with it is really what sets it apart. I swear this sauce can be used on basically anything on their menu, or any other menu for that matter, and make it that much better. Try it, don't make my rookie mistake. The Bulgogi Nachos struck me as counterintuitive amongst the other items on their menu but I finally tried them and they were some of the best "nachos" I've had. It's served in a small bowl but I could eat a standard full-size-nacho servings worth of these things. The beef is tender and delicious, and the spicy sauce again sets it apart.  The Nigiri options are pretty extensive and the cuts of meat are hefty and taste fresh. The Unagi and octopus stand out as some of my favorites.  The rolls offered vary in style, size and just about every one I've tried has pleased my palette. For deep fried rolls the Golden California is a safe choice, simply a deep fried Philly roll but it doesn't disappoint. Monkey Brains is a more unique deep fried option with banana being a focal point of it's components. While it wasn't bad it was one of my least favorite rolls.  The Something Wrong, No Name, and Mexican Roll standout in my brain as far as specialty rolls go.  Being of such rookie sushi-eatin status the baked rolls were somewhat new to me but such a great discovery. The lobster lasagna, baked lobster roll and the Wet Dream are just the right size for AYCE patrons. And yes they're delicious.  Service here has been on point for the majority of my 3 visits so far. We have a 1 year old and like some of his peers he can get grumpy and the waitstaff on multiple occasions have done a great job with giving him extra attention to keep him happy. This is huge for me because I hate feeling like we're bothering other diners and they definitely made us feel welcome. Big PLUS in my book.  Yes, I have nothing to compare it to (why venture away from greatness?) so perhaps my review isn't as worthy. BUT...I have a mouth. I've used it to eat lots of food. My taste buds work. And through the magic of science beyond my understanding I am able to distinguish between what tastes good and what doesn't.  Sakana tastes good.

Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The shit. A must try!

CxlSJcrGWOdHOXIMVbuXbQ.text: One word: outstanding! Very nice and attentive service, and creative sushi rolls! We had gyoza, and an appetizer called "the sh#t", which was a crab-stuffed tempura fried jalapeno. It was so fantastic that we ended up getting two orders. We also had the 911 roll and the little teaser which were hot and spicey  (which we loved!). We also got the Hawaiian, which tasted like wonderful poke, and the QA roll (again, wonderful!). We paid a la carte, but they have an all you can eat option which may be cheaper depending on how much you order, but they will charge you for anything you don't eat, so be aware. I highly recommend this place!!!

DCzIRb9-oGLboAzodojKjw.text: Great sushi. Cannot choose one as a favorite and I tried several rolls. Fast service and friendly faces everywhere.

S-pA0HmT19KDTBILlr6yfQ.text: "The Shit" is the actual shit,  great food all around, and wonderful service.... it has a really nice ambiance and everyone was extremely friendly.  The staff answered all question and gave great suggestions on what to have. Would recommend this place to any sushi head!!!!

ta6UaU7MQdnFfDyNV65MVA.text: Awesome place to eat AYCE Sushi! The place is nicely decorated, clean, and plays great music. We got seated right away. Super fast service! There's 5 sushi chefs on a Saturday lunch service and 6 service staff. I can't believe we go to Seafood City (across the street) and never came here! Only negative is one dessert per person but other than that, it was a great experience. We will definitely be recommending to everyone we know.

8nAu-jE7S1L2g82ez927KA.text: Best AYCE sushi I've ever been to. HUGE menu to choose from, everything is sooo good and fresh! Have to try The Shit, lol! My kids could not order/say that so someone else had to do it for them, ha ha.  A little inconsistent with stuff though, like the first time they charged my 12 yr old only childs price so it really was an amazing deal and was excited to go back. Went back 2 days later before had to leave Vegas and they charged him full price, that was disappointing. First time we got different flavors of mochi, another time they said we were only allowed one piece. Ugh!

iBSAQtht3FEEHTLqt1wY8w.text: Legit all you can eat sushi spot that's in a not so good area of town but totally worth it! They fresh fish and sushi is so good! Love the variety on their rolls as well as the nice mix in traditional sushi selections (nigiri or slice of fish on rice). The rice ratio is perfect, not too much so you really taste the fish and other additions they put into the rolls. They have awesome appetizers - you must order The Shit and The Pang! Both are mouthwatering! And to cap off your meal, they have a great dessert selection. Check this place out! You won't regret it!

XAaK0v1t3nnaU7dJbrKwBg.text: Probably one of my favorites for sushi now ,didnt wait long to be seated .The restaurant is spacious and clean very relax feel to it ,its family friendly and good for groups. The sushi is fresh and very flavorful. I would give it 5 stars but I've only been twice and the second time i came to eat here we got there around 9pm and they close at 11 so we figured good about of time for dinner. We were ordering a la carte but seemed like we were being a bit rushed almost couldn't enjoy my talk with my friends during dinner. But im hoping this isnt happening again next time i go. Theres alot of parking space its in the same shopping center as target. So looking for a new sushi place try it out ! I'll be back hoping to have a better experience because the food is delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sushi!!

NiVZG1ck0RAAsz0yFwccPA.text: Love this place and the vibes are always good, can't beat that AYCE deal. When go there ask for server Jeongho J. Excellent service and great personality. Everything Is what you ask for and the atmosphere Is amazing. Been to a lot of sushi places but this place has always taken care of me. Thank you guys so much and everything so fresh and nicely decorated

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My excellent waiter

ELUmv2NCKInXMhUPuYeSwA.text: The AYCE is so worth it. There's an abundance amount of choices from rolls, nigiris, appetizers, and even dessert. We mostly got nigiri and the fish was so fresh. My favorites was the salmon, albacore, and unagi. I wish I had more room to try their other items but I was stuffed. Definitely will be back for more when I'm in Vegas!

joGiBB8yoowV4P5hzVLQFg.text: *Rude Servers* *Still patronized the place despite being on Dirty Dining* ktnv.com/news/dirty-dini... My family and friends have been coming to Sakana for years. But now I am sorry to say I will never set foot in there again.We had the sever Anna throwing our orders on our table in a huff. She was slow to take our orders but quick to remind us of the 90 minute time limit! It seemed like a pain that we were there. I tried to complain and ask for the manager but she said the manger was not there. I had to remind her that we are paying customers. I am not interested in paying to be insulted and treated poorly by staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Despite being featured on Dirty Dining, I still came for the food. Too bad the staff is too rude for me to tolerate.
Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Despite being featured on Dirty Dining, I still came for the food. Too bad the staff is too rude for me to tolerate.

B4lfSUshtXwNqGJVdmIxxQ.text: Hands down the best all you can eat sushi in Las Vegas!  This place will not disappoint.  The nigiri is amazing ;)  go early or wait in line.  All the locals eat here.  It was nice to eat off the strip.  Only a 15 minute Uber.  Totally worth it if you love Japanese!!!

emS523RrE9ZgRVfqYhOw9w.text: Another review said "just go" I fully agree! I was there two days ago and about to go back tonight. I sat at the sushi bar and just asked for the chef to keep giving me the best rolls they had. IT WAS PHENOMENAL. If you're going, just one thing....take me with you!

Gm8U78ds1SNRyqxtocc1fA.text: AYCE Sushi + more food on their gigantic menu! What more can you ask for? The menu is huge and there's something for everyone...even my friend who didn't eat raw fish. We came here from Cali for my mom's birthday thru a suggestion of friends and family. Lemme tell y'all... it did not disappoint. Of course, there's a wait... BUT it's definitely worth it. The quality of the fish, uni, oysters, and anything served raw was on point and fresh so  you don't have to worry about getting sick or whatever and you have to get the dessert since it comes with AYCE. Get the black sesame thing. Delish! Our server was super attentive and came around often to make sure we are constantly ordering and everything comes out with a quickness! Highly recommend and will obviously be back when we go back to Vegas..which is often! :)

ys5cPXv1d4CrCcwE6yR0wg.text: By far one of my favorite ayce sushi restaurants. I don't mind that they have a waiting list most of the time. The service is always good and the food is great.

2hfcK8RZ-gFOx_sL14ox3w.text: Part of me doesn't want to write this review and let my new secret spot be revealed. But with all the reviews it already has I think most of Vegas, Hawaii and Cali visitors already knew. The place was packed when we went it a little after rush hour dinner but was seated within 15 minutes. The staff was on top of things and did a great job accommodating us with kids. I've been to my fair share of AYCR sushi places especially in Vegas. My past go to place was always Yamas and Goyemon. But alas they have all be dethroned and replaced. The sushi was fresh and the menu was vast. We ordered mostly nigiri but they were all delicious, not too much rice fish was served exactly as it is in Japan. I can't but say good things about the food and the staff. Will be back again and again.

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tC_dA3t6fSv2MTAzyo_iGA.text: Initially I thought this was just another non-traditional japanese restaurants. When I came in, all I saw were non-Asian waiters and chefs, and the menu had several Mexican style sushi items with strange names. BUT, when I tried some food, I went directly here to give them 5 stars.  I am not sure whether this is a Japanese-owned restaurant or not, but I believe people here try very hard to do real Japanese food. They definitely beat every fake Japanese restaurants in my home area (ie Rancho Cucamonga/ San Bernardino area). And they definitely deserve a 5-star.

q6JVTHuTw1lqp5f3oeDvMA.text: This was very enjoyable. The choices were varied and the sushi was fresh and well presented. Contrary to other all you can eat places, Sakana doesn't overwhelm patrons with rice. Be sure to go for the dinner buffet if you want to experience all of the options. The dinner options were phenomenal and leaves one hankering for another round but unfortunately diners are restricted to one serving per person which is a good strategy to ensure all diners will be able to sample throughout the night.

33NkIr0rfCPQ-PTGO9eIWg.text: Best salmon I ever had in las vegas! They give such a small portion of rice for AYCE sushi! Which means more fish! That's always wonderful! I give 4 stars, because they forgot about my entire second order. I ordered few dishes, none of them came out. Waitress lied and told me that its coming. Never came. We had to order again. Quality of food was great though!

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tQkRDmAtdxRwk_cqw4Wzdw.text: Speechless. If you come here, be prepared to wait. We waited for over 25 minutes. For a moment we thought we were skipped but it was just the party number and the table available. The food is worth the wait. We were almost hangry. The Monkey Brain roll is a MUST. Absolutely underrated and I wanted to dislike it but had to try it! I'm coming back just for it! I work on the strip as well and this is my second time here. I'm impressed even when things took a while. Give it a try if you have the time and tip well! They deserve it! Also, David is exceptional! Thank you!

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States

psl84PbqqFhV6g5Id2WWyA.text: Always consistent good food. The place is a little tight but the environment sure has that comfort feeling. Make sure you look for parking ahead since it can be crowded. Try the appetizers, will start off the meals well.   For all those who have yet visited this location, keep in mind this is not a five star restaurant. It's a okay-size sushi place. Don't pass judgement by the locations looks, instead concentrate on their food. The quality of service and the experience. You'll find Sakana to be one of those satisfying sushi places here in Las Vegas. I came once out of curiosity. I come weekly to eat and enjoy the place, and do some homework

EFBXthFxU7FpxwVgcIRHOw.text: Sakana was such an amazing dinner experience. There was a wait for this, but it wasn't too bad. You can choose between ayce or paying for each item separately. My friend and I went with ayce and honestly I am still thinking about their ebi and seared lemon salmon. Some items can only be ordered once during dinner (i.e. their delicious ebi and oysters). Their nigiri comes in sets of 2, which is great for sampling their options. Additionally, the nigiri has awesome fish to rice ratio. There was only a small ball of rice for the very generous amount of fish.

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YPkpHMqAkq1EyCMq-1qxxw.text: This the best Japanese restaurant I visited in Vegas. All foods are fresh and service are fast.  They have tons of menu to choose from, and unfortunately there is no picture from the menu. It's hard to choose you like. I give 4 stars because desserts are limited for 1 serving per costumer (buffet). Any additional order of desserts will cost  $2.50 to $3.50  per order and servings are small.

_lK4XzZ3IXXTqdyAfnph6Q.text: This place got me so stunned! The service was great not to mention the nigiri. Came here because I was craving squid nigiri after coming back from Japan. In California it's hard to find the closest replacement and I was surprised In Vegas this store was able to satisfied my cravings  the picture below is all the proof you need. I ask the waiter if I can get small slice of lemons on top of each squid nigiri and when I tasted them OMG it reminded of what I missed in Japan. Not the exact but was very close!   Price is similar to Cali, definitely come back again!

3uspRTFD7ICvCrRhwzTXvg.text: Good and delicious, this AYCE sushi joint is a delectable place to have your sushi fix satisfied.  Not too much rice, the ratio is just good so patrons don't get too full right away  and get to enjoy theur sushi and it's wonderful sauces and spieces. Chef Franco is an absolute joy and his expertise in sushi making gave us one heck of an experience.  The service is great! We were seated right away and drink orders were served without any delays and our food orders were delivered fast. Every bite had us saying: "Yummy!".  I will definitely come back and two thumbs us fron me to all of yoy.

O6wHfPeAwD55kj9jdy4ZRg.text: Good AYCE fairly priced too. My only gripe they were a bit mayo happy. Service was fast, our waiter was prompt and attentive.

rciPYgY56Jao5bwgqYddKA.text: Excellent food, service and prices. I am deducting a star because they ruin the atmosphere with exceptionally loud, irritating music that has no relation to the the theme of the venue. The lady I was with found the music and the volume thereof so offensive that she rushed through her meal and wanted to leave as quickly as possible.

glxrScEEymwzhVeUXfXlJw.text: One of our newest favorite sushi spots in Vegas thanks to a friend. They are always busy especially at dinner time, although the place is small I think it's worth the wait. They're tucked away in the corner so be sure to watch out when driving there. Their price is the same or average at all the other AYCE sushi places in Vegas. Rolls come out fairly quick & the service has been good so far. Our favorites to order as usual are super white, yellowtail, garlic tuna, tuna, Lisa Lisa, Dragon, Hawaiian, baked mussels & too many others to name. Oh & they also offer half rolls!

photos.caption: Photo of Sakana - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZHFwyD_bVFsZhAUZ1NXS1A.text: As an A.Y.C.E sushi connoisseur I would consider this one of the best if not the best in Las Vegas/Henderson.      We arrived on a Tuesday eight when they opened about 15-20 almost all the tables were filled.  Great atmosphere good service compared to others around. We waited no longer than 5 minutes to be greeted and asked if we we're ready of course we were.    Started with the lobster roll which was amazing. Then the spider roll, bacon lobster kaibab (more bacon taste couldn't taste the lobster), chicken fried rice. Now let me tell you something it was the best rice I've ever had. A few more rolls but since there were only two of us we couldn't try everything. U suggested going with a big group and just sharing everything so you get a chance to try it all.     Desert was as expected great I had the fried bananas which was great wife got the Mango Mochi. This is a great Vegas location and I see why the rating is so high. If you are looking for a new A.Y.C.E sushi ($21 for lunch $25 for dinner) look no futher.

6ImYsgvdqmYiLzDcdfF2GQ.text: Tried going here last Sunday to celebrate my grandsons' birthdays. Been here before in September. They don't take reservations Fridays-Sundays. I get it. This place is crowded. Food is good. Price is good. Staff okay.  Here's where they lost stars. Checked in to put our name down for 7 people.  They have a standard answer of 30 minutes. Didnt matter that they had a bunch of large parties before us.  But I trusted they knew what they were doing. Not so. After 30 minutes, we weren't much closer to being seated. They told my son-in-law that we have to check back every 30 minutes to see the status.  Left and went to Oyshi. No wait. Food was great. And we ended up spending  less money because unlike Sakana, they were fair in charging us for the kids. The last time we were at Sakana, they charged us the ala carte price for my grandson's multiple orders of tamago sushi. Came out to the price of an adult "All You Can Eat" price! My grandson just turned 6 years old!!!

7F3HjROklU5fV6HjbeKbgQ.text: So being so close to home and being invited by my neighbor I went for lunch yesterday.   Yes, it's True...all you can eat for 21.95 lunch ...good sushi ... I ordered 4 things the best one was tempora shrimp  very tasty   My neighbor had a salmon roll which was excellent!  And for dessert mango Mochi, which was good and a very small portion which did me just fine :).  The service was very good and the atmosphere very calming ...no restroom used.

MoMb-1Jk6_G_T4xZUayzWg.text: To start off, I have been to many sushi places, and no other place has blown my taste buds like Sakana has. For the super reasonable price of $25.95, you have access to all of the sushi your heart desires. I really recommend focusing on the nigiri because they give big pieces of fish and it tastes so fresh! My favorite are the seared lemon salmon, the super white tuna, the garlic tuna, the cajun tuna, the ocean trout, and the uni. Every single piece of fish is PACKED with flavor and each bite got me dancing in my seat. If you want to order appetizers, I recommend the shit, the pang, and the baked mussels (however, they can be pretty filling and heavy) I would skip out on the yakatori. I always crave this place and I'm so happy I found my go to sushi place. A definite MUST TRY if you're in the city!!
